en_dmt: "In the dense darkness, the thief was not able to see clearly.  "

text: सः शीघ्रं शीघ्रं वृक्षम् आरूढः।
en_dmt: "He quickly climbed the tree.  "

text: तत्र पूर्वतः विद्यमानं मधुमक्षिकाच्छत्रम् एव आभूषणपोटलीं मन्वानः सः यथा अस्पृशत्, तथा एव मधुमक्षिकाः उद्बुद्धाः, तं च सर्वथा अदंशन्।
en_dmt: "There, thinking that the beehive existing in front of him was a bundle of ornaments, as soon as he touched it, the bees awoke and stung him all over.  "

text: अनेन भूमौ पतितः चौरः यथाकथञ्चित् उत्थाय पलायितः इति।
en_dmt: "Having fallen to the ground, the thief somehow rose and fled.  "

text: पतिः पत्नीं किम् अवदत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the husband say to the wife?  "

text: चौरः तदा किम् अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the thief do then?  "

text: मधुमक्षिकाः चौरं किम् अदंशन् ?
en_dmt: "Why did the honeybees not bite the thief?  "

text: चौरः कथं पलायितः ?
en_dmt: "How did the thief escape?  "

text: युक्तिबलं कार्यं कदा साधयति ?
en_dmt: "When does the force of reasoning accomplish the effect?  "

text: मानवः कः?
en_dmt: "Who is a man (mānavaḥ)?  "

text: विना मानवतां शिक्षा, व्यर्था किं नहि वर्तते? । असहायस्य साहाय्यं, यः करोति स मानवः ॥
en_dmt: "Without humanity, is education not rendered meaningless? He who helps the helpless, is truly human.  "

text: मम मित्रस्य एकः विदेशी सहपाठी आसीत्।
en_dmt: "My friend had one foreign classmate.  "

text: एकदा सः भारतभ्रमणाय आयातः।
en_dmt: "Once, he came for a tour of India.  "

text: मम मित्रं तं सुरम्ये पर्वतीयस्थले भ्रामयितुम् अनयत्।
en_dmt: "My friend took him to wander in a beautiful mountainous place.  "

text: प्राकृतिकदृश्येषु सः अत्यन्तं मुग्धः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "He was extremely captivated by the natural scenery.  "

text: तत्र एकः वृद्धः वनचरः मिलितः।
en_dmt: "There, an old forest-dweller met [him].  "

text: भिक्षुकः इव सः किञ्चित् चेष्टते स्म।
en_dmt: "He behaved somewhat like a *bhikṣu* (mendicant, almsman).  "

text: सूपौदनयोः मूसलचन्द्रः इव तस्य उपस्थितिः अरुचिजनिका प्रतीता।
en_dmt: "His presence at the rice and soup was felt to be as unwelcome as the moon in a mortar.  "

text: कोपजिह्माननः सः सहपाठी स्वभाषया तम् अभर्त्सयत्।
en_dmt: "That classmate, his face distorted with anger, rebuked him in his own language.  "

text: निराशः सः निर्गतः।
en_dmt: "He, filled with despair, departed.  "

text: प्रत्यावर्तनकाले रात्रिः सञ्जाता आसीत्।
en_dmt: "At the time of returning, night had fallen.  "

text: सा अपि शीतकालिकी कृष्णपक्षस्य।
en_dmt: "She too [belongs to] the cold season, [to] the dark fortnight.  "

text: द्वौ अपि जनौ मार्गभ्रष्टौ अभवताम्।
en_dmt: "Both people were lost.  "

text: इतस्ततः अटन्तौ एकां कुटीं दृष्ट्वा तत्कपाटौ थपथपायितवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "Wandering here and there, having seen a hut, they knocked on its doors.  "

text: ततः एका वृद्धा स्त्री निःसृता।
en_dmt: "Then, an old woman emerged.  "

text: तां मम मित्रं स्वसमस्याम् अश्रावयत्।
en_dmt: "She made my friend listen to her problem.  "

text: सा कथितवती- "हिंसकजन्तुविशेषः अयं प्रदेशः। रात्रौ अत्र एव कुट्यां विश्रम्य प्रातः गन्तुम् अर्हतः भवन्तौ।"
en_dmt: "She said: \"This region is full of dangerous animals. You two should rest here in the hut tonight and leave in the morning.\"  "

text: विवशौ तौ तथा कृतवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "Helpless, they did so.  "

text: तया कृतम् आतिथ्यसत्कारम् अनुभूय द्वौ अपि अति सन्तुष्टौ अभूताम्।
en_dmt: "Having experienced the hospitality done by her, both were very satisfied.  "

text: प्रत्यूषसि सः एव वृद्धः वनचरः धृतमेषीदुग्धपात्रः तौ मृदुवाचा जागरयति स्म, तम् अवलोक्य विदेशिसहपाठिनः ग्रीवा लज्जया अवनता।
en_dmt: "At dawn, that same old forest dweller, holding a bowl of goat's milk, would awaken them with gentle words, and seeing him, the necks of the foreign classmates would bow down in shame.  "

text: स्वदेशं गतः सः मम मित्राय अलिखत्- "पाश्चात्यदेशाः भौतिकसम्पदा सम्पन्नाः अपि अन्धकारे एव सन्ति। भवदीयः देशः महान् अस्ति यतो हि एषः तस्य महनीयतमस्य अशिक्षितस्य भिक्षुकस्य पादयोः तिष्ठति"
en_dmt: "He went to his own country and wrote to my friend: \"Western countries, though rich in material wealth, are still in darkness. Your country is great because it lies at the feet of that most venerable, uneducated *bhikṣu* (monk).\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: विदेशी सहपाठी वृद्धं वनचरं किं मत्वा अभर्त्सयत्?
en_dmt: "Why did the foreign classmate scold the old forest dweller, thinking what?  "

text: रात्रौ मम मित्रं तस्य सहपाठिनं च का स्वकुट्याम् आवासयत्?
en_dmt: "At night, who lodged my friend and his classmate in her own house?  "

text: तौ प्रत्यूषसि कः अजागरयत्?
en_dmt: "Who awakened them at dawn?  "

text: विदेशी सहपाठी स्वदेशतः मम मित्राय किं लिखितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the foreign classmate write to my friend from his own country?  "

text: किं विना शिक्षा व्यर्था वर्तते? मानवः कः भवति?
en_dmt: "Without education, what is the use? What does it mean to be human?  "

text: सत्याः वैष्णवाः क्षमां याचन्ते
en_dmt: "The truthful devotees of Viṣṇu ask for forgiveness.  "

text: सत्या वैष्णवसन्तो हि, स्वदोषपरिशुद्धये। सङ्‌कोचं नैव कुर्वन्ति, कदापि याचितुं क्षमाम्॥
en_dmt: "Indeed, true devotees of Viṣṇu, for the purification of their own faults, never hesitate to ask for forgiveness.  "

text: 'अत्यल्पः एव समयः अवशिष्टः अस्ति, गन्तव्यं बहुदूरे वर्तते'
en_dmt: "'Very little time remains, and the place to be reached is very far away.'  "

text: इदं कस्यचित् यात्रिणः मुखात् श्रुत्वा युवकस्य मनः उद्विग्नम् अभूत्।
en_dmt: "Having heard this from the mouth of some traveler, the young man's mind became agitated.  "

text: सः आत्मानं संसारयात्रिणम् एव मत्वा चिन्तासागरे निमग्नः।
en_dmt: "Considering himself to be a traveler in saṃsāra, he was immersed in an ocean of worry (cintā-sāgara).  "

text: ततः तत्कालम् एव गृहं परित्यज्य वृन्दावनं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "Then, immediately abandoning his home, he reached Vṛndāvana.  "

text: तत्र एव मानापमानौ परित्यज्य भिक्षां याचित्वा तथा एव शरीरम् अनुपालयन्, यमुनातटे च संवसन् भगवद्ध्यानचिन्तनपरः अभूत्।
en_dmt: "There, having abandoned honor and dishonor, begging for alms, and thus maintaining his body, he lived on the bank of the Yamunā, devoted to meditating and contemplating the Blessed One.  "

text: मार्गे मिलितम् एकं साधुं यदा सः प्रणतवान्, तदा सः तं भर्त्सयन् इव तम् अकथयत् - "धूर्त्त! वैष्णवताम् अभिनयसि!"
en_dmt: "When he bowed down to a certain *sādhu* (ascetic, holy man) whom he met on the road, the *sādhu*, as if rebuking him, said to him: \"Rascal! You are feigning devotion to Viṣṇu!\"  "

text: एवम् उक्त्वा तस्मिन् निर्गते सः आत्मदोषं वारं वारं चिन्तितवान्।
en_dmt: "Having spoken thus, when he had left, he repeatedly reflected on his own faults.  "

text: सः अस्मरत् यत् एकदा सः एकं वैष्णवभक्तं कठोरवचसा अपमानितवान् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "He remembered that once he had insulted a devotee of Viṣṇu with harsh words.  "

text: अतः तम् एव क्षमां याचितुं विचार्य तद् गृहं प्रति प्रस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Therefore, resolving to ask forgiveness of him, he set out towards his house.  "

text: इदं ज्ञात्वा सः गृहस्थः सपत्नीकः यदा तम् एव द्रष्टुं मार्गे आयातः, तदा तं दृष्ट्वा एव युवकः साष्टाङ्गं प्रणिपत्य सर्वजनसमक्षं स्वदुष्कृताय क्षमाम् अयाचत।
en_dmt: "Having learned this, when that householder, together with his wife, came on the road to see him, then, having seen him, the youth prostrated himself with eight limbs touching the ground and begged forgiveness for his misdeeds in front of everyone.  "

text: गृहस्थः अपि तम् एवम् आचरन्तम् अवलोक्य भावविह्वलः तथा एव तं साष्टाङ्गं प्रणिपत्य पत्न्या सहितः तस्य चरणधूलिं स्वशिरसि धारितवान् इति।
en_dmt: "The householder, beholding him acting in this way, overwhelmed with emotion, prostrated himself before him with eight limbs touching the ground, together with his wife, and placed the dust of his feet on his own head.  "

text: युवकस्य मनः उद्विग्नं किं श्रुत्वा अभवत्? ततः सः किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "Having heard what did the young man's mind become agitated? What did he do then?  "

text: साधुः तं किं कथयित्वा अभर्त्सयत्?
en_dmt: "Did the *sādhu* rebuke him, saying what?  "

text: भर्त्सनेन युवकः किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the young man do when scolded?  "

text: गृहस्थः युवकेन सह कीदृशं व्यवहारं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What sort of behavior did the householder have with the youth?  "

text: सत्याः वैष्णवसन्तः किं कुर्वन्ति?
en_dmt: "What do true Vaiṣṇava saints do?  "

text: जीवनसारः
en_dmt: "Essence of life.  "

text: जीवनस्यैक एवास्ति, सारो भगवदाश्रयः। क्षणभङ्गुरदेहाय, तुच्छोऽस्त्यखिलसङ्ग्रहः॥
en_dmt: "The essence of life is only one: refuge in the Lord (bhagavat). For a body that is destroyed in a moment, all accumulation is worthless.  "

text: विश्वकर्मणा वारं वारं नवनवरूपे निर्मितम् अपि सर्वसुखसुविधासम्पन्नम् अनुपमं भवनं महेन्द्राय यदा नैव अरोचत, तदा खिन्नमनाः विश्वकर्मा विष्णुम् उपगत्य समस्यासमाधानं पर्यपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "When Viśvakarmā, again and again, built an unparalleled palace endowed with all comforts and conveniences for Mahendra, but it did not please him, then, with a distressed mind, Viśvakarmā approached Viṣṇu and inquired about a solution to the problem.  "

text: मायापतिः तम् आश्वास्य न्यवर्तयत्।
en_dmt: "The lord of *māyā*, having consoled him, turned him back.  "

text: पुनः एकः वटुकः महेन्द्रम् आसाद्य तस्य भवनं प्रशंसन् पृष्टवान्- "इदं निर्मातुं कति विश्वकर्माणः श्रमं कृतवन्तः?"
en_dmt: "Again, a certain young student, approaching Mahendra, and praising his palace, asked: \"How many *viśvakarmas* (artisans) labored to build this?\"  "

text: साश्चर्यं सगर्वं च महेन्द्रः उदतरत्- "विश्वकर्मा तु एकः एव।"
en_dmt: "With astonishment and pride, Mahendra replied: \"Viśvakarmā is truly one and only.\"  "

text: वटुकः प्रत्यवदत्- "न केवलं विश्वकर्मा एव, अपि तु महेन्द्रब्रह्मविष्णुमहेशाः अपि अनन्ताः सन्ति।"
en_dmt: "The young boy replied: \"Not only Viśvakarmā, but also Mahendra, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Maheśa are infinite.\"  "

text: एवम् उक्त्वा सः उच्चैः हसितवान्।
en_dmt: "Having said this, he laughed loudly.  "

text: पुनः महेन्द्रेण हसनस्य कारणे पृष्टे सः एकं बृहत्पिपीलदलं दर्शयन् कथितवान्- "देवराज! पश्यतु, अस्मिन् दले सर्वेऽपि पिपीलकाः प्राक्तनाः महेन्द्राः एव सन्ति। कर्मवशात् एव ते इमां योनिं प्राप्तवन्तः।"
en_dmt: "Again, when Mahendra asked the reason for the laughter, he, showing a large line of ants, said: \"O Lord of the Gods! Behold, in this line, all the ants are former Mahendras. By the power of their *karma* (actions), they have attained this birth.\"  "

text: अस्मिन् एव अन्तराले कश्चित् तेजस्वी जनः तत्र उपस्थितः।
en_dmt: "In that very interval, a certain radiant person appeared there.  "

text: महेन्द्रः तं यथाविधि पूजितवान्।
en_dmt: "Mahendra worshipped him properly.  "

text: तस्य शिरसि एकः वेत्रकटः वक्षसि च भूयान् लोमराशिः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "On his head was one cane basket, and on his chest was a great mass of hair.  "

text: वटुकेन पृष्टः सः आत्मानं लोमशम् ऋषिं ब्रह्मणः द्विपरार्धान्तम् आयुष्मन्तं पर्यचाययत्, सह एव च इदम् अपि अकथयत् यत्- "एकस्मिन् इन्द्रे गते तस्य एकं लोम उन्मूलितं भवति, आयुषः अस्थिरत्वात् तेन न विवाहः कृतः, न च निवासार्थं काचित् कुटी एव निर्मिता, शीतातपवर्षाभ्यः सुरक्षार्थं शिरसि उक्तः वेत्रकटः धार्यते। नश्वरशरीरस्य शृङ्गारार्थं किम् अनावश्यकः संग्रहः क्रियेत? सर्वथा भगवद्भक्तिः एव जीवनसारः इति मत्वा नित्यं तत्र भगवति रम्यते"
en_dmt: "The boy was asked, and he introduced himself as the sage Lomasa, whose life extends to two *parārdhas* of Brahmā. He also said this: \"When one Indra passes away, one hair of his is uprooted. Because of the impermanence of life, he has not married, nor has he built any hut for dwelling. The stated cane mat is worn on the head for protection from cold, heat, and rain. Why should unnecessary accumulation be done for the adornment of the perishable body? Thinking that devotion to the Lord is the essence of life, he always delights in that Lord.\"  "

text: इति उक्त्वा निर्गते ऋषौ वटुकः अपि निरगच्छत्।
en_dmt: "When the sage had gone out, saying this, the brahmacharin also went out.  "

text: ततः ऋषिवचनं भूयो भूयः चिन्तयन् मन्यमानः  च महेन्द्रः अपि विरक्तः भूत्वा प्रासादनिर्माणं व्यरमयत् विश्वकर्माणम् च दानमानादिना परितोष्य व्यसृजत् इति।
en_dmt: "Thereafter, Mahendra, repeatedly reflecting on and considering the words of the Ṛṣi, also becoming detached, stopped the construction of the palace, and, having fully satisfied Viśvakarman with gifts, honors, etc., dismissed him.  "

text: विश्वकर्मा विष्णुं किं अपृच्छत् ?
en_dmt: "What did Viśvakarmā ask Viṣṇu?  "

text: वटुके महेन्द्रे च कीदृशं प्रश्नोत्तरम् अभवत् ?
en_dmt: "What kind of question and answer (praśnottaram) took place between Vaṭuka and Mahendra?  "

text: लोमशः आत्मानं कस्मिन् रूपे पर्यचाययत् ?
en_dmt: "In what form did Lomaśa introduce himself?  "

text: अस्य महेन्द्रे कीदृशः प्रभावः अभवत् ?
en_dmt: "What kind of power did this Mahendra have?  "

text: जीवनस्य सारः कस्मिन् अस्ति ?
en_dmt: "What is the essence of life?  "

text: प्रासादाः पथिकगृहाणि
en_dmt: "Palaces and travelers' lodgings.  "

text: महामहान्तः प्रासादाः, यात्रिविश्रामभूमयः। यत्राऽऽयान्ति ततो यान्ति, न तिष्ठन्ति जनाः स्थिराः॥
en_dmt: "Great and grand are the palaces, resting places for travelers, Where people come and go, but do not stay permanently.  "

text: राजसभायां विराजमानः महाराजः यदा अशृणोत् यत् कश्चित् तत्र आयातुम् इच्छति, परन्तु द्वारपालः तं निषेधति तदा द्वयोः विवादं श्रुत्वा महाराजः द्वारपालं तं जनम् उपस्थापयितुम् आदिष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "When the great king, seated in the royal assembly (rājasabhā), heard that someone wished to come there, but the doorkeeper (dvārapālaḥ) was forbidding him, then, having heard the dispute between the two, the great king ordered the doorkeeper to present that person.  "

text: महाराजः आगन्तुकम् आगमनस्य कारणम् अपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "The great king asked the newcomer the reason for his arrival.  "

text: सः कथितवान् "महाराज! अहं परदेशी अस्मि। अस्मिन् पथिकगृहे किञ्चित् विश्रमितुम् इच्छामि।"
en_dmt: "He said: \"Great king! I am a foreigner. I wish to rest a little in this traveler's house.\"  "

text: महाराजः पृष्टवान् "हुँ, इदं तु मम गृहम्। पथिकगृहं कथम्? "
en_dmt: "The great king asked, \"Indeed, this is my house. How [can it be] a traveler's house?\"  "

text: आगन्तुकः अकथयत्  "पूर्वं यदा भवान् अत्र न आसीत् तदा कः आसीत्? "
en_dmt: "The visitor said, \"Who were you before, when you were not here?\"  "

text: महाराजः उक्तवान् "तदा मम पिता आसीत्।"
en_dmt: "The great king said, \"Then he was my father.\"  "

text: आगन्तुकः अपृच्छत्-  "सः कुत्र अस्ति?"
en_dmt: "The visitor asked, \"Where is he?\"  "

text: महाराजः अभाषत- "सः तु देवलोकं गतः।"
en_dmt: "The great king spoke: \"But he has gone to the world of the gods (devaloka).\"  "

text: आगन्तुकः अब्रवीत्  "अतः एव तु यत् भवान् स्वगृहं कथयति तद् अहं पथिकगृहं कथयामि। अत्र भवतः पिता इव पितामहप्रपितामहादयः यथा आगत्य गताः, तथा भवान् अपि गमिष्यति। अतः पथिकगृहम् एव इदम् अभवत्। स्वगृहं तु तद् भवति यतः कदापि निर्गमनं न भवति"
en_dmt: "The newcomer said: \"Therefore, because you call it your own house, I call it a traveler's house. Here, just as your father, grandfather (pitāmaha), great-grandfathers (prapitāmaha), and others came and went, so too will you go. Therefore, this has become just a traveler's house. Your own house is that from which there is never any departure.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: महाराजं पथिकः किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the traveler say to the great king (mahārāja)?  "

text: किं महाराजः पथिकस्य कथनेन स्वप्रासादं पथिकगृहम् अमन्यत?
en_dmt: "\"O great king, did you consider your own palace to be a traveler's home because of the traveler's words?\"  "

text: स्वगृहं कीदृशं भवति?
en_dmt: "What is one's own home like?  "

text: किं पथिकगृहं पथिकस्य स्थायिगृहं भवति?
en_dmt: "Is a traveler's inn a permanent dwelling for the traveler?  "

text: इयं कथा कीदृशं सन्देशं ददाति?
en_dmt: "What message does this story give?  "

text: वीरशिवाजिः
en_dmt: "Heroic Shivaji  "

text: मातृवत् परदाराभिः, व्यवहरन्ति ये जनाः । वीरशिवाजितुल्यास्ते, दुर्लभाः सन्ति साम्प्रतम् ॥
en_dmt: "Those people who treat the wives of others as mothers, like the brave Śivājī, are difficult to find these days.  "

text: महाराष्ट्रकेसरी वीरशिवाजिः स्वविश्वासपात्रैः कैश्चित् जनैः सह सभाकक्षे मन्त्रणां कुर्वन् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The Maharashtrian lion, the brave Śivājī, was in the assembly hall, holding counsel with some of his trusted men.  "

text: सहसा द्वारपालः प्रविश्य शिरः विनमय्य प्रणामं कुर्वन् निवेदितवान् - "महाराज! आर्यसेनापतिमहाशयः द्वारि उपस्थितः श्रीमन्तं भवन्तं च द्रष्टुम् इच्छति।"
en_dmt: "Suddenly, the doorkeeper, entering, bowing his head, and offering a respectful greeting, reported: \"Your Majesty! The esteemed Āryasenāpati Mahāśaya is standing at the gate, wishing to see you and the fortunate one.\"  "

text: "आम् आम्, प्रवेश्यतां सः। किमर्थं विलम्ब्यते? अत्र तस्य एव प्रतीक्षा अस्ति।"
en_dmt: "\"Yes, yes, let him be brought in. Why is there a delay? Here, we are waiting for him.\"  "

text: शिवाजिः अनुमतिं दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Śivājī gave permission.  "

text: सेनापतिः प्रविश्य साभिवादनं कथितवान् - "विजयतां विजयतां महाराष्ट्रकेसरी। शत्रुदलं महावायुना मेघदलम् इव सर्वथा उच्छिन्नम् अस्माकं सेनया। ततः अस्माभिः श्रीमद्भवत्प्रसादार्थम् एकं बहुमूल्यं वस्तु आनीतम्। आज्ञा यदि दीयेत तर्हि अत्र एव प्रस्तुत्य सर्वसमक्षं समर्प्येत श्रीमते भवते।"
en_dmt: "The commander-in-chief, having entered and greeted respectfully, said: \"May the great lion of Maharashtra be victorious! The enemy force has been completely destroyed by our army, like a mass of clouds by a great wind. Therefore, a very valuable object has been brought by us for your gracious pleasure. If permission is given, then it may be presented here and offered to your highness in front of everyone.\"  "

text: "आम् आम्, का हानिः इह?"
en_dmt: "\"Yes, yes, what harm is there here?\"  "

text: शिवाजिः आज्ञापितवान्।
en_dmt: "Śivājī commanded.  "

text: तस्मिन् अन्यजनेषु च तद् वस्तु द्रष्टुं महती उत्सुकता आसीत्।
en_dmt: "In that, and in other people, there was great eagerness to see that object.  "

text: सेनापतिः एकां सुन्दरीं युवतिं आदाय उपस्थितः।
en_dmt: "The commander arrived, bringing a single beautiful young woman.  "

text: युवतिः अवनतमुखी सङ्‌कोचशीला भयेन कम्पमाना च अवर्तत।
en_dmt: "The young woman, her face downcast, shy, and trembling with fear, turned away. (yuvatiḥ avanatamukhī saṅkocaśīlā bhayena kampamānā ca avartata)  "

text: क्रोधेन रक्तमुखः शिवाजिः सेनापतिं घोरशब्दैः विनिन्दन् भर्त्सयन् च कथितवान् - "अरे! इदं किं दुष्कर्म कृतं युष्माभिः? न एतद् म्लेच्छराज्यम्। अविलम्बम् एव इदानीम् इमां बहुसम्मानसहितां स्वकीयस्थानं प्रापयतु।"
en_dmt: "Śivāji, his face red with anger, rebuking and scolding the commander with terrible words, said: \"Hey! What evil deed (duṣkarma) has been done by you? This is not a kingdom of barbarians (mleccharājyam). Without delay, bring her with great respect to her own place now.\"  "

text: पुनः युवतिं प्रति हस्तौ निबध्य सविनयम् अभाषत - "मातः! क्षम्यतां मे भ्रष्टमतेः सेनापतेः अस्य अयं घोरापराधः। भवती मत्पक्षतः सर्वथा निर्भया भवतु। अयं सद्यः एव भवतीं स्वजनेषु प्रापयिष्यति। सानन्दं तिष्ठतु तत्र भवती।"
en_dmt: "Again, having folded his hands towards the young woman, he spoke politely: \"Mother! May this terrible offense of this general, whose mind is corrupted, be forgiven by you. May you be completely fearless from my side. He will immediately bring you to your own people. May you happily remain there.\"  "

text: अतीव सन्तुष्टाः जनाः उच्चैः उच्चैः जयजयकारं कर्तुं प्रवृत्ताः - "महाराजः वीरशिवाजिः विजयताम्, महाराष्ट्रकेसरी शिवाजिः विजयताम्"
en_dmt: "The people, greatly pleased, began to shout loudly cries of \"Victory! Victory!\"—\"May the great king, the brave Śivājī, be victorious! May Śivājī, the Lion of Maharashtra, be victorious!\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: वीरशिवाजितुल्याः जनाः कीदृशाः भवन्ति ?
en_dmt: "What are people like Vīraśiva and Ajita like?  "

text: सेनापतिः शिवाजिं साभिवादनं किं कथितवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did the commander tell Śivājī with greetings?  "

text: सेनापतिः किं वस्तु आदाय उपस्थितः ?
en_dmt: "What object has the general brought?  "

text: शिवाजिः सेनापतिं भर्त्सयन् किं कथितवान् ? युवतिं प्रति च किम् अभाषत ?
en_dmt: "What did Śivājī say, rebuking the commander? And what did he say to the young woman?  "

text: इयं कथा कां शिक्षां ददाति ?
en_dmt: "What lesson does this story teach?  "

text: अनिष्टचिन्तकस्य कुशलं न
en_dmt: "Good does not befall one who thinks ill (of others).  "

text: योऽन्यस्मै खनते खातं, तस्मै कूपः स्थितः पुरः। चिन्तयन्तौ मिथोऽनिष्टं, नष्टौ द्वौ सुहृदौ न किम्?॥
en_dmt: "He who digs a pit for another, a well stands before him. Are not two friends destroyed, thinking evil of each other?  "

text: धनोपार्जनार्थं देशान्तरं गच्छतोः द्वयोः मित्रयोः हस्ते नगरसमीपे एव वने भूमौ सुरक्षितः एकः बहुमूल्यरत्नपूर्णः कलशः लग्नः।
en_dmt: "While two friends were going to another country to earn wealth (dhanopārjana), a pot (kalaśaḥ) full of very valuable jewels (ratna) was found by them in a forest near the city, safely buried in the ground.  "

text: सुदूरं पदयात्रया तयोः उदरे उन्दुराः कूर्दितुं प्रावर्तन्त ।
en_dmt: "Having traveled a great distance on foot, mice began to jump in their stomachs.  "

text: 'तयोः एकः नगरे गत्वा पक्वान्नम् आनयतु, अन्यः च पृष्ठे तत्र स्थित्वा कलशस्य रक्षां करोतु'
en_dmt: "\"Let one of you go to the city and bring cooked food, and let the other stay there behind and guard the pot (kalaśa).\"  "

text: इदं द्वाभ्यां विचार्य तथा एव कृतम्।
en_dmt: "This was considered by two people and done accordingly.  "

text: नगरं गतः सुहृद् पूर्वम् उदरपूरं मिष्टान्नं भक्षितवान्, पुनः ततः वनस्थाय अपि मिष्टान्नम् आदाय आगच्छतः तस्य मनसि विचारः आयातः यत् 'यदि मित्रं म्रियते तर्हि सम्पूर्णः कलशः तस्य एव अधिकारे स्यात्'
en_dmt: "The friend who went to the city had previously eaten his fill of sweets. Then, as he was coming back from there, taking sweets for the hermit in the forest as well, the thought came to his mind: 'If my friend dies, then the entire pot will be in my possession.'  "

text: इदं विचार्य सः मिष्टान्ने विषम् अमेलयत्।
en_dmt: "Having considered this, he mixed poison in the sweets.  "

text: तत्र वनस्थः सुहृद् अपि विचारयति स्म यत् 'अहं तं मारयित्वा अस्य कलशस्य एकाकी स्वामी भविष्यामि।'
en_dmt: "There, even the friend living in the forest considered, \"I will kill him and become the sole owner of this pot.\"  "

text: मिष्टान्नम् आदाय आगतं मित्रं सः छुरिकाप्रहारेण मारितवान्।
en_dmt: "He killed the friend who had come bringing sweets with a stab of a knife.  "

text: पश्चात् प्रसन्नः सः बुभुक्षातुरः मिष्टान्नं भक्षित्वा विषप्रभावेण स्वयम् अपि मृतः।
en_dmt: "Afterwards, delighted, he, tormented by hunger, having eaten the sweet food, himself also died from the effect of the poison.  "

text: जडः कलशः तु तत्र एव स्थितः आसीत् इति।
en_dmt: "The inert pot was indeed staying right there.  "

text: द्वयोः मित्रयोः हस्ते किं लग्नः?
en_dmt: "What is stuck to the hands of the two friends?  "

text: तयोः एकं मित्रं किं विचारितवत् किं च कृतवत्?
en_dmt: "What did one friend of those two consider, and what did he do?  "

text: अन्येन मित्रेण किं विचारितं किं च कृतम्?
en_dmt: "What has been considered and what has been done by another friend?  "

text: अस्य परिणामः कीदृशः अभवत्?
en_dmt: "What was the nature of its transformation?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: कल्पनालोके विचरणकर्ता
en_dmt: "One who wanders in the world of imagination.  "

text: विचरन् कल्पनालोके, जनो वेत्ति न तत्फलम्। वर्तमानं स्वकीयं स, विकरोति स्वहस्ततः॥
en_dmt: "Wandering in a world of imagination, a person does not know its fruit. He spoils his own present with his own hand.  "

text: द्वौ सुहृदौ वादिप्रतिवादिरूपे न्यायं प्राप्तुं न्यायाधीशसमक्षे उपस्थितौ कथितवन्तौ च- "श्रीमन्! आवाम् एकदा उपविष्टौ स्वं स्वं विचारं प्रकटितवन्तौ यत् '
en_dmt: "Two friends, in the form of plaintiff and defendant, having approached the judge to obtain justice, said: \"O Honorable One! We, having once sat down, expressed our own views, namely that...\"  "

text: अहं क्षेत्रं क्रेष्यामि।
en_dmt: "I will buy the field (kṣetra).  "

text: ' ततः अयं '
en_dmt: "Then this.  "

text: महिषीं क्रेतुं कथितवान्।
en_dmt: "He told [someone] to buy the *mahiṣī*.  "

text: ' मया एषः निषिद्धः यत् '
en_dmt: "I forbade him from that.  "

text: ते महिषी मम क्षेत्रे प्रविश्य कृषिं भक्षयिष्यति, अतः त्वं महिषीं मा क्रीणीहि।
en_dmt: "Those female buffaloes will enter my field and eat the crops; therefore, do not buy the female buffaloes.  "

text: ' अयम् अकथयत् -'
en_dmt: "He said:  "

text: किं न क्रेष्यामि? त्वं एव क्षेत्रं मा क्रीणीहि।
en_dmt: "Will I not buy? You alone should not buy the field.  "

text: ' अहम् अपि उत्तेजितः भूत्वा कृष्णाङ्गारेण तत्कालम् एव भूमौ क्षेत्रसीमाम् अङ्‌कित्वा कथितवान्- '
en_dmt: "I, too, being agitated, immediately marked the field boundary on the ground with charcoal and said:  "

text: पश्य, इदं क्षेत्रम् अहं क्रीतवान् अस्मि।
en_dmt: "Look, I have bought this field.  "

text: ' अयम् अपि पुनः मम क्षेत्रे महिषीम् अङ्‌कित्वा प्रोक्तवान्- '
en_dmt: "'This one, again, having marked the female buffalo in my field, said:'  "

text: इयं मे महिषी तव क्षेत्रे प्रविष्टा।
en_dmt: "This is my queen who has entered your field.  "

text: कुरु इदानीं यद् इच्छसि।
en_dmt: "Do now what you wish. (kuru idānīṃ yad icchasi)  "

text: ' क्रुद्धः अहम् अस्य शिरः स्फोटितवान् अयं च मम। महाराज! दण्डनीयं भवान् एव दण्डयतु।"
en_dmt: "“Being angry, I smashed his head, and he did the same to me.  O great king! You alone should punish the one who deserves punishment.”  "

text: न्यायाधीशः तयोः मूर्खतायाम् उपहसन् आसीत् इति।
en_dmt: "The judge was laughing at their foolishness.  "

text: द्वौ सुहृदौ न्यायाधीशस्य समक्षे किमर्थम् उपस्थितौ ?
en_dmt: "Why are two friends present before the judge?  "

text: तौ स्वं स्वं पक्षं कीदृशं प्रस्तुतवन्तौ ?
en_dmt: "How did they each present their own side/argument?  "

text: न्यायाधीशः तयोः कथनं श्रुत्वा किं कुर्वन् आसीत् ?
en_dmt: "What was the judge doing after hearing their statements?  "

text: कल्पनालोके विचरणकर्ता किं तत्फलं जानाति ?
en_dmt: "Does the one wandering in the world of imagination know that result?  "

text: कल्पनालोके विचरणेन किं भवति ?
en_dmt: "What is the result of wandering in the world of imagination (kalpanāloke)?  "

text: आर्जवं हि कुटिलेषु न नीतिः
en_dmt: "Indeed, straightforwardness is not a wise policy among the crooked.  "

text: धूर्तेन धूर्तता कार्या, तत्र दोषो न कश्चन। शठेन शठताकारी, शठेन वञ्च्यते नहि॥
en_dmt: "A rogue should be treated roguishly; there is no fault in that. One who acts deceitfully is deceived by a deceitful person; he is not deceived by an honest person.  "

text: मम प्रतिवेशी सम्पन्नः तु बहुः अस्ति, किन्तु कृपणः अपि ततः न्यूनः न।
en_dmt: "My neighbor is very wealthy, but he is no less miserly than that.  "

text: समाचारपत्रं तु क्रीत्वा पठनं तस्य स्वाभावे एव न वर्तते।
en_dmt: "But buying and reading a newspaper is not in his nature.  "

text: मत्तः एव याचित्वा सः पठति।
en_dmt: "Having begged from me, he reads.  "

text: प्रतिदिनं याचनायां सङ्‌कोचम् अनुभवन् सः समाचारपत्रं समाचारपत्रवितरकात् एव गृह्णाति।
en_dmt: "Every day, feeling embarrassed to ask, he takes the newspaper from the newspaper deliverer himself.  "

text: पुनः कदाचित् पठितं मह्यं ददाति, कदाचित् च नैव अपि।
en_dmt: "Again, sometimes he gives me what has been recited, and sometimes he does not give it at all.  "

text: अहं तस्य व्यवहारेण अति खिन्नः आसम्।
en_dmt: "I was very upset by his behavior.  "

text: अतः यदा  वितरकः मासान्ते समाचारपत्रस्य मूल्यं माम् अयाचत, तदा अहं तं प्रतिवेशिनः एव ग्रहीतुं प्रेरितवान्।
en_dmt: "Therefore, when the distributor asked me for the monthly cost of the newspaper, I encouraged him to collect it from the neighbor.  "

text: अनेन रुष्टः प्रतिवेशी माम् उपागत्य मां मूल्यं दातुं बाध्यं कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Angered by this, the neighbor came to me and forced me to pay the price.  "

text: अहं तु विनम्रतया तं प्रत्यवदम् "महाशय! समाचारपत्रस्य ग्राहकः तु भवान् एव। अहं तु प्रतिवेशितया भवन्तं याचित्वा पठामि। तद् अहं मूल्यं किं दद्याम्?"
en_dmt: "But I replied to him humbly, \"O large-hearted one! You are the subscriber to the newspaper. But I, as a neighbor, read it by requesting it from you. So what price should I give?\"  "

text: सः मम इदम् उत्तरं श्रुत्वा कुपितः तु अतीव अभूत्, मूल्यम् अपि सः एव अनिच्छन् दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Having heard my answer, he became extremely angry, and unwillingly, he himself gave the price.  "

text: परन्तु अग्रे याचित्वा पठनस्य तस्य कुप्रवृत्तिः विलुप्ता इति।
en_dmt: "However, his bad habit of begging and reciting [scriptures] will be eliminated in the future.  "

text: मम प्रतिवेशी कीदृशः अस्ति? किं च करोति स्म?
en_dmt: "What is my neighbor like? And what does he do?  "

text: अहं खिन्नः भूत्वा ततः किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "Being weary, what did I do then?  "

text: प्रतिवेशी मां किं कर्तुं बाध्यम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "Why did the neighbor force me to do it?  "

text: अहं तदा तं किं प्रत्यवदम्?
en_dmt: "What did I answer him then?  "

text: मम उत्तरेण सः किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did he do with my answer?  "

text: शारीरकश्रमः स्थौल्यनाशकः
en_dmt: "Bodily exertion destroys obesity.  "

text: शारीरिकः श्रमोऽवश्यं, करणीयः सदैव हि। स्थौल्यं नोत्पद्यतेऽनेन, शरीरं स्याच्च कार्यकृत्॥
en_dmt: "Physical exertion is definitely always to be done, for obesity does not arise from this, and the body becomes efficient.  "

text: आसीत् एकः श्रेष्ठी।
en_dmt: "There was a wealthy merchant.  "

text: कर्मचारिणः एव तस्य सर्वं कार्यं कुर्वन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "Indeed, all the work for him was done by the *karmacāriṇas* (those assigned to tasks).  "

text: सः नित्यं पौष्टिकम् आहारं सेवते स्म, परन्तु शारीरिकश्रमात् दूरे पलायते स्म।
en_dmt: "He always partook of nutritious food, but he always avoided physical labor.  "

text: अनेन तस्य शरीरे स्थूलता आयाता।
en_dmt: "Because of this, his body became stout.  "

text: चलने भ्रमणे अपि सः असुविधाम् अनुभवति स्म।
en_dmt: "Even in walking and wandering, he experienced discomfort.  "

text: अन्ते स्वनगरे एव निवासिनम् एकं सुप्रसिद्धं चिकित्सकम् उपगत्य सः आत्मीयां व्यथां श्रावितवान् उपचारं च पृष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "Finally, he approached a very famous physician living in his own city, and told him of his suffering and asked for treatment.  "

text: चिकित्सकः तं परामृष्टवान् "अधुना अग्रे दशरूप्यकैः एव एकमासपर्यन्तं स्वीया आहारव्यवस्था करणीया। किन्तु इदम् अवश्यं ध्याने रक्षणीयं यत् तानि दशरूप्यकाणि आत्मीयेन शीरीरिकश्रमेण उपार्जितानि एव भवेयुः"
en_dmt: "The doctor examined him and said, \"Now, for the next month, you must manage your diet with only ten rupees per day. But this must be kept in mind that those ten rupees must be earned by your own physical labor.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: श्रेष्ठिनः शरीरे स्थूलता कथम् आयाता?
en_dmt: "How did the merchant's body become so stout?  "

text: श्रेष्ठी चिकित्सकस्य समीपे किं गतवान्‌?
en_dmt: "Why did the merchant go to the doctor?  "

text: चिकित्सकः श्रेष्ठिने कीदृशं परामर्शं दत्तवान्?
en_dmt: "What kind of advice did the doctor give to the merchant?  "

text: शरीरे स्थूलता कदा उत्पन्ना न भवति?
en_dmt: "When does grossness not arise in the body?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: लिखितं सुस्थिरं सदा
en_dmt: "Always written firmly.  "

text: उच्छलन्तो विचाराश्चेल्लिख्यन्ते सत्वरं स्वयम्। तर्हि ते सुस्थिरा भूत्वा जायन्ते राष्ट्रसम्पदः॥
en_dmt: "If surging thoughts are quickly written down by oneself, then they, becoming stable, become the wealth of the nation.  "

text: एकदा कविराजं द्रष्टुम् तस्य सुहृत् प्रातः तस्य गृहम् अगच्छत्।
en_dmt: "Once, a friend of Kaviraja went to his house in the morning to see him.  "

text: ततः इदं ज्ञात्वा यत् 'सः तु रात्रौ भुक्त्वा पीत्वा गृहात् किञ्चित् दूरे एव स्वसम्बन्धिनः इन्धनविपणौ गतः'
en_dmt: "Then, having learned that \"he, indeed, having eaten and drunk at night, went only a little distance from the house to the fuel shop of his relative,\"  "

text: तत्र एव अगमत्।
en_dmt: "There, indeed, he went.  "

text: तत्र तेन दृष्टं यत् सः खट्वायां सुप्तः अस्ति।
en_dmt: "There, it was seen by him that he was sleeping on the bed.  "

text: यदा मित्रं तस्य आवरणम् अपसारयितुं प्रावर्तत, तदा कविराजः कथितवान् - "नहि नहि, एवं मा कुरु। पूर्वं मम गृहतः पादयामम् आनय। अहं सर्वथा नग्नः अस्मि।"
en_dmt: "When his friend began to remove the covering from him, the poet said, \"No, no, do not do that. First, bring my slippers from my house. I am completely naked (sarvathā nagnaḥ asmi).\"  "

text: सहृत् तथा एव कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "The kind-hearted one did just that.  "

text: पादायामं परिधाय नग्नतायाः कारणं कविराजः एवम् अकथयत् - "मित्रवर! त्वं तु जानासि एव, यदा मस्तिष्के कविताः उच्छलन्ति, तदा अहं न दिनं पश्यामि न च रात्रिम्। तत्कालम् एव ताः लिपिबद्धाः कर्तुं प्रवृत्तः भवामि। यदि एवं न करोमि, तर्हि ताः विलुप्यन्ते। रात्रौ अत्र आगतस्य अपि मे एवम् एव अभवत्। इन्धनविक्रेतुः तु गृहगमनसमयः सञ्जातः आसीत्। सः माम् अत्र एव एकाकिनं त्यक्त्वा निर्गतः। तदा मम इतः कविताः आयान्ति स्म, ततः च लेखनाय प्रकाशाभावः कष्टं ददाति स्म। अन्ते धीरं धीरं शरीरात् सर्वाणि एव वस्त्राणि अवतार्य प्रकाशार्थं तेषां क्रमशः उपयोगं कृतवान्। पश्य, तेषां ज्वलनप्रकाशे यद् लिखितं, तद् अत्र त्वाम् एव श्रावयितुं सुरक्षितवान् अस्मि।"
en_dmt: "The poet-king, regarding the length of his feet [used as clothing] and the reason for his nakedness, said thus: \"Dear friend! You know, when poems surge in my brain, then I see neither day nor night. At that very moment, I become engaged in writing them down. If I do not do so, then they are lost. The same thing happened to me even when I came here at night. It was time for the fuel seller to go home. He left me here alone and departed. Then poems were coming to me from here, and the lack of light for writing was causing distress. In the end, slowly, slowly, I took off all the clothes from my body and used them one by one for light. Look, what was written in the light of their burning, I have kept it safe here to recite to you.\"  "

text: सुहृद् अपृच्छत् - "अत्र इन्धनस्थितौ अपि प्रकाशार्थम् इन्धनस्य उपयोगः त्वया कथं न कृतः?"
en_dmt: "A friend asked, \"Why haven't you used the fuel for light, even though the fuel is here?\"  "

text: कविराजः खेदं प्रकटयन् उदतरत् - "अरे! इदं तु तदा अहं सर्वथा विस्मृतवान् एव आसम्।"
en_dmt: "The poet-king, expressing sorrow, replied: \"Alas! I had completely forgotten this at that time.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: कविराजः सुहृदं कदा किं कथितवान् ?
en_dmt: "When did the poet-king tell his friend what?  "

text: सहृद् तं तदा किम् अपृच्छत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the kind-hearted one ask him then?  "

text: कविराजः सुहृदः प्रश्नस्य किम् उत्तरं दत्तवान् ?
en_dmt: "What answer did the poet-king, the friend, give to the question?  "

text: विचाराणां लेखनेन किं भवति ?
en_dmt: "What is accomplished by writing down thoughts?  "

text: अनया कथया का शिक्षा मिलति ?
en_dmt: "What lesson is learned from this story?  "

text: सत्यः पत्रः, सत्यं धनं च
en_dmt: "A true letter, and true wealth.  "

text: निर्वहेत् पुत्रधर्मं यः, पुत्रः स एव वस्तुतः । येन पुण्यम् भवेन्नित्यं, तदेव धनिनो धनम् ॥
en_dmt: "He who fulfills the duty of a son (putradharma), he alone is truly a son. That by which merit (puṇyam) is constantly obtained, that alone is the wealth of the wealthy.  "

text: एकदा वाराणस्यां लब्धनाम्नः श्रेष्ठिनः कार्यालये एकः महान् तपस्वी महात्मा उपस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Once, in Vāraṇāsī, in the office of a merchant named Labdhanāman, a great ascetic, a *mahātmā* (great soul), appeared.  "

text: श्रेष्ठी तं प्रणम्य बहु सम्मानितवान्, तस्य भोजनव्यवस्थां च कारयितुम् उपरि स्वावासे पत्न्याः समीपे गतः।
en_dmt: "The merchant, having bowed to him, greatly honored him, and, in order to arrange for his food, went up to his own residence, to [his] wife.  "

text: इतः महात्मा श्रेष्ठिनः पुत्राणां संख्यां धनराशिसंख्यां च मुख्यलिपिकात् ज्ञातवान्।
en_dmt: "From this, the great man learned the number of the sons of the eminent merchant and the amount of the treasure from the chief scribe.  "

text: तदनुसारं पुत्राः पञ्च, धनं च पञ्चलक्षमितम् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "According to that, there were five sons and wealth of five hundred thousand.  "

text: नीचैः आगत्य श्रेष्ठी महात्मानं भोजनं कारयितुम् उपरि नीतवान्।
en_dmt: "Having come down, the merchant led the great-souled one upstairs to offer him food.  "

text: भोजनं परिवेष्य श्रेष्ठी भगवत्प्रसादं प्राप्तुं सप्रणामं महात्मानं न्यवेदयत्।
en_dmt: "Having served the food, the wealthy merchant respectfully requested the great soul in order to obtain the grace of the Lord (bhagavatprasāda).  "

text: महात्मा पृष्टवान्- "श्रेष्ठिन्! भोजनं पश्चात् करिष्ये। प्रथमं कथयतु, भवतः पुत्राः कियन्तः सन्ति?"
en_dmt: "The great being asked: \"O merchant! I will eat later. First tell me, how many sons do you have?\"  "

text: श्रेष्ठी उदतरत्- "महाराज! एकः पुत्रः।"
en_dmt: "The merchant replied: \"Great king! I have one son.\"  "

text: महात्मा अकथयत्- "भवतः मुख्यलिपिकः तु पञ्च पुत्रान् कथयति।"
en_dmt: "The great soul said: \"Your chief clerk speaks of five sons.\"  "

text: श्रेष्ठी उदतरत्- द्वयम् अपि सत्यम्।
en_dmt: "The merchant said: Both are true.  "

text: पञ्चसु पुत्रेषु विद्यमानेषु अपि एकः एव पुत्रधर्मं निर्वहति।
en_dmt: "Even though five sons existed, only one son fulfilled the duties of a son (putradharma).  "

text: अतः अहं तम् एव सत्यं पुत्रं कथयामि।
en_dmt: "Therefore, I will tell you about that true son.  "

text: " पुनः महात्मा पृष्टवान्- "
en_dmt: "Again, the great being asked.  "

text: भवतः धनं कियत् ?" श्रेष्ठी अकथयत्- "
en_dmt: "\"How much wealth do you have?\" The merchant said:  "

text: महाराज! पञ्चसहस्ररूप्यकात्मकम्।
en_dmt: "Great king! (This is) in the amount of five thousand silver coins.  "

text: " महात्मा अपृच्छत्- "
en_dmt: "The great being asked:  "

text: भवतः लिपिकानुसारं तु पञ्चलक्षात्मकं धनम् अस्ति।
en_dmt: "According to your scribe, there is a fortune amounting to five hundred thousand.  "

text: " श्रेष्ठी उदतरत्- लिपिकः सत्यं वदति। अहम् अपि सत्यम् वदामि। धार्मिककार्ये संयोजनार्थम् निःसारितं पञ्चसहस्रात्मकम् एव धनम् अहं धनं मन्ये। इदं एव धनम् मरणोत्तरं मया सह गमिष्यति। अन्यत् तु सर्वम् अत्र एव स्थास्यति।"
en_dmt: "The merchant said: The scribe speaks the truth. I also speak the truth. I consider only that wealth to be wealth, which, amounting to five thousand, has been set aside for pious activities. This very wealth will go with me after death. But everything else will remain here.  "

text: श्रेष्ठिनः अनेन उत्तरेण सन्तुष्टः महात्मा भोजनं तु कृतवान् एव, तस्मै धर्मवृध्यर्थं स्वकीयम् अमोघम् आशीर्वादम् अपि दत्तवान् इति।
en_dmt: "The wealthy man, satisfied by this reply, not only partook of the meal but also bestowed his infallible blessing for the increase of *dharma* (virtue, righteousness) upon him.  "

text: श्रेष्ठी महात्मानं कथं सम्मानितवान्?
en_dmt: "How did the merchant honor the great being?  "

text: महात्मा  श्रेष्ठिनं किं किम् अपृच्छत्?
en_dmt: "What did the great being ask the merchant?  "

text: श्रेष्ठी महात्मानं किं किम् उदतरत्?
en_dmt: "What questions did the wealthy man ask the great being?  "

text: महात्मा श्रेष्ठिनः उत्तरेण सन्तुष्टः किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the great *mahātmā* do, being satisfied with the merchant's reply?  "

text: वास्तविकः पुत्रः कः अस्ति? धनम् अपि वास्तविकं किम् अस्ति?
en_dmt: "Who is the real son? What is the real wealth also?  "

text: स्वार्थी परपीडां न जानाति
en_dmt: "A selfish person does not know the suffering of others ( *parapīḍāṃ*).  "

text: स्वार्थी स्वार्थं विहायान्यत्, किञ्चिन्नैवाभिपश्यति। तस्य कुचेष्टया साधुः, पीडां प्राप्नोति किं नहि?॥
en_dmt: "A selfish person, abandoning his own purpose (*svārtha*), sees nothing else. By his bad actions, does a good person experience suffering, or not?  "

text: गुरुं प्रसन्नं कर्तुं द्वौ शिष्यौ तस्य चरणयोः रात्रौ शयनसमये संवाहनद्वारा सेवां कर्तुं निर्णयं कृतवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "To please the preceptor, two disciples decided to serve him by massaging his feet at bedtime during the night.  "

text: द्वयोः अपि पादयोः एकः एव शिष्यः सेवां कर्तुम् इच्छति स्म।
en_dmt: "Of the two feet, only one disciple wanted to perform service.  "

text: अतः द्वयोः परस्परं कलहं दृष्ट्वा गुरुः स्वस्य एकं चरणम् एकस्मै शिष्याय द्वितीयं चरणं च द्वितीयस्मै शिष्याय संवाहयितुं निर्द्दिष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "Therefore, having seen the two quarreling with each other, the teacher instructed one disciple to massage one of his feet and the second disciple to massage the other foot.  "

text: एवं कलहः तु शान्तः, किन्तु मानसिकः असन्तोषः वर्धमानः एव आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Thus, the quarrel was over, but the mental dissatisfaction was still increasing.  "

text: अस्मिन् एव अन्तराले एकः शिष्यः स्वमातुः अस्वास्थ्यवृत्तं श्रुत्वा तां द्रष्टुं ग्रामान्तरं गतः।
en_dmt: "In that very interval, one disciple, having heard of his mother's illness, went to another village to see her.  "

text: ततः गुरुः तेन संवाह्यमानं चरणम् अपि संवाहयितुम् अन्यस्मै शिष्याय आदिशत्।
en_dmt: "Then the preceptor ordered another disciple to massage even the foot that was being massaged by him.  "

text: परन्तु 'अयं चरणः मम विपक्षिणः'
en_dmt: "But, \"This step (caraṇa) [is] of my adversary (vipakṣiṇaḥ).\"  "

text: इति मत्वा तथा सबलं समवाहयत् यथा तस्य पादस्य अस्थ्नः एव भङ्गः अभवत्।
en_dmt: "Thinking thus, he pulled with all his might, so that the bone of his leg broke.  "

text: द्वित्रिदिनानन्तरं प्रत्यावृत्तः शिष्यः यदा गुरोः सेवनीयस्य स्वपादस्य विपक्षिणा कृताम् एतां दुर्दशां दृष्टवान् - तदा क्रोधाविष्टः ततः प्रतिशोधं ग्रहीतुं विपक्षिणा सेव्यमानस्य चरणस्य अपि तत्कालं तादृशीम् एव दशां कृतवान् यादृशी विपक्षिणा तेन सेवनीयस्य चरणस्य कृता आसीत्।
en_dmt: "After two or three days, the disciple returned. When he saw this misfortune done to his guru's foot, which should be revered, by an opponent, he was filled with anger. Then, to take revenge, he immediately did the same thing to the foot of the opponent that was being revered, as the opponent had done to the foot that should be revered.  "

text: अनेन वेदनापीडितः गुरुः तौ द्वौ अपि शिष्यौ जडमती मत्वा स्वसेवातः दूरीकृतवान् इति।
en_dmt: "Tormented by this pain, the guru, thinking those two disciples were dull-witted, removed them from his service.  "

text: द्वौ शिष्यौ किम् इच्छतः स्म ?
en_dmt: "What did the two students want?  "

text: गुरुः तौ किं कर्तुम् आदिशत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the teacher order them to do?  "

text: प्रथमशिष्ये ग्रामं गते द्वितीयः शिष्यः किम् अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "When the first disciple went to the village, what did the second disciple do?  "

text: ग्रामात् आगतः प्रथमशिष्यः किम् अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the first disciple, who came from the village, do?  "

text: स्वार्थी जनः किं करोति ?
en_dmt: "What does a selfish person do?  "

text: अच्छं भगवतः कार्यम्
en_dmt: "The work of the Blessed One is pure.  "

text: करोति भगवान् यत्तु, तद् भवत्यच्छमेव हि । मन्दस्तन्मन्यते नैव, तत्फलानुभवं विना ॥
en_dmt: "Indeed, whatever the Blessed One does, that itself becomes pure. The dull-witted do not think so, without experiencing its fruit.  "

text: एकः राजा आसीत्।
en_dmt: "There was a king.  "

text: एकवारं लौहद्वारं पिदधतः तस्य हस्तस्य एका अङ्गुलिः छिन्ना, तदा पार्श्वे स्थितस्य अङ्गरक्षकस्य मुखात् सहसा निःसृतम् - "अच्छम् अभवत्। भगवान् यत् करोति, तद् अच्छम् एव करोति।"
en_dmt: "Once, while closing an iron door, one finger of his hand was cut off. Then, from the mouth of a bodyguard standing nearby, it suddenly came out: \"It is good that it happened! Whatever the Blessed One (bhagavān) does, that he does well (accham).\"  "

text: तस्य इदं कथनं श्रुत्वा वेदनार्तः राजा कुपितः भूत्वा तम् आदिशत् - "दुष्ट दूरम् अपेहि इतः, यावत् अहं न आह्वयेयं, तावत् स्वमुखं मां कदापि मा दर्शय।"
en_dmt: "Having heard this statement, the king, afflicted with pain and angered, commanded him: \"Wicked one, go far away from here! Until I summon you, never show me your face.\"  "

text: अङ्गरक्षकः तं प्रणम्य तत्कालं ततः स्वगृहम् आगतः।
en_dmt: "The bodyguard, having bowed to him, immediately returned to his own house.  "

text: पृष्ठतः राजा षट्सप्तमासानन्तरम् एकाकी एव मृगयार्थं वनं गतः।
en_dmt: "After six or seven months, the king went alone into the forest behind [the city] to hunt.  "

text: तत्र हरिणम् एकं सः अनुधावन् मार्गभ्रष्टः अभवत्।
en_dmt: "There, he, chasing after a deer, became lost from the path.  "

text: उपरितः ग्रीष्मसूर्यातपतप्तः पिपासाव्याकुलः च तु सः आसीत् एव, सहसा भयानकाकृतयः केचन वनवासिनः उपस्थिताः, तं च बलात् निगृह्य एकस्मिन् देवीमन्दिरे नीतवन्तः।
en_dmt: "He was already afflicted by thirst, scorched by the summer sun from above, when suddenly some forest dwellers with terrifying appearances arrived, forcibly seized him, and took him to a certain temple of the goddess.  "

text: तत्र ते तस्य देव्यै बलिं दातुम् उद्यताः एव आसन् यत् तेषु एकजनस्य दृष्टिः राज्ञः छिन्नाङ्गुलिहस्ते न्यपतत्।
en_dmt: "Then, just as they were preparing to offer a sacrifice to that queen, one of them noticed the king's hand with a severed finger.  "

text: बलिदाने छिन्नाङ्गव्यक्तेः निषेधत्वात् ते राजानं मुक्तवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Because the offering of a sacrifice involving the cutting off of limbs is forbidden, they released the king.  "

text: राजा यथा तथा स्वप्रासादे न्यवर्तत, अङ्गरक्षकं च आहूय कथितवान् - "त्वं यद् उक्तवान् आसीः, तद् अहम् अपि सत्यम् अनुभूतवान् अस्मि। अङ्गुलिच्छेदनम् एव अद्य मे प्राणरक्षाम् अकरोत्"
en_dmt: "The king returned to his palace as before, and having called the bodyguard, he said: \"What you said was true, I also experienced it. The cutting off of the finger alone saved my life today.\"  "

text: इति कथयित्वा आत्मना सह घटितां सर्वां घटनां विस्तरेण अश्रावयत्।
en_dmt: "Having said this, he recounted in detail the entire incident that had happened to him.  "

text: अङ्गरक्षकः सविनयं न्यवेदयत् - " अन्नदातः! भवान् मां यद् आदिशत् - तद् अपि भगवान् अच्छम् एव कृतवान्। यदि अहं मृगयायां भवता सह अस्थास्यं तर्हि वनवालिनः देव्यै मम बलिम् अवश्यम् अदास्यन् - यतो हि मम किमपि अङ्गं छिन्नं न अस्ति"
en_dmt: "The bodyguard humbly submitted: \"O giver of food! What you commanded me, the Blessed One has done well. If I had stayed with you on the hunt, the forest dwellers would surely have offered me as a sacrifice to the goddess, because none of my limbs are cut off.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: वेदनार्तः राजा अङ्गरक्षकं किम् आदिशत्?
en_dmt: "Afflicted by pain, what did the king command the bodyguard?  "

text: राजानं वनवासिनः कुत्र नीतवन्तः?
en_dmt: "Where did they take the king of the forest dwellers?  "

text: वनवासिनः राजानं किं मुक्तवन्तः?
en_dmt: "Did the forest dwellers release the king?  "

text: राजा अङ्गरक्षकम् आहूय किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "The king, having summoned the bodyguard, what did he say?  "

text: अङ्गरक्षकः राजानं सविनयं किं न्यवेदयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the bodyguard respectfully report to the king?  "

text: पिता अपि पुत्रस्य पुत्रः
en_dmt: "the father of his son  "

text: मातृवत् परदारेषु, वर्तमाने न कः पिता । सपत्नीकस्य सूनोः किं, स्वस्यैव जायते सुतः? ॥
en_dmt: "\"When one behaves towards the wives of others as towards one's mother, who is the father [of the child]? What [benefit] is there to a son with a co-wife? Does a son belong to himself alone?\"  "

text: "तात! मम विवाहं तु भवान् करोति। किन्तु इदम् अवश्यं स्मरणीयं यत् तदा अहं भवतः पिता भविष्यामि, भवान् च मम पुत्रः।"
en_dmt: "\"Father! You will arrange my marriage. But this must be remembered: then I will be your father, and you will be my son.\"  "

text: पुत्रः स्वपितरम् अकथयत्।
en_dmt: "The son spoke to his father.  "

text: "कथम् एतद् वत्स!"
en_dmt: "How is this, child!  "

text: पिता अपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "The father asked.  "

text: "मातृवत् परदारेषु"
en_dmt: "Like a mother towards the wives of others.  "

text: पुत्रः स्वपितरं किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the son say to his father?  "

text: पिता तं किम् अपृच्छत्?
en_dmt: "What did [his] father ask him?  "

text: पुत्रः पितुः प्रश्नस्य किम् उत्तरं दत्तवान्?
en_dmt: "What answer did the son give to the father's question?  "

text: कदा पिता स्वपुत्रस्य एव पुत्रः भवति?
en_dmt: "When does a father become the son of his own son?  "

text: किं पितृसम्मुखे रक्षितः तर्कः सत्यः अस्ति?
en_dmt: "Is the argument, protected in the presence of the father, true?  "

text: काले हि शोभते सर्वम्
en_dmt: "Everything shines in time.  "

text: कार्यं न क्रियते किञ्चित्, कालो वार्तासु याप्यते। पुनः काले व्यतीते च, किं पश्चात् तप्यते नहि?॥
en_dmt: "No work is done at all, and time is spent in idle talk. And when the time has passed, why then does one not regret it later?  "

text: द्वौ जनौ आस्ताम्।
en_dmt: "There were two people.  "

text: एकस्य स्वभावः भाषणदानं, द्वितीयस्य च तद्भाषणश्रवणम् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The nature of one was giving a speech, and of the second was listening to that speech.  "

text: एकदा केनचित् बृहता अपराधेन ताभ्यां मृत्युदण्डः उद्घोषितः।
en_dmt: "Once, a death sentence was proclaimed for them by reason of some great offense.  "

text: कण्टे पाशयोजनात् पूर्वं ततः अन्तिमेच्छा पुष्टा।
en_dmt: "Before the noose is placed around the neck, then the final wish is fulfilled.  "

text: तत्र एकेन भाषणदानस्य, अन्येन च तद्भाषणश्रवणस्य इच्छा प्रकटीकृता।
en_dmt: "There, one party expresses the wish to give a speech, and the other to hear that speech.  "

text: अधिकारिभिः द्वयोः अपि इच्छायाः पूर्तिः कृता।
en_dmt: "The fulfillment of the wishes of both was done by the authorities.  "

text: किन्तु न एकस्य भाषणं विरमति स्म, न च अन्यः तत्श्रवणात् उद्विजते स्म।
en_dmt: "But the speech of one person did not cease, nor did another shrink back from hearing it.  "

text: अयं क्रमः निरन्तरम् अनेकानि दिनानि पर्यन्तं प्रचलितः।
en_dmt: "This sequence continued uninterrupted for many days.  "

text: किन्तु 'अन्तः सर्वस्य भवति'
en_dmt: "But \"[it] is inside everything.\"  "

text: अनेन प्राकृतिकेन नियमेन एकस्मिन् दिने भाषणदाता एव विरतः अाजायत।
en_dmt: "Through this natural law, on one day, the speaker himself became silent.  "

text: तेन एव सह भाषणश्रोतरि अपि विरामः लग्नः ।
en_dmt: "Therefore, even the speaker and listener ceased to [verbally] interact with him.  "

text: परिणामतः द्वौ अपि पाशयोजनेन मृतौ।
en_dmt: "As a result, both died by hanging themselves with a rope.  "

text: एवम् एव जनतायाः व्यक्तिः आत्मीयान् अभावाभियोगान् जनप्रतिनिधिं श्रावयति।
en_dmt: "Just so, an individual from the populace makes their personal grievances known to their representative.  "

text: अनयोः
en_dmt: "Of these two.  "

text: श्रावकः श्रोता च परस्परं श्रावणे श्रवणे च एव समयं यापयतः।
en_dmt: "The *śrāvaka* (disciple) and the hearer spend their time mutually in hearing and listening.  "

text: परं कार्यं तु ततः किम् अपि न सिध्यति इति।
en_dmt: "But what other supreme effect is accomplished by that?  "

text: द्वयोः जनयोः स्वभावः कीदृशः आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the nature of the two parents?  "

text: ताभ्यां कीदृशः दण्डः उद्घोषितः आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What kind of punishment was announced for them?  "

text: तौ कां कां स्वकीयाम् अन्तिमेच्छां प्रकटितवन्तौ?
en_dmt: "What final wish of their own did they reveal?  "

text: ताभ्यां दण्डः कदा मिलितः?
en_dmt: "When was the punishment meted out to them?  "

text: पश्चात्तापः कदा करणीयः भवति?
en_dmt: "When should remorse be felt?  "

text: प्रशंसा नोचिता पुरः
en_dmt: "Praise is not appropriate in front [of him].  "

text: सम्मुखे विहिता व्यक्तेः, प्रशंसा गतिरोधिका । अतः सुबुद्धिमन्तस्तां, प्रशंसन्ति न सम्मुखे ॥
en_dmt: "Manifestation is ordained in someone's presence, [but] praise obstructs progress. Therefore, those of good intellect do not praise in someone's presence.  "

text: भारविः पितुः सपरिश्रमं पठति स्म।
en_dmt: "Bhāravi diligently studied with his father.  "

text: परन्तु पिता तस्य वैदुष्यम् एकवारम् अपि नैव प्रशंसितवान्।
en_dmt: "However, his father never praised his scholarship even once.  "

text: अनेन खिन्नः भारविः पितरं हन्तुं निलीनः।
en_dmt: "Distressed by this, Bhāravi hid himself to kill his father.  "

text: रात्रौ तस्य मात्रा पृष्टः पिता कथितवान् - "भारविः विश्वविख्यातः एकः अजरः अमरः महाकविः भवतु। इदं विचार्य एव अहं तं प्रत्यक्षं नैव प्रशंसामि। प्रशंसा प्रगतौ पूर्णविरामं योजयति। इदं श्रुत्वा भारविः स्वाचरणे पश्चात्तापं कुर्वन् प्रकटीभूय पितृपादयोः खड्गं निधाय स्वविचारितं सर्वं सत्यम् अकथयत्, तदपराधे च आत्मानं हन्तुं निर्णयं श्रावितवान्। पित्रा तु "
en_dmt: "At night, when asked by his mother, the father said, \"May Bhāravi be a world-renowned, undecaying, immortal great poet. Having considered this, I do not praise him directly. Praise puts a full stop to progress.\" Having heard this, Bhāravi, repenting his behavior, revealed himself, placed his sword at his father's feet, and truthfully recounted everything he had thought, and announced his decision to kill himself for that offense. But the father [said]:  "

text: आत्महत्या महान् अपराधः" इति सन्दिश्य प्रायश्चित्तरूपे पत्न्या सह श्वशुरालये कानिचित् वर्षाणि प्रवासं कर्तुं सः निर्दिष्टः। भारविः तथा एव कृतवान्।कानिचित् दिनानि सः श्वशुरालये सपत्नीकः सानन्दं स्थितवान्। किन्तु पश्चात् श्वशुरेण आज्ञप्तः भारविः तस्य गाः चारयितुं प्रवृत्तः। एकतः गावः स्वेच्छया विचरन्त्यः चरन्ति स्म, तर्हि अन्यतः उपविश्य भारविः किरातार्जुनीयं नाम महाकाव्यं रचयितुं प्रावर्तत। गवां स्वक्षेत्रे प्रविश्य चरणेन कुपितः तत्क्षेत्रपतिः भारवेः श्वशुरं भारवेः चेष्टितं यदा अश्रावयत्, तदा श्वशुरः भारविं स्वकार्यं सावधानतापूर्वकं सम्पादयितुं परुषवाचा कथितवान् अपि। किन्तु अनेन रुष्टः न भूत्वा भारविः महाकाव्यविरचनं नैव त्यक्तवान्।भारविः किरातार्जुनीयस्य कानिचित् सुभाषितानि रात्रौ स्वपत्नीम् अपि श्रावयति स्म। आसीत् सा संस्कृतज्ञा विदुषी। स्मरणशक्तिः तस्याः तीव्रा आसीत्। एकदा सा गृहदासीं -"
en_dmt: "Having instructed that \"Suicide is a great crime,\" he was ordered to live in his father-in-law's house for some years with his wife as a form of penance.  Bhāravi did as he was told.  For some days, he lived happily with his wife in his father-in-law's house.  But later, Bhāravi, ordered by his father-in-law, began to graze his cows.  On one hand, the cows grazed, wandering freely; on the other hand, Bhāravi sat down and began to compose the epic poem called Kirātārjunīya.  When the owner of the field, angered by the cows entering and grazing in his field, told Bhāravi's father-in-law about Bhāravi's actions, the father-in-law harshly told Bhāravi to carry out his work carefully.  But not being angered by this, Bhāravi did not give up composing the epic.  Bhāravi would also recite some beautiful verses of the Kirātārjunīya to his wife at night.  She was a learned woman, knowledgeable in Sanskrit.  Her memory was sharp.  One day, she said to the maidservant -  "

text: सहसा विदधीत न क्रियाम्, अविवेकः परमापदां पदम् ।
en_dmt: "One should not undertake any action rashly, for lack of discernment is the seat of the greatest calamities.  "

text: वृणुते हि विमृश्यकारिणं, गुणलुब्धा स्वयमेव सम्पदः ॥"इमं श्‌लोकं श्रावितवती। सा अपि ततः प्रभाविता इमम् एव श्‌लोकम् अन्यत्र यत्र सा कार्यं करोति स्म- तत्रत्यां गृहस्वामिनीम् अश्रावयत्। सा तु स्वशयनकक्षे स्थूलस्थूलाक्षरेषु इमं लेखयित्वा उपयुक्तस्थाने सुरक्षितवती।द्वितीयस्मिन् एव दिने व्यापाराय दशपञ्चदशवर्षेभ्यः विदेशे कृतप्रवासः तस्याः पतिः रात्रौ प्रतिनिवृत्तः। सः पत्न्याः कक्षे तरुणं हृष्टं पुष्टं युवकं शयानं दृष्ट्वा पत्नीं च दुराचारिणीं मत्वा यावत् एव तं हन्तुं प्रवृत्तः, तावत् एव तस्य दृष्टौ उपर्युक्तः श्‌लोकः आपतितः। विरम्य सः किञ्चित् विचारयितुं प्रवृत्तः, तावत् एव तस्य पत्नी तं यथार्थतां प्रबोधितवती यत् अयम् आवयोः आत्मजः एव। '
en_dmt: "Wealth herself chooses the man who acts after deliberation, being greedy for his virtues.  \"She made [her] hear this verse.\"  She, too, influenced by that, made the mistress of the house hear this very verse elsewhere, where she used to work.  And she, having had this written in large, bold letters in her bedroom, kept it safe in a suitable place.  On the second day, her husband, who had been living abroad for trade for ten or fifteen years, returned at night.  When he saw a young, cheerful, and well-nourished youth lying in his wife's room, and thinking his wife to be immoral, as soon as he was about to kill him, that very verse mentioned above fell into his sight.  Stopping, he began to think a little, and then his wife made him understand the truth, that this was their own son.  "

text: पिता स्वपुत्रं भारविं किं न प्रशंसति स्म ?
en_dmt: "Why did the father not praise his own son Bhāravi?  "

text: अनेन भारविः किम् अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "What did Bhāravi do with this?  "

text: पिता भारविं प्रायश्चित्तरूपे किं कर्तुं निर्द्दिष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did [your] father instruct Bhāravi to do as a form of penance (prāyaścitta)?  "

text: भारविः स्वपत्नीं कीदृशं सुभाषितम् अश्रावयत् ?
en_dmt: "What kind of well-spoken verse (subhāṣitam) did Bhāravi cause his own wife to hear (aśrāvayat)?  "

text: अस्य सुभाषितस्य कस्मिन् कीदृशः प्रभावः अभवत् ?
en_dmt: "What sort of effect did this well-spoken statement have, and on whom?  "

text: विमाता जननीतुल्या न
en_dmt: "A stepmother is not equal to one's own mother.  "

text: सन्ततिं मातृहीनां न, कुर्यात् सर्वेश्वरः क्वचित्। जननीवद् विमातापि, स्नेहं नैवाभिवर्षति॥
en_dmt: "The all-powerful one should never create a lineage without a mother. A stepmother never pours forth affection like a real mother.  "

text: इन्दुमती मम प्रतिवेशिन्याः पञ्चषड्वर्षीया कन्या अस्ति।
en_dmt: "Indumatī is the five- or six-year-old daughter of my neighbor.  "

text: स्वभावेन सरला स्मितमुखी सन्तोषिणी च वर्तते।
en_dmt: "By nature, she is straightforward, has a smiling face, and is content. (svabhāvena saralā smitamukhī santoṣiṇī ca vartate)  "

text: मातृहीनत्वात् तस्यां मम वात्सल्यं विशेषम् एव अस्ति।
en_dmt: "Because she is motherless, I have a special affection for her.  "

text: अधुना तु तस्याः पिता तस्यै एकां विमातरम् अपि आनीतवान्।
en_dmt: "But now, her father has brought a stepmother for her as well.  "

text: किन्तु तस्याः व्यवहारेण इन्दुमती सन्तुष्टा न अस्ति।
en_dmt: "But Indumatī is not satisfied with her conduct (vyavahareṇa).  "

text: विमातुः सकाशात् तया एकः भ्राता अपि सम्प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "From his stepmother, he also obtained a single brother.  "

text: सा तस्मिन् बहु स्निह्यति।
en_dmt: "She is very fond of him.  "

text: किन्तु शङ्‌कितचित्ता विमाता शिशुं स्प्रष्टुम् अपि तां निवारयति।
en_dmt: "But the stepmother, with a fearful mind, prevents even touching the child.  "

text: वराक्याः निष्कपटः स्नेहः शुष्कः एव तिष्ठति।
en_dmt: "The affection of the poor woman remains dry, indeed without deceit.  "

text: सा विमातुः व्यवहारं यदा कदा मां वर्णयति।
en_dmt: "She describes her stepmother's behavior to me from time to time.  "

text: अहं शान्तिपूर्वकं तस्याः वार्ताः शृणोमि।
en_dmt: "I listen to her stories peacefully.  "

text: अनेन सा मां बहु मन्यते, आत्मीयां मनोव्यथां च मम अग्रे कथयित्वा स्वमनः लघु करोति।
en_dmt: "By this, she esteems me greatly, and, telling me her mental anguish, she lightens her own mind.  "

text: मम पतिदेवस्य नगरान्तरे परिवर्तनेन मम अपि तत्र गमनम् अनिवार्यम् अभवत् एव।
en_dmt: "Due to the transfer of my husband to another city, my going there also became unavoidable.  "

text: अतः यदा गृहस्य सर्वां सामग्रीं सङ्‌कलितां कृत्वा अहं यानम् आरोढुम् उद्यता एव आसं यत् सा उपस्थिता, मां च तथाविधां दृष्ट्वा स्तब्धा इव सञ्जाता पुनः ज्ञाततत्त्वा च रुदती विलपन्ती सा माम् अब्रवीत् - "मातृष्वसः! रोधनात् तु त्वं न स्थास्यसि, किन्तु जननीहीनां मां यदा कदा अत्र आगत्य अवश्यं सम्भालय।"
en_dmt: "Therefore, when I had gathered all the materials of the house and was just about to get into the vehicle, she arrived, and seeing me in that state, she became as if stunned. Then, understanding the truth, weeping and lamenting, she said to me: \"Aunt! You will not stay because of my weeping, but when I am without a mother, you must come here and take care of me from time to time.\"  "

text: अहं ताम् आश्वास्य भारिमनसा प्रस्थिता।
en_dmt: "Having consoled her, I departed with a heavy heart.  "

text: तस्याः मधुरा स्मृतिः अद्यापि न अपयाति इति।
en_dmt: "Her sweet memory still does not fade away.  "

text: इन्दुमती सन्तुष्टा किं न अस्ति?
en_dmt: "Is Indumati content? Is she not?  "

text: तया सह विमाता कीदृशं व्यवहारं करोति?
en_dmt: "How does the stepmother treat her?  "

text: नगरान्तरे प्रस्थातुम् उद्यतां माम् इन्दुमती किं कथितवती?
en_dmt: "What did Indumatī say to me when I was preparing to set out for another city?  "

text: किम् इन्दुमत्याः स्मृतिः अपयाति?
en_dmt: "Does the recollection of Indumati fade away?  "

text: विमाता किं न करोति?
en_dmt: "What will a stepmother not do?  "

text: नहि कश्चित् वञ्च्यताम्
en_dmt: "Let no one be deceived.  "

text: वञ्चनं हि महापापं, महारौरवपातकम्। स्वयं तु वञ्च्यतां नाम, किन्त्वन्यो न हि वञ्च्यताम्॥
en_dmt: "For deception is a great sin, a deed leading to the great Naraka hell called *mahāraurava*. One may deceive oneself, but another should certainly not be deceived.  "

text: एकः राजा आसीत्।
en_dmt: "There was a king.  "

text: कदाचित् स महाव्याधिना ग्रस्तः अभूत्।
en_dmt: "Once, he was afflicted by a great disease (mahāvyādhinā grastaḥ).  "

text: चिकित्सकः तं मृगमांसनिर्मितम् औषधं सेवितुं परामृष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "The physician advised him to take the medicine made of deer meat.  "

text: मन्त्री तत्कालं व्याधम् मृगान् निगृह्य आनेतुम् आदिशत्।
en_dmt: "The minister immediately ordered the hunter to capture and bring the deer.  "

text: व्याधं दृष्ट्वा सर्वे अपि मृगाः पलायिताः।
en_dmt: "Seeing the hunter, all the deer fled. (तं बद्धं दृष्ट्वा सर्वे मृगा निष्पलायिताः)  "

text: इदं दृष्ट्वा वञ्चकः व्याधः साधुवेषं धृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Having seen this, the deceitful hunter assumed the guise of a holy man.  "

text: तदा मृगाः तस्मिन् विश्वस्य प्रत्यागताः प्रतिगृहीताः च व्याधेन।
en_dmt: "Then the deer, having trusted him, returned to him and were received by the hunter.  "

text: व्याधः मृगान् राजान्तिकं नीत्वा तेषां निग्रहणप्रकारं राजानं श्रावितवान्।
en_dmt: "The hunter, having taken the deer to the king, made the king hear of the manner of their capture.  "

text: राजा मृगाणां सारल्यं दृष्ट्वा तान् अमोचयत्।
en_dmt: "Seeing the deer's simplicity, the king released them.  "

text: पुनः ईश्वरकृपया राजा साधारणेन एव औषधेन पूर्ववत् स्वस्थः समजायत।
en_dmt: "Again, by the grace of Īśvara, the king became healthy as before, by means of a common medicine.  "

text: व्याधः अपि स्वकीये दुष्कृत्ये पश्चात्तापं कुर्वन् आत्मीयं पापजनकं वधकर्म त्यक्तवान् ईश्वरसेवोन्मुखः च अभवत् इति।
en_dmt: "Even a hunter, feeling remorse for his own misdeed, abandoned his own sin-generating profession of killing and became inclined to the service of Īśvara.  "

text: मन्त्री व्याधं मृगान् आनेतुं किं निर्दिष्टवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the minister instruct the hunter to bring deer for?  "

text: मृगाः व्याधं दृष्ट्वा किम् अकुर्वन्?
en_dmt: "What did the deer do, having seen the hunter?  "

text: मृगाः पुनः व्याधस्य वशे कथम् अूभवत्?
en_dmt: "How did the deer again fall under the control of the hunter?  "

text: राजा मृगान् किम् अमोचयत्?
en_dmt: "Why did the king release the deer?  "

text: वञ्चनं कीदृशं भवति?
en_dmt: "What is deception like?  "

text: अन्तकाले हृदयपरिवर्तनम्
en_dmt: "Transformation of the heart at the time of death.  "

text: अन्तकाले समायाते, हृदयं परिवर्तते। अमित्रो जायते मित्रं, त्यजति स्वां च शत्रुताम्॥
en_dmt: "When the end-time approaches, the heart changes. An enemy becomes a friend, and abandons his own enmity.  "

text: क्षतविक्षतान् स्वकीयान् परकीयान् च सैनिकान् परित्यज्य सेनापतिः स्वसैन्येन सह अग्रे प्रचलितः।
en_dmt: "Abandoning his own and the enemy's soldiers, who were wounded and mutilated, the general advanced with his own army.  "

text: कः म्रियते? कः च जीवति? इदं द्रष्टुं कस्यचित् अपि समीपे समयः न आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Who dies? And who lives? No one had time to see this.  "

text: सुदूरे निर्गते सेनापतौ ऊर्ध्वं निःश्वसन्तं सैनिकं दृष्ट्वा अन्यः आहतः सैनिकः पृष्टवान्- "किं भोः! जलं पातुम् इच्छसि? मम समीपे इदम् अस्ति जलपात्रम्।"
en_dmt: "When the commander had gone far away, another wounded soldier, seeing a soldier sighing deeply, asked: \"Friend! Do you wish to drink water? I have this water vessel near me.\"  "

text: "आम्, किन्तु पीडया तव समीपे आयातुं न शक्नोमि।"
en_dmt: "Yes, but I am unable to come to you because of the pain.  "

text: क्षतविक्षतः सैनिकः स्वस्थानतः एव उत्तरं दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "The wounded soldier gave his reply from his own position.  "

text: "चिन्तां मा कुरु, चिन्तां मा कुरु "
en_dmt: "Do not worry, do not worry.  "

text: अहम् एव येन केन प्रकारेण आयामि।
en_dmt: "I will come by any means whatsoever.  "

text: त्वं शत्रुसैनिकः असि तर्हि अनेन   किम्? असि तु सैनिकः एव मम बन्धुः।
en_dmt: "If you are an enemy soldier, then what is the meaning of this? But if you are a soldier and my friend.  "

text: सेनापतिः किं कृत्वा अग्रे प्रचलितः?
en_dmt: "What did the general do before proceeding forward?  "

text: सेनापतौ निर्गते आहतः सैनिकः अन्यं सैनिकं किं पृष्टवान्?
en_dmt: "When the commander had left, what did the wounded soldier ask the other soldier?  "

text: सः सैनिकः किम् उदतरत्?
en_dmt: "What did that soldier say?  "

text: हृदयं कदा परिवर्तितं भवति?
en_dmt: "When does the heart change?  "

text: अनया कथया कीदृशः सन्देशः दीयते?
en_dmt: "What kind of message is given by this story?  "

text: राष्ट्रोत्थानं कथं भवेत् ?
en_dmt: "How can there be a rise of the nation?  "

text: गुरूभक्ता न भूयांसो, विद्वच्छ्रद्धालवोऽपि न । विद्याह्रासस्ततो जातो, राष्ट्रोत्थानं कथं भवेत् ? ॥
en_dmt: "Devotees of the teacher are not many, nor are those who have faith in the learned. From this, the decline of knowledge arises; how can there be the rise of the nation?  "

text: शिक्षां परिसमाप्य कौत्सः गुरुं वरतन्तुं स्वेप्सितां दक्षिणां निर्देष्टुं न्यवेदयत्।
en_dmt: "Having completed his studies, Kautsa requested his teacher Varatantu to specify the fee he desired (dakṣiṇā).  "

text: किन्तु वरतन्तुः तस्य सेवाशुश्रूषाम् एव परमोत्तमां दक्षिणां मत्वा ततः किम् अपि अन्यत् नैव ऐच्छत्।
en_dmt: "But Vara-taṇtu, considering service and attendance to him as the highest and best reward, desired nothing else whatsoever from him.  "

text: कौत्सः अनेन नैव सन्तुष्टः।
en_dmt: "Kautsa was not satisfied with this.  "

text: सः वारं वारं गुरुं न्यवेदयत्।
en_dmt: "He repeatedly submitted [this] to the guru.  "

text: तस्य आग्रहेण उत्तेजितः वरतन्तुः तम् आदिष्टवान् - "त्वं मत्तः अधीतानाम् चतुर्दशविद्यानां कृते चतुर्दशकोटिसुवर्णमुद्राः देहि।"
en_dmt: "Urged by his insistence, Varatantu ordered him: \"Give me fourteen *koṭi* (ten million) gold coins for the fourteen sciences (*caturdaśavidyā*) you have learned from me.\"  "

text: कौत्सः किञ्चित् अपि न खिद्यमानः गुरुपादवन्दनां कृत्वा साकेताधिपतिं महाराजं रघुं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "Kautsa, not feeling at all distressed, having bowed at the feet of his teacher, reached the lord of Saketa, the great king Raghu.  "

text: मृण्मयपात्रेषु पूजासामग्रीं निधाय रघुः कौत्सं सत्कर्तुं द्वारि उपस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Having placed the materials for worship in earthenware vessels, Raghu stood at the door to honor Kautsa.  "

text: ततः तम् अन्तः नीत्वा सम्मान्य च आगमनप्रयोजनं पृष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "Then, having taken him inside and honored him, he asked the reason for his arrival.  "

text: कौत्सः गुरुणा सह घटितं दक्षिणाविषयकं सर्वं वृत्तान्तम् अकथयत्।
en_dmt: "Kautsa related to his teacher the entire incident regarding the *dakṣiṇā* that had occurred.  "

text: विश्वजिति यज्ञे वितीर्णसर्वस्वः अकिञ्चनीभूतः अपि रघुः तं यज्ञशालायाम् उषित्वा द्वित्रिदिनानि प्रतीक्षितुं प्रार्थयत।
en_dmt: "Having given away all his possessions in the Viśvajit sacrifice, Raghu, rendered penniless, requested him to wait two or three days, dwelling in the *yajñaśālā* (sacrificial hall).  "

text: मन्त्रिपरामर्शेन कुबेरतः धनम् आहर्तुं प्रातः प्रस्थानाय रात्रौ सः रथे एव प्रसुप्तः।
en_dmt: "Having consulted with his ministers, and in order to obtain wealth from Kubera, he fell asleep in the chariot itself that night, in order to set out in the morning.  "

text: अन्येद्युः प्रस्थानोद्यतं तं कोषाध्यक्षः उपस्थाय कोषे रात्रौ सञ्जातां सुवर्णवृष्टिम् असूचयत्।
en_dmt: "The next day, the treasurer, approaching him as he was preparing to depart, reported a rain of gold that had occurred in the treasury during the night.  "

text: ततः कौत्सम् आदाय कोषाध्यक्षमन्त्र्यादिसहितः रघुः कोषालयं गतः, सर्वाः च सुवर्णमुद्राः गुरवे दातुं ग्रहीतुं कौत्सं प्रार्थितवान्।
en_dmt: "Then Raghu, taking Kautsa, along with the treasurer, minister, etc., went to the treasury and requested Kautsa to take all the gold coins to give to the guru.  "

text: परन्तु सः कौत्सः ततः अपेक्षिताः एव ग्रहीतुम् इच्छति स्म, रघुः च सर्वाः अपि ग्रहीतुं तं बाधते स्म।
en_dmt: "But Kautsa desired to take only as many as were needed from him, and Raghu urged him to take all of them.  "

text: तयोः अनेन शुद्धेन व्यवहारेण तत्र उपस्थिताः सर्वे अपि सन्तुष्टाः जनाः द्वौ अपि जयोद्घोषैः भृशम् अभिनन्दितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "By this pure transaction of theirs, all the people present there were satisfied and greatly congratulated both of them with shouts of victory.  "

text: अन्ते रघुः एव सर्वं सुवर्णराशिं कौत्सेन सह तस्य गुरोः समीपे प्रेषितवान् इति।
en_dmt: "In the end, Raghu sent the entire heap of gold, together with Kautsa, to the vicinity of his teacher.  "

text: गुरुं वरतन्तुं तस्य शिष्यः कौत्सः किं न्यवेदयत् ?
en_dmt: "What did Kautsa, the disciple of the *guru* Varatantu, report?  "

text: वरतन्तुः कौत्सं किं प्रबोधितवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did Varatantu awaken Kautsa to?  "

text: वारं वारं निवेदनेन वरतन्तुः कौत्सं किम् आदिष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did Varatantu order Kautsa by repeatedly requesting him?  "

text: कौत्सः गुरवे दक्षिणां कुतः आदाय अर्पितवान् ?
en_dmt: "From where did Kautsa take the *dakṣiṇā* and offer it to his teacher?  "

text: विद्याह्रासस्य किं कारणम् ?
en_dmt: "What is the reason for the decline of knowledge?  "

text: साधुसन्तः महात्मानः
en_dmt: "Good, virtuous, great-souled ones.  "

text: साधुसन्तो महात्मानः, कामात्मानो भवन्ति न। सन्मार्गे ते प्रवर्त्यान्यान्, न त्यजन्ति कदापि तान्॥
en_dmt: "Good and virtuous great souls do not become driven by desire. They lead others onto the good path and never abandon them.  "

text: अमेरिकायां स्वामिरामतीर्थस्य भाषणकौशलेन शारीरिकसौन्दर्येण च मुग्धा भूत्वा एका महिला ततः तादृशं पुत्रं प्राप्तुम् इच्छन्ती स्वां पत्नीरूपेण स्वीकर्तुं प्रार्थितवती।
en_dmt: "In America, captivated by Swami Ram Tirtha's eloquence and physical beauty, a woman, desiring to have such a son, requested him to accept her as his wife.  "

text: स्वामी तु सविनयं कथितवान्- "आवयोः दाम्पत्येन जातः पुत्रः मत्तुल्यः एव भविष्यति अस्मिन् दृढता न अस्ति। अतः किं न माम् एव भवती स्वात्मजं ज्ञात्वा स्वीकरोति? अहम् एवम् आजीवनं भवतीं भवदीयं देशं च सेवितुं पूर्णम् अवसरं प्राप्स्यामि"
en_dmt: "The master then humbly said: \"There is no certainty that a son born of our marriage will be like me. Therefore, why doesn't your ladyship consider me your own son and accept me? Thus, I will have a full opportunity to serve you and your country for my entire life.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: रामतीर्थं महिला किं कर्तुं प्रार्थितवती?
en_dmt: "What did Rāmatīrtha ask the woman to do?  "

text: रामतीर्थः महिलां किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did Rāmatīrtha say to the woman?  "

text: रामतीर्थस्य महिलां प्रति कथनं रामतीर्थं किं साधयति?
en_dmt: "What does Rāmatīrtha prove by his statement to the woman?  "

text: साधुमहात्मानः कीदृशाः भवन्ति?
en_dmt: "What kind of excellent great beings (sādhu-mahātmānaḥ) are they?  "

text: अनया कथया कः सन्देशः मिलति?
en_dmt: "What message is obtained from this story?  "

text: राजसम्मानः
en_dmt: "Royal honor.  "

text: दुर्लभो राजसम्मानो, विरला निःस्पृहास्ततः। काले स्वल्पोऽपि सम्मानो, भवेद् भूरि यशस्करः॥
en_dmt: "Rare is royal honor, and rarer still are those who are without desire. Even a small honor in due time becomes greatly conducive to fame.  "

text: प्रतिवेशिराज्यस्य राजानं विदुषां सम्मानं कुर्वन्तं दृष्ट्वा यशोलिप्सोः तस्य अपि स्वराज्यपण्डितान् सम्मानयितुम् इच्छा जागरिता।
en_dmt: "Seeing the king of the neighboring kingdom honoring scholars, a desire arose in him, who was greedy for fame, to honor the scholars of his own kingdom as well.  "

text: सः स्वकीयं मन्त्रिणं सम्मानपात्रं विद्वांसम् अन्वेष्टुम् आदिष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "He ordered [them] to seek a minister of his own, worthy of respect, and learned.  "

text: एकः वृद्धः पण्डितः मिलितः।
en_dmt: "An old wise man was met.  "

text: प्रचुरं धनधान्यं गृहीत्वा दलबलसहितः राजा तत्पण्डितावासं प्राप्तः, पण्डितं च सादरं प्रणम्य सम्मान्य च सह आनीतं धनधान्यं तच्चरणारविन्दयोः समर्पितवान्।
en_dmt: "Taking abundant wealth and grain, the king, together with his army, arrived at the dwelling of that learned man, and respectfully bowing and honoring the learned man, he offered the wealth and grain he had brought at his lotus feet.  "

text: पण्डितः तद् नैव स्वीकृतवान् कथितवान् च "महाराज! उत्तरायुषि विद्यमानस्य न एतेन मे किमपि प्रयोजनम्, न च अहम् इदानीम् उपकारकं भवन्तं प्रत्युपकर्तुम् एव शक्नोमि। भगवद्भजने निरतस्य मे शिरसि मा भवतु अन्यः कश्चित् भारः।"
en_dmt: "The wise man did not accept that and said, “Great king! This is of no use to me, who is in the later part of life, nor am I now able to reciprocate the help to you, the benefactor. Let there not be any other burden on my head, as I am engaged in the worship of the Blessed One (bhagavad-bhajane).”  "

text: राजा तस्य इमां निःस्पृहताम् अवलोक्य खिन्नमनाः अपि तं वाचा एव भूयः भूयः सम्मान्य प्रणम्य च स्वं प्रासादं प्रत्यावृत्तः इति।
en_dmt: "The king, observing his indifference, though saddened in mind, repeatedly honored him with words, bowed to him, and returned to his own palace.  "

text: यशोलिप्सोः राज्ञः किं कर्तुम् इच्छा जागरिता?
en_dmt: "What desire has arisen in the king who is eager for fame, to do?  "

text: सः पण्डितं किं कृत्वा किं कथितवान्‌?
en_dmt: "What did he do to the wise man, and what did he say?  "

text: पण्डितः तं राजानं किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the learned man say to that king?  "

text: राजा ततः किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the king do then?  "

text: कीदृशः सम्मानः यशस्करः भवति?
en_dmt: "What kind of respect is glorious?  "

text: सज्जनः
en_dmt: "good person  "

text: दृष्ट्वाऽन्येषां तु दुःखानि, दुःखी भवति सज्जनः। तेषां दुःखानि हर्तुं स, सम्प्रार्थयत ईश्वरम्॥
en_dmt: "Seeing the sufferings of others, a virtuous person becomes sorrowful. To remove their sufferings, he prays to the Lord (Īśvara).  "

text: भगवतः गोविन्ददेवस्य एकः निर्धनः भक्तः प्रतिदिनं प्रातः नियमितरूपेण दर्शनं कर्तुं गच्छति स्म।
en_dmt: "A poor devotee of the Blessed Lord Govindadeva used to go every morning to see him regularly.  "

text: वर्षाशीतग्रीष्मादिकाः ऋतवः तस्य दर्शने बाधकाः न भवन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "The seasons, such as the rainy season, the cold season, and the hot season, were not obstacles to seeing him.  "

text: किन्तु एकवारं शीतर्तौ तस्य पादत्राणे जीर्णशीर्णे अभवताम्।
en_dmt: "But once, in the cold season, his shoes became worn and torn.  "

text: सः गोविन्ददेवं प्रार्थितवान् - "भगवन्! त्वं सर्वदानी असि। यदि कुतश्चन मह्यं पादत्राणयोः व्यवस्थां कुर्याः, तर्हि मह्यं सुखकरं स्यात्। "
en_dmt: "He prayed to Govindadeva: \"Lord! You are the giver of all. If you would somehow arrange for a pair of shoes for me, it would be comfortable for me.\"  "

text: एवं सम्प्रार्थ्य यदा सः परावृत्तः, तदा मन्दिरात् बहिः उपविष्टम् एकं याचकं बालकम् अपश्यत्।
en_dmt: "Having thus entreated, when he turned back, then outside the temple, he saw a beggar boy sitting.  "

text: तस्य पादौ न आस्ताम्।
en_dmt: "His feet were not there.  "

text: तस्य जनकः तं तत्र उपावेश्य स्वयम् अन्यत्र भिक्षार्थं गतः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "His father, having seated him there, himself had gone elsewhere for alms (bhikṣā).  "

text: बालकाय दर्शनार्थिनः तस्य विकलाङ्गतां दृष्ट्वा दयाभिभूताः सन्तः यत् किञ्चित् ददति स्म।
en_dmt: "Those who wished to see the boy, seeing his crippled state, were overcome with compassion and gave whatever they could.  "

text: पादत्राणाभिलाषुकः भक्तः यदा बालकम् इमं दृष्टवान् तदा भगवते गोविन्ददेवाय  धन्यवादं ददत् अकथयत् - "अहो! भगवन्! त्वत्कृपया मम पादौ तु वर्तेते, अहम् आभ्यां यथेच्छम् इतस्ततः चलितुं शक्नोमि। अयं बालकः तु तथा कर्तुम् अपि न शक्नोति। मह्यं त्वं पादत्राणे देहि वा मा देहि, किन्तु अस्मै बालकाय तु द्वौ पादौ अवश्यम् एव देहि, येन अयम् अपि इच्छानुसारं पर्यटितुं शक्नुयात्। तदा एव अहं सुखम् अनुभवेयम्"
en_dmt: "When the devotee, desirous of shoes, saw this boy, he gave thanks to the Blessed Lord Govindadeva and said: \"Oh! Blessed Lord! By your grace, I have feet, and I am able to walk here and there as I wish with them. But this boy is not even able to do that. Whether you give me shoes or not, but to this boy, you must give two feet, so that he too may wander according to his wish. Only then will I experience happiness.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: निर्धनः भक्तः गोविन्ददेवं प्रथमं किं प्रार्थितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the poor devotee first pray to Govindadeva for?  "

text: प्रार्थनां कृत्वा परावृत्तः भक्तः मन्दिरात् बहिः किं दृष्टवान्?
en_dmt: "Having made his prayer and turned back, what did the devotee see outside the temple?  "

text: पुनः सः भगवन्तं गोविन्दं किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What, then, did he say to the Blessed Lord Govinda?  "

text: सज्जनः कीदृशः भवति?
en_dmt: "What kind of person is a *satpuruṣa*?  "

text: अन्यदुःखानि दृष्ट्वा सज्जनः किं करोति?
en_dmt: "Having seen the suffering of others, what does a virtuous person do?  "

text: सहायतादानस्य मिष्टं फलम्
en_dmt: "The sweet result of the gift of assistance.  "

text: साहाय्यं सङ्‌कटे दत्तं, क्वचिद् व्यर्थं न जायते। तत्फलं मिलते मिष्टं, तस्मात् साहाय्यमाचरेत् ॥
en_dmt: "Help given in distress is never useless. Its sweet fruit is obtained; therefore, one should render assistance.  "

text: स्थैषणे यात्रिणां सम्मर्दे एकस्याः मुखावगुण्ठनधारिण्याः वृद्धायाः हस्ततः तदीयः त्रिचतुरवर्षीयः पौत्रः मुक्तः।
en_dmt: "In the crowded marketplace, a three- or four-year-old grandson of an old woman wearing a veil was released from her hand.  "

text: अवसरं दृष्ट्वा एकः साधुवेशधारी दुष्टः तं बालकम् अपहृत्य रात्र्याः गहने अन्धकारे विलीनः।
en_dmt: "Seeing an opportunity, a wicked man disguised as a mendicant abducted the boy and disappeared into the dense darkness of night.  "

text: वराकी वृद्धा साहाय्यार्थं क्रन्दति स्म।
en_dmt: "The poor old woman was crying for help.  "

text: किन्तु कस्य समीपे आसीत् तस्याः सहायतां कर्तुं समयः? स्थैषणे उपस्थिताः आरक्षिजनाः अपि इतः ध्यानं न दत्तवन्तः।
en_dmt: "But who had the time to help her? Even the policemen present at the station did not pay attention to this.  "

text: मया सह यात्रायां मम धर्मपत्नी अपि आसीत्।
en_dmt: "My *dharma*-wife (dharmapatnī) was also with me on the journey.  "

text: तस्याः मातृवात्सल्यं प्रस्फुटितम्।
en_dmt: "Her motherly affection blossomed.  "

text: सा मां साग्रहं कथितवती - "आर्यपुत्र! आवाभ्यां यात्रा स्थगिता एव किं न करणीया स्यात्, किन्तु अस्याः वृद्धायाः पौत्रम् अन्विष्य अस्मै स देयः एव।"
en_dmt: "She told me insistently: \"Noble son! Shouldn't we postpone our journey and search for this old woman's grandson and give him back to her?\"  "

text: तदा पत्नीद्वितीयः अहं बालकापहारकं धृत्वा ततः बालकम् आदाय तस्य पितामह्यै दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Then, accompanied by my wife, I seized the child-snatcher, and taking the child from there, I gave him to his paternal grandmother.  "

text: पौत्रं प्राप्य अत्यन्तं प्रसन्ना वृद्धा अन्तःकरणतः तथा आशीर्वादं वितीर्णवती-  यथा आवां दम्पती अद्य कुलदीपकं लब्ध्वा निःसीमं प्रसुदितौ स्वः इति।
en_dmt: "Having obtained a grandson, the extremely delighted old woman wholeheartedly bestowed a blessing, saying: \"Today, having obtained an heir to the family, we, the couple, are immensely happy.\"  "

text: वृद्धायाः हस्ततः पौत्रः कुत्र मुक्तः?
en_dmt: "Where did the grandson slip from the old woman's hand?  "

text: तस्याः पौत्रं कः अपहृतवान्?
en_dmt: "Who stole her grandson?  "

text: अपहर्तुः पौत्रं कः अमोचयत्?
en_dmt: "Who released the grandson of the thief?  "

text: पौत्रमोचयित्रे वृद्धा किम् अददात्?
en_dmt: "What did the old woman give to the one who freed her grandson?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: स्वभावे स्वभावे भेदः
en_dmt: "A difference in inherent nature itself.  "

text: स्वार्थी स्वार्थातिरिक्तं न, किञ्चित् कदापि पश्यति । उदारचरितश्चापि, प्रकृतिं स्वां न मुञ्चति ॥
en_dmt: "A selfish person never sees anything beyond their own interests. And even a noble-minded person does not abandon their own nature.  "

text: कञ्चित् पशुम् अनुधावन् एकः वृकः एकस्मिन् कूपे निपतितः।
en_dmt: "A certain wolf, chasing after an animal, fell into a well.  "

text: ततः एव सः उच्चैः उच्चैः आत्मानम् निःसारयितुम् अशब्दापयत्।
en_dmt: "Then, indeed, he tried again and again to extract himself, wordlessly.  "

text: इतस्ततः आयान्तः यान्तः पशवः तस्य शब्दं श्रुतवन्तः, परन्तु तं स्वशत्रुं मन्वानाः न केचन अपि उदधरन्।
en_dmt: "The animals, coming and going here and there, heard his sound, but thinking him to be their enemy, none of them approached.  "

text: एका छागी यदा तं शब्दापयन्तम् अशृणोत्, तदा तस्याः मनसि दया उत्पन्ना।
en_dmt: "When a certain goat heard him calling, compassion arose in her mind.  "
