en_dmt: "The householder, not giving alms to him, had him driven out with contempt by his own son.  "

text: किन्तु कियद्दूरं गतं तं पुनः आहूय पूर्ववत् एव सताडनं निरगमयत्।
en_dmt: "But after he had gone some distance, he called him back again and drove him out with the same beating as before.  "

text: एवं सः 10-20 वारं कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Thus, he did so 10-20 times.  "

text: अन्ते तस्य क्रोधहीनतां प्रशान्ततां च दृष्ट्वा तस्य चरणयोः निपत्य स्वधृष्टतायाः कृते वारं वारं ततः क्षमाम् अयाचत, तदीयां सहिष्णुतां च बहु बहु कीर्तयितुं प्रवृत्तः।
en_dmt: "In the end, having seen his lack of anger and his peacefulness, he fell at his feet and repeatedly begged forgiveness for his impudence, and proceeded to praise his forbearance greatly.  "

text: किन्तु संन्यासी तं निवारयन् केवलम् इदम् एव अकथयत् "प्रशंसायोग्यः तु सः कुक्कुरः अस्ति, यः वारं वारं अपमानितः प्रताडितः अपि लक्ष्यप्राप्तिं यावत् न विरमति। अहं तु शान्तस्वभावस्य तस्य अग्रे अस्मि एव कः ? माम् एवं कीर्तयित्वा मम अभिमानं न जागरयतु न च मां नरकगामिनम् एव करोतु"
en_dmt: "But the *saṃnyāsī*, renunciate, preventing him, only said this: \"That dog is worthy of praise, who, even repeatedly insulted and beaten, does not cease until the goal is reached. But who am I before him, of peaceful disposition? Do not awaken my pride by praising me thus, nor make me go to hell.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: गृहस्थः संन्यासिनं किम् अपृच्छत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the householder ask the renunciate?  "

text: संन्यासी किम् उत्तरं दत्तवान् ?
en_dmt: "What answer did the renunciate give?  "

text: गृहस्थः - वारं संन्यासिनं गृहात् सताडनं किं निरगमयत् ?
en_dmt: "Why did the householder drive the renunciate out of the house with a beating?  "

text: संन्यासी प्रशंसायोग्यं कं निर्दिष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "Whom did the renunciate indicate as worthy of praise?  "

text: कः सदा प्रशान्तः मोदते ?
en_dmt: "Who always rejoices, being peaceful?  "

text: शान्तिप्रेमस्थितौ लक्ष्मीः
en_dmt: "Lakṣmī is established in a state of peace and love.  "

text: यत्र शान्तिस्तथा प्रेम, तत्र लक्ष्मीस्थितिः सदा। सद्वेषः कलहो यत्र, तत्र दारिद्र्यसंस्थितिः॥
en_dmt: "Where there is peace and also love, there Lakṣmī (the Goddess of wealth) always resides. Where there is animosity and quarreling, there poverty dwells.  "

text: एकदा श्रेष्ठिनः रामधनस्यस्वप्ने आगत्य दरिद्रता कथितवती- "श्रेष्ठिन्! लक्ष्मीः तव गृहे बहुवर्षाणि वासं कृतवती। तस्याः छत्रच्छायायां तिष्ठिता सपरिवारेण त्वया असीमः आनन्दः उपभुक्तः। किन्तु समयः सदा एकसमानः न तिष्ठति। लक्ष्म्याः स्थाने अधुना अहं वासं करिष्यामि। परम् इतः पूर्वं त्वम् एकं यथेच्छं वरं मत्तः ग्रहीतुम् अर्हसि।"
en_dmt: "Once, poverty came to the wealthy man Rāmadhana in a dream and said: \"O wealthy man! Lakṣmī has resided in your house for many years. You, along with your family, have enjoyed boundless bliss while dwelling in her protective shade. But time never remains the same. Now, in place of Lakṣmī, I will reside. But before that, you may take one boon from me as you wish.\"  "

text: स्वप्ने एव श्रेष्ठी ताम् उदतरत्- "यदि एवं, तर्हि अहं प्रकृतिनियमाग्रे किं कर्तुं शक्नोमि? किन्तु यत् किम् अपि करोमि, तत् गृहस्य समस्तानां सदस्यानां सहमत्या एव करोमि, तत् गृहस्य समस्तानां सदस्यानां सहमत्या एव करोमि। अतः वरविषये अपि तेषाम् एव सहमतिं गृहीत्वा कथयिष्यामि। तावत् मे कृपया समयं देहि।"
en_dmt: "In a dream, the merchant then said to her: \"If it is so, then what can I do against the rule of nature? But whatever I do, I do it with the consent of all the members of the household, with the consent of all the members of the household.  Therefore, even regarding the choice of a groom, I will take their consent and then tell you.  Until then, please give me time out of kindness.\"  "

text: दरिद्रता तथा स्वीकृतवती।
en_dmt: "She accepted poverty (daridratā).  "

text: अन्यस्मिन् दिने प्रातः श्रेष्ठी सर्वान् अपि सदस्यान् दरिद्रतायाः समस्तां घटनां श्रावयित्वा वरविषये अपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "On another day, in the morning, the merchant, having told all the members about the entire incident of poverty, inquired about the bridegroom.  "

text: ततः प्रत्येकं सदस्यः पृथक् पृथक् वरणीयं वस्तु निर्दिष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "Then, each member individually specified the item to be selected separately.  "

text: किन्तु श्रेष्ठिनः मनः तेन नैव सन्तुष्टम्।
en_dmt: "But the merchant's mind was not at all content with that.  "

text: अन्ते तस्य पुत्रवधूः तस्मै परामर्शं दत्तवती- "पितः! ततः अयं वरः याच्यतां यत् अस्मद् गृहे  शान्तिः प्रेम च यथापूर्वं तिष्ठतु।"
en_dmt: "At the end, his daughter-in-law gave him advice: \"Father! Therefore, this boon should be requested, that peace and love remain in our house as before.\"  "

text: श्रेष्ठिने अयं परामर्शः भृशम् अरोचत।
en_dmt: "This advice greatly pleased the merchant.  "

text: रात्रौ उपस्थितां दरिद्रतां सः वधूनिर्दिष्टम् एव वरम् अयाचत।
en_dmt: "When poverty presented itself that night, he requested a husband, just as the woman had directed.  "

text: दरिद्रता निराशा भूत्वा कथितवती- "श्रेष्ठिन्! तथास्तु। किन्तु अधुना तव गृहे अहं कदापि न वत्स्यामि, यतो हि यत्र द्वेषकलहौ तिष्ठतः- अहं तत्र एव वसामि"
en_dmt: "Poverty, having become hopeless, said: \"O merchant! So be it. But now, I will never live in your house, because wherever hatred and strife exist, I live there.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: दरिद्रता श्रेष्ठिनं रामधनं स्वप्ने किं कथितवती ?
en_dmt: "What did poverty tell the wealthy Rāmadhana in a dream?  "

text: श्रेष्ठी तदा दरिद्रतां किम् उदतरत् ?
en_dmt: "Then, how did the wealthy merchant overcome poverty?  "

text: पुत्रवधूः श्रेष्ठिनं दरिद्रतां कीदृशं वरं याचितुम् अकथयत् ?
en_dmt: "What kind of boon did the daughter-in-law ask of the wealthy man regarding poverty?  "

text: तस्य वरस्य याचनया दरिद्रता श्रेष्ठिनं किं कथितवती ?
en_dmt: "What did poverty say to the wealthy man because of his request for that boon?  "

text: दरिद्रता लक्ष्मीः च कुत्र कुत्र तिष्ठतः ?
en_dmt: "Where do poverty and prosperity reside?  "

text: निषेधे अपि स्वाधिकारः
en_dmt: "Even in prohibition, one has one's own authority.  "

text: निषेधेऽप्यधिकारं स्वं, मन्यन्ते दुर्धियो जनाः। हस्तक्षेपं परस्यास्मिन्‌, न सहन्ते कदापि ते॥
en_dmt: "\"Foolish people, even when forbidden, consider it their right; they never tolerate the interference of another in this matter.\"  "

text: मन्दिरात् प्रत्यागच्छन्ती वृद्धा स्वगृहात् परावर्तमानं भिक्षुकं दृष्ट्वा तम् अपृच्छत्- "किं किञ्चित् प्राप्तम्?"
en_dmt: "Returning from the temple, an old woman saw a beggar returning from her own house and asked him, \"Did you get anything?\"  "

text: भिक्षुकः उदतरत्- "नहि किञ्चित् अपि न। वधूः महाशया न्यषेधीत्।"
en_dmt: "The mendicant replied: \"No, not at all.\" The noble bride forbade it.  "

text: वृद्धा सरोषं कथितवती- "एेवं कथं सम्भवति? वध्वै निषेद्धुं कः अधिकारः? मया सह चल्यताम्।"
en_dmt: "The old woman angrily said: \"How can this be? What right does the daughter-in-law have to forbid [this]? Come with me!\"  "

text: भिक्षुकः ततः प्राप्त्याशया ताम् अनुगृहं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "The mendicant, then, with the hope of obtaining (something), went to that house.  "

text: तत्र वृद्धा भिक्षुकम् अभिमुखी अवदत्  "अरे! इतः ते किञ्चित् न दास्यते। परावर्तस्व। अन्यत्र कुत्रचित् यतस्व।"
en_dmt: "There, an old woman, facing the mendicant monk, said: “Hey! You will not be given anything here. Turn back. Try somewhere else.”  "

text: विस्मितः भिक्षुकः निराशः सन् रिक्तहस्तः एव ततः न्यवर्तत इति।
en_dmt: "Astonished, the mendicant, being disappointed, returned empty-handed from there.  "

text: वृद्धायाः प्रश्नस्य उत्तरं भिक्षुकः किं दत्तवान्?
en_dmt: "What answer did the mendicant give to the old woman's question?  "

text: तदा वृद्धा भिक्षुकं किं कर्तुं कथितवती?
en_dmt: "Then, what did the old nun tell the monk to do?  "

text: गृहं प्राप्तं भिक्षुकं वृद्धा किं कथयित्वा परावर्त्तयत्?

text: दुर्धियः जनाः कीदृशाः भवन्ति?
en_dmt: "What kind of people are the unwise?  "

text: दीनार्तवचसा कोऽपि, भगवन्तं स्तवीत चेत्। तर्हि तं स परित्रातुं, स्वयं सद्यः समैति हि॥
en_dmt: "If someone in distress and afflicted speaks words of praise to the Blessed One (Bhagavān), then He Himself quickly comes to protect him.  "

text: "महाग्राहेण गृहीतपादः गजराजः यदा ततः मोचयितुम् आर्तस्वरेण भगवन्तं प्रार्थितवान्, तदा तत्क्षणम् एव भगवान्‌ स्वकीये सु?दृढे आरक्षिविभागे विद्यमाने अपि कथम् एकाकी एव तं परित्रातुम् उपस्थितः?"
en_dmt: "When the elephant king, whose foot was seized by a powerful crocodile (mahāgraha), then prayed to the Blessed One with a distressed cry to be released from that, why did the Blessed One, even though his own strong and well-established security force was present, appear alone to rescue him at that very moment?  "

text: श्रावकस्य इमं प्रश्नं समाधातुं कथावाचकः दृष्टान्तम् इमं प्रस्तुतवान् -
en_dmt: "To answer this question of the disciple (śrāvaka), the storyteller (kathāvācaka) presented this example (dṛṣṭānta):  "

text: "एकः राजा सपरिवारः नौकाविहारार्थं मनः कृतवान्। तेन सह प्रमुखाः राज्याधिकारिणः आरक्षिणः अङ्गरक्षिणः अपि आसन्। मन्त्री चतुरः अवर्तत। राजकुमारस्य स्थाने तत्सदृशी एव मधूच्छिष्टनिर्मिता एका आकृतिः कुशलमूर्तिकारेण निर्मापिता अन्यस्यां नौकायां स्थापिता अभूत्। नाविकः मन्त्रिणा तथा सन्दिष्टः आसीत् यथा सः नद्यां मध्येप्रवाहं प्राप्नुयात्, नौकां तथा कुर्यात् यथा राजकुमारः निपत्य निमज्जतु। नाविकः एवम् एव कृतवान्। राजकुमारं निपतितं दृष्ट्वा राजा तत्क्षणम् एव तं रक्षितुं नद्यां कूर्दितवान्।"
en_dmt: "Once, a king, along with his family, decided to go for a boat ride. Along with him were prominent state officials, guards, and bodyguards. The minister was clever. In place of the prince, a likeness made of beeswax was crafted by a skilled sculptor and placed in another boat. The boatman was instructed by the minister to navigate the boat to the middle of the river and then maneuver the boat in such a way that the prince would fall and drown. The boatman did exactly that. Seeing the prince fall, the king immediately jumped into the river to save him.  "

text: अनेन दृष्टान्तेन कथावाचकः समसाधयत् यत् यथा अन्येषु आत्मीयेषु विद्यमानेषु अपि राजा स्वयम् एव पुत्रं परित्रातुं समुद्यतः, तथा एव भगवान् अपि गजराजं रक्षितुं स्वयम् एव एकाकी उपस्थितः अभूत् इति।
en_dmt: "With this example, the storyteller proved that just as, even with other relatives present, the king himself was ready to rescue his son, so too, the Lord himself appeared alone to protect the elephant king.  "

text: श्रावकः कथावाचकं किं पृष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did the disciple ask the preacher?  "

text: कथावाचकः श्रावकं कं दृष्टान्तं श्रावयित्वा सन्तोषितवान् ?
en_dmt: "What example did the storyteller tell to the disciple to make him happy?  "

text: भगवान् रक्षणाय कदा समायाति ?
en_dmt: "When will the Blessed One come for protection?  "

text: किम् आर्तप्रार्थना व्यर्था भवति ?
en_dmt: "Is a distressed person's prayer in vain?  "

text: अनया कथया कीदृशः सन्देशः दीयते ?
en_dmt: "What kind of message is given by this story?  "

text: अनिष्टं न चिन्त्यं, न च कार्यम् एव
en_dmt: "The undesirable should not be thought of, nor should it be done.  "

text: नानिष्टं कस्यचिच्चिन्त्यं, नापि तत्कार्यमेव च। दग्ध्वा शुष्काणि पत्राणि, दग्धानि हरितान्यपि॥
en_dmt: "One should not think of anything bad for anyone, nor should one do it. Having burnt the dry leaves, the green ones are also burnt.  "

text: ग्रामसीमातः बहिः एकः पिप्पलवृक्षः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Outside the village boundary, there was a *pippala* tree (a Ficus religiosa tree).  "

text: पथिकेभ्यः सः विश्रामस्थानम् अभवत्।
en_dmt: "He became a resting place for travelers.  "

text: रात्रौ पक्षिणः अपि तस्मिन् आश्रयं प्राप्नुवन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "Even birds found shelter in it at night.  "

text: तस्य कानिचित् पत्राणि पीतवर्णानि शुष्कप्रायाणि च अजायन्त।
en_dmt: "Some of its leaves became yellow and almost dry.  "

text: यानि हरितपत्राणि तत्र आसन्, तानि शुष्कपत्राणाम् अवस्थानं स्वसमीपे नैव अवाञ्छन्।
en_dmt: "The green leaves that were there did not want the dry leaves to remain near them.  "

text: अतः परस्परं सम्मिल्य प्रकम्पमानानि तानि स्ववायुना शुष्कपत्राणि नीचैः अपातयन्।
en_dmt: "Therefore, uniting together and trembling, they cast down those dry leaves with their own wind.  "

text: तस्मिन् एव समये एकः पथिकः आगत्य तत्र विश्रमितुं प्रवृत्तः, धूमवर्त्तिकां च प्रज्वाल्य ज्वलन्तीम् एव दीपशलाकां पार्श्वे पत्रेषु न्यपातयत्।
en_dmt: "At that very moment, a traveler came and began to rest there, and having lit a cigarette, he dropped the burning splinter of wood onto the leaves nearby.  "

text: पत्राणि ज्वलन्ति दृष्ट्वा वृक्षस्थानि पत्राणि अतिप्रसन्नानि अभवन्।
en_dmt: "Having seen the leaves ablaze, the leaves on the trees became exceedingly delighted.  "

text: क्षणे एव च सर्वाणि अपि तानि प्रज्वालयितुं पुनः सम्भूय वायुं तीव्रं कृतवन्ति।
en_dmt: "And in an instant, they all gathered together again and made the wind intense in order to ignite them.  "

text: अनेन वृक्षः अपि प्रदग्धः, सह एव च तत्रत्यानि तानि हरितपत्राणि अपि इति।
en_dmt: "By this, even the tree was burned, along with the green leaves that were there.  "

text: पिप्पलवृक्षहरितपत्राणि किम् अकुर्वन्?
en_dmt: "What did the green leaves of the *pippala* tree do?  "

text: दीपशलाकां पत्रेषु कः न्यपातयत्?
en_dmt: "Who dropped the burning torch on the leaves?  "

text: अनेन दीपशलाकानिपातेन किम् अभवत्?
en_dmt: "What happened by the falling of this lamp-stick?  "

text: अनिष्टचिन्तनेन किं भवति?
en_dmt: "What is the result of thinking about what is undesirable?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: शासकानुवर्ती शासितः
en_dmt: "The governed one follows the ruler.  "

text: शासको गुणयुक्तश्चेत्, सर्वः सम्पद्यते गुणी। अमुष्मिंश्चान्यथा भूते, सर्वो भवति तादृशः ॥
en_dmt: "If the ruler is endowed with virtues (guṇa), everyone becomes virtuous (guṇī). If he becomes otherwise, everyone becomes like that.  "

text: आसीत् एकः राजा।
en_dmt: "There was a king. (rājā āsīt)  "

text: सर्वगुणसम्पन्नः अपि सः स्वस्य अवगुणान् वक्तुं प्रथमं कर्मचारिणः अकथयत्।
en_dmt: "Even though he was endowed with all virtues (sarvaguṇasampannaḥ), he first told his staff about his own faults (avaguṇān).  "

text: किन्तु कञ्चित् अपि अवगुणं ते तस्मिन् नैव दर्शितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "But they did not show any fault in him at all.  "

text: राजा जनतायां घोषणाम् अकारयत् यत् राज्ञि अवगुणदर्शकः राजतः भूयांसं पुरस्कारं प्राप्स्यति।
en_dmt: "The king made a proclamation to the people that whoever points out a fault in the king will receive a great reward from the king.  "

text: परन्तु जनतायाः अपि काचित् व्यक्तिः राज्ञः अवगुणान् नैव दर्शितवती।
en_dmt: "But not even a single person from the populace pointed out the king's faults.  "

text: तेन निराशः राजा स्वयम् एव आत्मीयम् अवगुणज्ञं द्रष्टुं निःसृतः।
en_dmt: "Disappointed by that, the king himself went out to see his own fault-finder.  "

text: अस्मिन् प्रसङ्गे सः एकं महात्मानं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "In this context, he attained a great soul (mahātman).  "

text: महात्मा आश्रमस्थवृक्षतः एकं फलं त्रोटयित्वा तेन तं राजानं सत्कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "The great being, having plucked a fruit from a tree in the hermitage, honored the king with it.  "

text: राजा फलस्य अनास्वादितपूर्वं माधुर्यं यदा भूरि प्राशंसत्, तदा महात्मा अकथयत् यत् "सद्‌गुणवतः राज्ञः शासने सर्वं सद्‌गुणमयम् एव सम्पद्यते।"
en_dmt: "When the king greatly praised the sweetness of the fruit, which he had never tasted before, the great soul said, \"In the reign of a virtuous king (sadguṇavataḥ rājñaḥ), everything becomes full of virtue (sadguṇamayam).\"  "

text: राजा जिज्ञासितवान् यत्- "किं दुर्गुणवति राज्ञि एवं न भवति?"
en_dmt: "The king inquired, \"Does this not happen in a king who possesses bad qualities?\"  "

text: महात्मा समाधानम् अकरोत्- "आम्, तदा सर्वम् एव नीरसं निःसारं च जायते।"
en_dmt: "The great soul made a resolution: \"Yes, then everything becomes tasteless and without essence.\"  "

text: राज्ञे स्वप्रश्नस्य उत्तरं मिलितम् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The king had found the answer to his question.  "

text: सः महात्मानं सादरं सम्पूज्य प्रणम्य च परावृत्तः इति।
en_dmt: "Having respectfully worshiped the magnanimous one and having bowed, he returned, thus.  "

text: राजा कर्मचारिणः किं कर्तुम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the king tell the officials to do?  "

text: महात्मानं राजा  किम् अपृच्छत्?
en_dmt: "What did the king ask the high-souled one (mahātmā)?  "

text: राज्ञे किं दत्त्वा महात्मा तस्य सत्कारं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the high-minded one give to the king, having shown him honor?  "

text: राज्ञः का जिज्ञासा आसीत्, तस्याः समाधनं महात्मा किं कथयित्वा अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What was the king's question, and what did the great soul say to resolve it?  "

text: किं शासितः शासकम् अनुकरोति?
en_dmt: "Does the one who is ruled imitate the ruler?  "

text: जीवद्‌भ्यः अपि मृतः वन्द्यः
en_dmt: "Even among the living, the dead one is worthy of veneration.  "

text: जीवद्‌भ्योऽपि जनेभ्यः स, वन्द्यतां मृतगर्दभः। पट्टीं विभाजनार्थं यो, निर्ममेऽध्वनि सर्पितुम्॥
en_dmt: "That dead donkey is worthy of veneration, even more than living people, because it created a path on the road for snakes to crawl on, in order to divide the road.  "

text: राजमार्गे समुचितयातायातव्यवस्थायाः अभावेन वाहनानां मिथः सङ्घर्षणेन विपुलजनधनहानिः भवति स्म।
en_dmt: "Due to the lack of a proper traffic system on the royal road (rājamārga), there was a great loss of life and property due to the collision of vehicles.  "

text: प्रतिवेशिवसतिवासिनः एतादृशेषु अवसरेषु मार्गावरोधं कृत्वा स्वकीयं रोषं प्रकटयन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "The neighbors, residents, on such occasions, would block the road and express their anger.  "

text: किन्तु प्रशासनतः तेभ्यः आश्वासनतः अतिरिक्तं किम् अपि नैव मिलितम्।
en_dmt: "But from the government, they received nothing more than assurances.  "

text: एकदा कुम्भकारस्य गर्दभः कस्यचित् भारिवाहनस्य प्रहारेण मृतः।
en_dmt: "Once, a potter's donkey died from the blow of someone carrying a heavy load.  "

text: अस्मिन् वारे अपि मार्गावरोधः अभूत्।
en_dmt: "Even this time, there was an obstruction of the path.  "

text: किन्तु यथापूर्वं मधुराश्वासनदानेन एकार्धघण्टायाम् एव वाहनानां गमनम् आगमनं प्रारब्धम्।
en_dmt: "But, as before, with sweet assurances and gifts, the coming and going of vehicles was started in just one and a half hours.  "

text: मृतः गर्दभः मार्गमध्ये पतितः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "A dead donkey had fallen in the middle of the road.  "

text: तस्य इतस्ततः पार्श्वतः निःसरणं भवति स्म।
en_dmt: "It was moving out from here and there, from its sides.  "

text: "एकः मृतः गर्दभः विभाजनपट्टिकायाः निर्माणं कृत्वा यत् कार्यं कृतवान्- तत् कार्यम् अधुनावधि अनेके जीवन्तः अपि गर्दभाः नैव कृतवन्तः"
en_dmt: "\"The work that a single dead donkey accomplished by creating a dividing panel, that work even many living donkeys have not done until now.\"  "

text: इयम्‌ आसीत् जने जने चर्चा इति।
en_dmt: "This was the talk among people, it is said.  "

text: राजमार्गे जनधनहानेः कारणं किम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the reason for the loss of life and property on the royal road?  "

text: वसतिवासिनः स्वीयं रोषं कथं प्रकटयन्ति स्म?
en_dmt: "How did the resident monks express their anger?  "

text: द्वितीयवारं मार्गावरोधः किम् अभवत्?
en_dmt: "What was the obstruction of the path the second time?  "

text: विभाजनपट्टिकायाः कार्यं कः कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "Who made the function of the spreadsheet?  "

text: जने जने कीदृशी चर्चा आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What sort of discussion was there among the people?  "

text: वाणी नैव दूष्या
en_dmt: "Speech should not be defiled.  "

text: ईश्वरेण प्रदत्तेयं, वाणी सर्वार्थसाधिका । परनिन्दावचोभिर्न, क्षीणशक्तिर्विधीयताम्॥
en_dmt: "This speech, given by the Lord, accomplishes all aims. Let it not be deprived of its power by words of slander against others.  "

text: एकः अध्यात्ममार्गीजनः गीतोपदेशानुसारेण मानापमानयोः दशायाम् अपि क्रोधरहितः भवितुं कठिनां साधनां कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "One spiritual seeker, following the teachings of the Gītā, undertook the difficult practice of being without anger even in situations of honor and dishonor.  "

text: आत्मनः परीक्षां दातुं सः काश्यां हिन्दुविश्वविद्यालयस्य प्रतिष्ठापकं सनातनधर्मावलम्बिनं भारतीयसंस्कृतसंस्कृत्योः प्रबलं समर्थकं पण्डितश्रीमदनमोहन मालवीयम् उपगतः।
en_dmt: "To give his examination, he approached Pandit Shri Madan Mohan Malaviya, the founder of the Hindu University in Kashi, a follower of *sanātana dharma* (eternal religion), and a strong supporter of Indian culture and Sanskrit.  "

text: तत्र स्वाभिप्रायं प्रकटयन् सः कथितवान् "परमादरणीय पण्डितप्रवर! मया क्रोधरहितः स्थातुं साधना कृता अस्ति। कृपया मां निन्दावचोभिः उत्तेज्य प्रकोप्य परीक्षतां तु तावत्, मम तत्र कियती न्यूनता वर्तते? अहं ज्ञातुं शक्नुयाम्।"
en_dmt: "There, revealing his intention, he said: \"Most venerable and excellent scholar! I have practiced to remain without anger. Please, test me by provoking and irritating me with words of blame, so that I may know how much deficiency there is in me.\"  "

text: श्रीमालवीयः महाराजः तं प्रणम्य सविनयम् इदम् एव प्रत्यवदत्- "भवन्तं परीक्षितुम् अहं स्वां पवित्रां वाणीं किमर्थम् अपवित्रां कुर्याम्? कृपया क्षमतां मां तावत्"
en_dmt: "Śrī Mālavīya, the great king, having bowed to him, replied humbly thus: \"Why should I defile my pure speech in order to test you? Please forgive me.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: अध्यात्ममार्गी किमर्थं साधनां कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "Why did the spiritual seeker engage in practice?  "

text: सः कुत्र कस्य समीपे अगच्छत्?
en_dmt: "Where did he go, and to whose presence?  "

text: श्रीमदनमोहनमालवीयम् अध्यात्ममार्गी किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did Śrī Madan Mohan Malaviya say about the spiritual path (adhyātma-mārga)?  "

text: श्रीमालवीयः तम् अध्यात्ममार्गिणं किं प्रत्यवदत्?
en_dmt: "What did Śrīmālavīya reply to that follower of the path of the Self (adhyātma-mārga)?  "

text: सर्वार्थराधिका का अस्ति?
en_dmt: "What is the fulfiller of all aims?  "

text: आत्महत्या महापापम्
en_dmt: "Suicide is a great sin (mahāpāpa).  "

text: आत्माहत्या महापापं, मृतोऽपि नैव शान्तिभाक्। जीवितः सुखमाप्नोति, त्यज्यतां स्वं न पौरुषम्॥
en_dmt: "Suicide is a great sin; even in death, one does not attain peace. While alive, one obtains happiness; one's own strength should not be abandoned.  "

text: "अरे रे! किम् इदं क्रियते? आत्महत्या तु महत् पापम्। विरम्यतां, विरम्यताम्"
en_dmt: "\"Hey, hey! What is this being done? Suicide is a great sin. Cease, cease!\"  "

text: अकस्मात् महात्मनः उद्बोधनं श्रुत्वा किङ्‌कर्तव्यविमूढः पुरुषः गलपाशं विमुच्य अकथयत्- "महात्मन्!  किं क्रियताम् ? निर्धनतातः मरणम् एव वरम्। निर्धनं मां कुटुम्बिनः अपि नैव रोचयन्ति।"
en_dmt: "Suddenly, hearing the awakening of the great being (mahātman), the man, bewildered as to what to do, released the noose and said: \"Great being (mahātman)! What should be done? Death is better than poverty. Even my family does not like me because I am poor.\"  "

text: "सत्यं निर्धनता अभिशापः। किन्तु इयं न दैवी, अपि तु मानुषी एव। अहं तव निर्धनतां दूरीकर्तुं सहायतां करोमि। अस्ति मम एकः व्यवसायी भक्तः। ततः तुभ्यं यथेच्छं धनं दापयिष्यामि।एतत्कृते त्वया आत्मनः अक्षिद्वयात् हस्तद्वयात् पादद्वयात् च एकैकम् अङ्गं दत्वा अवशिष्टेन एकैकेन एव अङ्गेन स्वकीयं कार्यं चालनीयम्। किम् इदं त्वं करिष्यसि?"
en_dmt: "Truthfully, poverty is a curse (abhishāpaḥ). But this is not divine (daivī), but rather human (mānushī) indeed. I will help you to remove your poverty. I have one merchant devotee (bhaktaḥ). From him, I will cause you to be given wealth as you desire (yathecchaṃ dhanam). For this, by giving one limb each from your two eyes, two hands, and two feet, you must manage your work with only one remaining limb. Will you do this?  "

text: महात्मा तम् अपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "The great being asked him. (mahātmā tam apṛcchat)  "

text: "नहि नहि महाराज! इदं तु केनापि मूल्येन न दास्यामि। सर्वथा इदं दुर्लभं मन्ये"
en_dmt: "\"No, no, Great King! I will not give this away for any price. I consider this to be very rare in every way.\"  "

text: पुरुषः उदतरत्।
en_dmt: "The man arose.  "

text: "तर्हि मुग्ध! यदा त्वम् इयतः अद्वितीयस्य अनुपमस्य विशालधनराशेः स्वामी असि, तदा त्वं निर्धनः कथम्? विचारय भगवता परमात्मना कुबेरवत् विरचितः धनाढ्यः त्वं कथम् इयान् निराशः? पुरुषः असि। पौरुषं धारय। परमात्मनः अद्भुतं निधिम् आत्मानं च सुरक्ष। स्मर, आत्महत्याकारी मरणोत्तरम् अपि शान्तिं न प्राप्नोति।"
en_dmt: "\"Then, foolish one! If you are the master of such a unique, incomparable, vast treasure, then how are you poor? Consider, how can you, who have been made wealthy like Kubera by the blessed Supreme Self (paramātman), be so hopeless? You are a man. Hold onto your manhood (pauruṣam dhāraya). Protect the wonderful treasure of the Supreme Self (paramātman) and yourself. Remember, a suicide does not attain peace even after death.\"  "

text: महात्मनः अनेन उपदेशेन शान्तमनाः पुरुषः साष्टाङ्गं तं प्रणम्य तूष्णीं गृहं प्रति प्रस्थितः, महात्मा अपि च अग्रे प्रचलितः इति।
en_dmt: "By this instruction of the great-souled one, the man, with a pacified mind, having prostrated to him with eight limbs, silently departed towards his home; the great-souled one also proceeded onward.  "

text: महात्मनः उद्बोधनं कीदृशम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the awakening of the great-minded one like?  "

text: पुरुषः तं किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the man say to him?  "

text: महात्मा तं किं कर्तुं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the great being tell him to do?  "

text: किं पुरुषः महात्मनः कथनानुसारं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the man do according to the words of the great soul (mahātman)?  "

text: महापापं किम् अस्ति?
en_dmt: "What is a great sin?  "

text: इच्छाः दुःखदाः सदा
en_dmt: "Desires are always the cause of suffering.  "

text: इच्छानां नास्ति कोऽप्यन्तः, पूर्तिस्तासां न सम्भवा । आदावन्ते सदुःखास्ता, अतस्तासु रमेत कः? ॥
en_dmt: "There is no end to desires, nor is their fulfillment possible. They are always painful in the beginning and the end, so who would delight in them?  "

text: सुरसामुखम् इव एकतः वर्धमाना महार्घता, द्रौपदीशाटिका इव अन्यतः अन्तहीना नित्यं नवनवानाम् उपभोग्यवस्तूनां लिप्सा, द्वाभ्याम् अपि उत्पीडितः सुरेशः गृहत्यागे एव कल्याणम्‌ अमन्यत।
en_dmt: "Like the mouth of Surasā, expending limitlessly on one hand, and like the garment of Draupadī, the desire for ever-new consumable goods, never coming to an end on the other hand, oppressed by both, Sureśa thought it best to renounce his household.  "

text: विना सूचनादानं सः एकवारं यः निर्गतः -निर्गतः एव।
en_dmt: "Without giving notice, he left once and for all – simply left.  "

text: पश्चात् तस्य पत्न्या पुत्रेण च पत्रम् एकं प्राप्तं - यत्र कुतः कुतः कियत् कियत् च तेन ऋणं गृहीतम् आसीत् ? तस्य विवरणं दत्तम् अभवत्।
en_dmt: "Afterwards, his wife and son received a letter in which a detailed account was given of how much debt he had taken from where and from whom.  "

text: ऋणशोधनार्थं तस्मिन् पत्रे निर्दिष्टम् आसीत्‌।
en_dmt: "It was specified in that letter for the purpose of repaying the debt.  "

text: द्वौ अपि मातापुत्रौ तं पूर्वं नगरे एव, तदनन्तरं बहिरपि सम्बन्धिषु अन्विष्टवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "Both mother and son searched for him first in the city, and then even outside [the city] among [their] relatives.  "

text: परन्तु सः नैव मिलितः।
en_dmt: "But he was never met.  "

text: अन्ते निराशौ भूत्वा विंशतिपञ्चविंशतिवर्षाणि एवम् एव यापितवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "In the end, having become hopeless, they spent twenty or twenty-five years just like that.  "

text: ततः तीर्थयात्रायै कृतविचारौ तौ बदरीनाथधाम प्राप्तौ।
en_dmt: "Then, having resolved on a pilgrimage, they reached Badarīnāthadhāma.  "

text: तत्र भिक्षुषु एकं भिक्षुकं दृष्ट्वा पुत्रः स्थितः, माता च अपि निर्निमेषं तं पश्यन्ती ततः पदम् एकम् अपि न प्रचलिता।
en_dmt: "There, among the monks, the son stood, having seen a certain monk, and the mother, also gazing at him without blinking, did not move even a step from there.  "

text: भिक्षुः अपि किञ्चित् स्मरन् इव ताम् एव स्थितिम् आपन्नः।
en_dmt: "The bhikṣu, as if remembering something, entered into that very state.  "

text: अन्ते माता किञ्चित् वक्तुम् उद्यता, तावत् एव भिक्षुः "हा पुत्र रमेश !"
en_dmt: "In the end, the mother was about to say something, but just then the monk cried, \"Alas, son Rameśa!\"  "

text: इति उच्चारयन् एव निष्प्राणः अभवत्।
en_dmt: "Saying this, he became lifeless.  "

text: अधुना तु मातापुत्रौ 'अयम् एव मे पतिदेवः, अयम् एव मे पिता'
en_dmt: "But now, the mother and son [think], \"This one alone is my lord and husband, this one alone is my father.\"  "

text: इति अवगत्य अत्यन्तं पश्चात्तपन्तौ तत्र एव पुरोहितस्य एकस्य साहाय्येन तस्य सर्वम् अपि और्ध्वदैहिकं कर्म यथाविधि सम्पादितवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "Having understood this, and repenting greatly, with the help of a certain priest, they performed all of his funeral rites (aurdhvadaika karma) according to the proper procedure there.  "

text: तत्र तत्रत्याः सर्वेऽपि तस्य सहचराः भिक्षुकाः सम्मिलिताः अजायन्त इति।
en_dmt: "There, all of his companions, the mendicant monks, gathered together.  "

text: सुरेशः गृहत्यागं किम् अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "Why did Sureśa renounce household life?  "

text: तस्य पत्रं प्राप्य तस्य पत्नी पुत्रः च किम् अकुरुताम् ?
en_dmt: "Having received his letter, what did his wife and son do?  "

text: माता पुत्रः च सुरेशं कुत्र प्राप्तवन्तौ ?
en_dmt: "Where did the mother and son find Sureśa?  "

text: सुरेशः निष्प्राणः किम् उच्चारयन् अभवत् ?
en_dmt: "What did Sureśa utter when he became lifeless?  "

text: इच्छाः कीदृश्यः भवन्ति ?
en_dmt: "What kind of desires are there?  "

text: सतीसाध्वीचमत्कारः
en_dmt: "The miracle of a virtuous and chaste woman.  "

text: सती साध्वी स्वशीलेन, रक्षिता भवति स्वयम्। अन्यांश्चापि दयायुक्ता, जगन्मातेव रक्षति॥
en_dmt: "A virtuous and chaste woman, by her own conduct, protects herself. And full of compassion for others, she protects [them] like the mother of the world.  "

text: उपवने विचरणं कुर्वन् राजकुमारः एकेन विषधरेण दष्टः अभूत्।
en_dmt: "While wandering in the garden, the prince was bitten by a venomous snake.  "

text: अचेतनं तं तस्य सहचराः राज्ञे निवेदितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "His companions informed the king that he was unconscious.  "

text: सम्पूर्णे राजपरिवारे शोकः आच्छन्नः।
en_dmt: "Grief overwhelmed the entire royal family.  "

text: एकमात्रं सः एव राज्ञः प्रियतमः उत्तराधिकारी आसीत्।
en_dmt: "He was the king's only, and most beloved, heir.  "

text: राजवैद्याः तस्य चिकित्साम् अकुर्वन्।
en_dmt: "The royal physicians treated him.  "

text: किन्तु सफलता नैव मिलिता।
en_dmt: "But success was not attained.  "

text: राजज्योतिषिणा तस्य दीर्घायुष्यं जन्मपत्रतः दृष्ट्वा एकः उपायः कथितः यत् यदि काचित् सती साध्वी स्त्री राजकुमारं दष्टस्थाने स्पृशेत् तर्हि अयं स्वस्थः भवेत्।
en_dmt: "Having seen the prince's longevity in his horoscope, a royal astrologer suggested a remedy: that if some virtuous and chaste woman were to touch the place where the prince was bitten, then he would become healthy.  "

text: राज्ञः अनेकपत्न्यः आसन्।
en_dmt: "The king had many wives.  "

text: राजकुमारस्य जननी अपि तासु एका आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The prince's mother was also one of them.  "

text: सा प्रथमं ततः च क्रमशः सर्वाः अपि राज्ञ्यः राजकुमारं स्पृष्टवत्यः।
en_dmt: "Then first, and successively thereafter, all the queens touched the prince.  "

text: किन्तु राजकुमारस्य चेतना नैव आयाता।
en_dmt: "But consciousness did not return to the prince.  "

text: अनेन राज्ञीनाम् असतीत्वम् अपि प्रकटितम् अभूत्।
en_dmt: "By this, the unchastity of the queens was also revealed.  "

text: पुरस्कारलोभेन राज्यस्य अन्याभिः अपि महिलाभिः चेष्टा कृता।
en_dmt: "Other women also made efforts for the kingdom, out of greed for rewards.  "

text: किन्तु ताः अपि विफलाः एव अतिष्ठन्।
en_dmt: "But those also remained useless.  "

text: अन्ते तेन एव राजज्योतिषिणा राजा निवेदितः यत् अधुना एव राज्यसीमायाम् एका युवतिः स्वस्य पत्या सह प्रविष्टा अस्ति।
en_dmt: "Finally, the king was informed by that very royal astrologer: \"Just now, a young woman has entered the border of the kingdom with her husband.\"  "

text: कदाचित् सा कार्यं साधयेत्।
en_dmt: "Perhaps she will accomplish the effect.  "

text: राजा एकाकी एव ताम् आनेतुं निर्गतः।
en_dmt: "The king went out alone to bring her back.  "

text: ताम् उपेत्य सः अनुनयं विनयं कृत्वा राजभवनम् आनीतवान्।
en_dmt: "Having approached her, and having made entreaties and requests, he brought her to the royal palace.  "

text: तस्याः स्पर्शमात्रेण राजकुमारः तत्क्षणम् एव सुप्तोत्थितः इव जागरितः।
en_dmt: "By merely touching her, the prince instantly awoke as if from sleep.  "

text: सर्वेषां हर्षेण मुखकमलानि विकसितानि अजायन्त।
en_dmt: "The lotus-like faces of all of them blossomed with joy.  "

text: विरक्तः राजा स्वीयं राज्यार्धं ताभ्यां दम्पतिभ्याम् अवशिष्टं च आत्मजाय समर्प्य तपः तप्तुं वनं प्रस्थितः इति।
en_dmt: "Detached, the king, having entrusted half of his own kingdom to that couple and the remainder to his son, departed to the forest to perform austerities.  "

text: अचेतनं राजकुमारं स्वस्थं कर्तुं ज्योतिषी कम् उपायं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What remedy did the astrologer suggest to restore the unconscious prince to health?  "

text: राजकुमारस्य जनन्या अन्याभिः राज्ञीभिः महिलाभिः च स्पृष्टः राजकुमारः किं स्वस्थः
en_dmt: "Is the prince, having been touched by the prince's mother, other queens, and women, well?  "

text: अभवत्?
en_dmt: "It occurred.  "

text: राजकुमारः कस्याः स्पर्शेन सचेतनः अभवत्?
en_dmt: "By the touch of which [woman] did the prince become conscious?  "

text: राजा तदा किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the king do then?  "

text: सती साध्वी किं करोति?
en_dmt: "What does a virtuous and chaste woman do?  "

text: मातापितरौ पूज्यौ
en_dmt: "Mother and father should be worshipped.  "

text: तौ मातापितरौ पूज्यौ, पार्वतीशङ्‌कराविव । यतो जातो हि सन्तान, आजीवनं प्रमोदते ॥
en_dmt: "Those parents are venerable, like Pārvatī and Śaṅkara, because the lineage is born from them, and [one] rejoices throughout life.  "

text: सुरेशः विधुरः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Sureśa was distressed.  "

text: सेवनिवृत्या सह तस्य धर्मपत्नी अपि दिवङ्गता अभूत्।
en_dmt: "With the cessation of service, his virtuous wife (dharma-patnī) also passed away.  "

text: इदानीं तेन पुत्रवध्वोः एव अवलम्बनं ग्रहीतव्यं जातम्।
en_dmt: "Now, he had to take refuge in his son and daughter-in-law.  "

text: आयुः कस्यापि स्थिरं न तिष्ठति।
en_dmt: "The life of no one remains stable.  "

text: वृद्धावस्थया सह क्षयरोगः तम् आक्रान्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Consumption seized him together with old age.  "

text: कफकासाभ्यां पीडितं तं पुत्रवधूः अधिकं सेवितुं श्रान्ता अजायत।
en_dmt: "The daughter-in-law, weary of excessively attending to him, became tired of [him] afflicted by cough and phlegm.  "

text: वाचा सा किञ्चित् कर्कशा आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Her speech was somewhat harsh.  "

text: एकस्मिन् दिने सा स्वभर्तारं कथितवती- "दृश्यताम्, अग्रे पितृसेवा मया कर्तुं न पारयिष्यते। पिता भवतः अस्ति। भवान् एव तस्य कफमलमूत्रादिकं स्वच्छं करोतु। चिकित्सया अपि लाभः न दृश्यते। अधुना तु भवान् इमं क्वचित् गङ्गातटे नीत्वा भगवदाश्रये एव परित्यजतु। अन्ते अपि तु तत्र एव अस्य अस्थिसञ्चयः प्रवाह्यः अस्ति। यदि एवं न करोति, तर्हि अहं स्वपितृगृहं गच्छामि उत अत्र एव अनशनं कृत्वा प्राणान् परित्यजामि।"
en_dmt: "One day she said to her husband: \"Look, I will not be able to serve your father any longer. Your father is here. You alone should clean his phlegm, feces, urine, and so on. No benefit is seen even with medical treatment. Now, take him somewhere to the banks of the Ganges and abandon him to the refuge of the Lord. In the end, his collection of bones must be scattered there. If you do not do this, then I will go to my father's house, or I will give up my life here by fasting.\"  "

text: पत्न्याः इमां तर्जनाम् आकर्ण्य भर्ता स्वं पितरं रात्रौ एव चिकित्सकं दर्शयितुं मिषेण स्वपृष्ठे उपावेश्य गङ्गातटे नीत्वा एकस्य पिप्पलवृक्षस्य अधस्तात् अवतार्य यथा एव गृहं प्रति निर्वर्तितुम् उद्यतः अभवत्, तथा एव पिता अति उच्चैः उपाहसत्।
en_dmt: "Having heard this threat from his wife, the husband, on the pretext of showing his father to a physician that very night, made him sit on his back, took him to the bank of the Ganges, and having made him descend under a *pippala* tree, as he was about to return home, the father laughed very loudly.  "

text: पुत्रः तं यदा तस्य एवं हसनस्य कारणं पृष्टवान्, तदा पिता अकथयत्- "वत्स! अहम् अपि त्वम् इव अत्र एव स्वीयं वृद्धं रुग्णं पितरं त्यक्तवान् आसम्। तथा एव अधुना स्वयम् अनुभवामि। क्वचित् त्वां .............।"
en_dmt: "When the son asked him the reason for laughing like that, then the father said, \"My dear son! I too, just like you, had abandoned my own old and sick father right here. I am experiencing the same thing myself now. Somewhere, you...  "

text: पुत्रः मध्ये एव तं विनिवार्य अवोचत्- "अलम्, अलम्, अहं सर्वं बुद्धवान् अस्मि। आत्मनः त्रुटये पादयोः प्रणिपत्य पुनः पुनः क्षमाम् अभियाचे"
en_dmt: "The son, interrupting him, said: \"Enough, enough, I understand everything. For my fault, I repeatedly beg forgiveness, bowing at your feet.\"  "

text: इदम् उक्त्वा पितरं स्वकीये पृष्ठे एव उपावेश्य गृहम् आनयत्, पत्नीं च सर्वां घटितां घटनां श्रावयित्वा अकथयत्- "अहं न इच्छामि यत् आवयोः पुत्रः शशिधरः तरुणः भूत्वा वृद्धभूतौ आवाम् अपि एवम् एव निराश्रितौ गृहाद् बहिः क्वचित् परित्यजेत्। इदानीम् अयं मे पिता अत्र एव वत्स्यति। त्वम् एतं सेवस्व वा मा सेवस्व। अहम् एव एकाकी एनम् आजीवनं सम्यक् सेविष्ये।"
en_dmt: "Having said this, he made his father sit on his own back and brought him home. And having made his wife listen to the entire incident that had occurred, he said: \"I do not want our son Śaśidhara, when he becomes a young man, to abandon us, old and helpless, somewhere outside the house in just this way. Now my father will live here. You may serve him or not serve him. I alone will properly serve him for my entire life.\"  "

text: भर्त्तुः अनेन वचनेन उद्बुद्धबुद्धिः पत्नी कथितवती- 'आर्य! अहं भवतः अर्धाङ्गिनी सुदूरे कथं स्थातुं शक्नोमि? अहम् अपि स्कन्धेन स्कन्धं मेलयित्वा सर्वत्र भवदीयं सहयोगं कृत्वा एव आत्मानं धन्यं मंस्ये। भवान् इतः पूर्वं कृतं मम सर्वं धार्ष्ट्यं क्षन्तुम् अर्हति"
en_dmt: "The wife, her intellect awakened by these words of her husband, said: \"Noble one! How can I, your *ardhāṅginī* (better half), remain so far away? I too, joining shoulder to shoulder, considering myself blessed by offering my cooperation to you in all matters. You ought to forgive all my impudence done before.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: सुरेशस्य पुत्रवधूः स्वभर्तारं किं कथितवती ?
en_dmt: "What did Sureśa's daughter-in-law say to her husband?  "

text: भर्ता तदा किं कृतवान् ?
en_dmt: "what did the husband do then?  "

text: सुरेशः पुत्रं किम् अकथयत् ?
en_dmt: "What did Suresh say to his son?  "

text: पुत्रः तदा किम् अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the son do then?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति ?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: चातुर्यपूर्णा वाणी
en_dmt: "Speech full of cleverness.  "

text: चातुर्यालङ्‌कृता वाणी, सद्यः स्पृशति मानसम्। मुग्धः प्राणी तया वाण्या, जायते हि वशंवदः॥
en_dmt: "Speech adorned with cleverness immediately touches the mind. A simple creature becomes obedient through that speech.  "

text: अहं चिकित्सालये उपचारार्थं प्रविष्टं स्वस्य सम्बन्धिनं द्रष्टुं गतवान्।
en_dmt: "I went to the hospital to see a relative of mine who had been admitted for treatment.  "

text: किन्तु निर्धारितसमयात् पूर्वं प्राप्तः आसम्।
en_dmt: "But I arrived before the appointed time.  "

text: परिचारिका प्रवेशतः मां न्यवारयत्।
en_dmt: "The attendant prevented me from entering.  "

text: अस्मिन् एव अन्तराले एकः अन्यः जनः आगतः।
en_dmt: "In this very interval, another person came.  "

text: तम् अपि निवारयन्ती परिचारिका प्रतीक्षितुं कथितवती।
en_dmt: "The attendant, also preventing him, told him to wait.  "

text: किन्तु सः अब्रवीत् "इमानि वस्तूनि मया स्वपत्न्यै देयानि सन्ति।"
en_dmt: "But he said, \"These things must be given by me to my own wife.\"  "

text: परिचारिका तानि वस्तूनि ततः आददती उक्तवती "अहम् इमानि प्रापयामि।"
en_dmt: "The female attendant, taking those items from there, said, \"I will deliver these.\"  "

text: आगन्तुकः कथितवान्  "महाशये! एषु वस्तुषु अहम् अपि तु एकं वस्तु अस्मि।"
en_dmt: "The visitor said, \"Sir, among these things, I too am but one thing.\"  "

text: तस्य इदं कथनं श्रुत्वा परिचारिका स्वहास्यं रोद्धुं न पारितवती।
en_dmt: "Having heard this statement of his, the maidservant was unable to restrain her laughter.  "

text: सा आवां द्वौ अपि प्रवेशितवती कथितवती च- "शीघ्रम् एव आगन्तव्यम्"
en_dmt: "She let the two of us enter and said, \"You must come quickly!\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: परिचारिका मां किं कृतवती?
en_dmt: "What did the female servant do to me?  "

text: अन्यं जनम् अपि सा किं कर्तुं कथितवती?
en_dmt: "What did she tell [kathitavatī] to do to another person [anyaṃ janam api]?  "

text: सः परिचारिकां किम् अब्रवीत्?
en_dmt: "What did he say to the female attendant?  "

text: परिचारिका यदा तेन दत्तां सामग्रीं प्रापयितुं कथितवती, तदा सः किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "When the servant girl was told to deliver the materials given by him, what did he say?  "

text: प्राणी कीदृश्या वाण्या वशंवदः भवति?
en_dmt: "What kind of speech makes a living being obedient?  "

text: युद्धपरिणामः
en_dmt: "The result of war.  "

text: युध्यन्ते सैनिका युद्धे, मोदन्ते शासकास्ततः। युद्धे मृता दिवं यान्ति, क्लिश्यन्ते जीविता इह॥
en_dmt: "The soldiers fight in battle, and the rulers rejoice thereafter. Those who die in battle go to heaven, while those who live suffer here.  "

text: भारतीयस्वातन्त्र्यान्दोलने भागं गृहीत्वा तेन स्वकीयं सम्पूर्णं यौवनं यापितम् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Having taken part in the Indian independence movement, he spent his entire youth.  "

text: विवाहः तेन कृतः आसीत् एव न।
en_dmt: "The marriage was indeed done by him, no?  "

text: मातापितरौ तस्य वियोगेन सन्तपन्तौ दिवं गतौ आस्ताम्।
en_dmt: "His mother and father, tormented by separation from him, passed away.  "

text: सम्पूर्णः देशः एव तस्य कुटुम्बः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The entire country was indeed his family.  "

text: तस्य एव सुखशान्तिसमृद्ध्यर्थं तेन आत्मीयं सर्वस्वम् आहुतम्।
en_dmt: "For his happiness, peace, and prosperity, he offered all his possessions.  "

text: भारतमाता पारतन्त्र्यपाशतः विमुक्ता।
en_dmt: "Mother India is liberated from the bonds of dependence (paratantryapāśa).  "

text: तेन अपि अपूर्वा आनन्दानुभूतिः प्राप्ता।
en_dmt: "Thereby, also, an unprecedented experience of bliss is attained.  "

text: किन्तु अत्र चिरस्थायितां न दृष्ट्वा सः विषण्णः।
en_dmt: "But, not seeing long-term stability here, he was dejected.  "

text: तस्य एव अनेके सहयोगिनः शासकाः भूत्वा विदेशिशासकेभ्यः अपि भारतमातरि अत्यधिकम् अत्याचरन्ति।
en_dmt: "Likewise, many collaborators, becoming rulers, inflict even greater atrocities on Mother India than foreign rulers.  "

text: इदानीं सः एकाकी संस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Now, he remained alone.  "

text: वृद्धावस्थायां स्वतन्त्रतायोद्धृरूपे तस्मै प्रदत्ता सम्मानवृत्तिः तस्य मुखम् एव पिहितवती।
en_dmt: "The pension granted to him in old age in the form of a freedom fighter's allowance completely silenced him.  "

text: अन्तः दहति तस्य मनः।
en_dmt: "His mind burns within.  "

text: अशक्तः सः मृत्युदिनानि गणयति इति।
en_dmt: "Being powerless, he counts the days until death.  "

text: तेन स्वं समापूर्णं यौवनं कुत्र यापितम्?
en_dmt: "So, where was his own complete youth spent?  "

text: तस्य कुटुम्बः कः आसीत्? कुटुम्बाय तेन किं कृतम्?
en_dmt: "What was his family like? What was done by him for the family?  "

text: सः विषण्णः किं तिष्ठति?
en_dmt: "Why does he stand there dejected?  "

text: तस्य मुखं का पिहितवती?
en_dmt: "Whose face did she cover?  "

text: युद्धेन के मोदन्ते? के च क्लिश्यन्ते?
en_dmt: "Who rejoices in war? And who suffers?  "

text: स्त्रीपुरुषपरिचयः
en_dmt: "Acquaintance of men and women.  "

text: मायाभोगेषु लिप्तो यः, स एव स्त्री न किं वद । यस्तथा वर्तते नैव, स एव पुरुषः खलु ॥
en_dmt: "He who is attached to the pleasures of Māyā, why do you not call him a woman? He who does not behave thus, he alone is truly a man.  "

text: नगराद् बहिः एकस्मिन् उपवने कश्चित् संन्यासी निवसति स्म।
en_dmt: "Outside the city, in a certain garden, a certain *saṃnyāsī* (renunciate) was living.  "

text: परन्तु भिक्षार्थं सः नगरं एव गच्छति स्म।
en_dmt: "But for alms, he would go to the city.  "

text: तस्य भक्तेषु सद्‌गृहस्थाः, अधिकारिणः, कर्मचारिणः च आसन्।
en_dmt: "Among his devotees were virtuous householders (sad-gṛhasthāḥ), officials (adhikāriṇaḥ), and servants (karmacāriṇaḥ).  "

text: मार्गे एकस्याः वेश्यायाः आवासः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "On the path, there was the dwelling of a prostitute.  "

text: एकदा सा अपि भिक्षां दत्त्वा सप्रणामं सन्यासिनं पृष्टवती - "भगवन्! भवान् स्त्री अस्ति अथवा पुरुषः?"
en_dmt: "Once, after giving alms, she respectfully asked the renunciate: \"Bhagavan, are you a woman or a man?\"  "

text: संन्यासी उत्तरम् दत्तवान् - "पुत्रि! तव प्रश्नस्य उत्तरं पश्चात् प्राप्स्यसि।"
en_dmt: "The renunciate gave the answer: \"Daughter! You will receive the answer to your question later.\"  "

text: उत्तरस्य प्रतीक्षायां बहूनि दिनानि निर्गतानि।
en_dmt: "Many days have passed in waiting for an answer (uttara).  "

text: कतिपयदिनेभ्यः संन्यासिनः भिक्षार्थम् आगमनं न अभवत्।
en_dmt: "For a few days, mendicants did not come for alms.  "

text: तस्य अन्तसमयः निकटे आसीत्।
en_dmt: "His final hour was near.  "

text: सः वेश्याम् आहूय कथितवान् - "पुत्रि! तव प्रश्नस्य उत्तरं ददामि यत् अहं पुरुषः अस्मि, स्त्री नैव ।"
en_dmt: "He, having called the prostitute, said: \"Daughter! I will give the answer to your question, which is that I am a man, certainly not a woman.\"  "

text: वेश्या अवदत्- "महाराज! इदं तु भवता पूर्वम् एव कथयितुं शक्यते स्म। इयन्ति दिनानि किं यापितानि?"
en_dmt: "The courtesan said: \"Great King! This could have been said by you earlier. Why have so many days been wasted?\"  "

text: संन्यासी अभाषत - "पुत्रि! अहम् इदम् एव स्वस्मिन् परीक्षमाणः आसम्। केवलं पुरुषस्य शरीरस्य धारणेन एव कश्चित् पुरुषः न भवति। यः मायायाः भोगेषु आसक्तः तिष्ठति,  सः जनः मायायाः अधीनतया स्त्री भवति। यः तथा न भवति, सः एव पुरुषः। पुरुषः तु मायापतिः एकः एव। अहम् अधुना तम् एव शरणं गच्छामि। माया स्वजाले मां पातयितुं न शक्नोति। अतः निश्चयेन कथयामि यत् अहं पुरुषः एव अस्मि"
en_dmt: "The renunciant said: \"Daughter! I myself was examining this very thing. Merely by possessing a human body, one does not become a *puruṣa* (man). That person who remains attached to the enjoyments of *māyā* (illusion), that person, being under the control of *māyā*, becomes a woman. He who is not like that, he alone is a *puruṣa* (man). The *puruṣa* (man), however, is the lord of *māyā*, and is one alone. Now, I go to that very refuge. *Māyā* is not able to make me fall into its net. Therefore, I say with certainty that I am indeed a *puruṣa* (man).\"  "

text: एवं कथयन् एव सः उच्चैः 'ओम्'
en_dmt: "Saying thus, he loudly [said] \"Oṃ.\"  "

text: इति उच्चार्य अनन्ते विलीनः इति।
en_dmt: "Thus having spoken, he dissolved into the infinite.  "

text: संन्यासिनं वेश्या किं कृत्वा किं पृष्टवती ?
en_dmt: "What did the prostitute do and ask the renunciate (saṃnyāsin)?  "

text: संन्यासी तदा किम् उत्तरं दत्तवान् ?
en_dmt: "What answer did the *saṃnyāsī* then give?  "

text: मृत्युसमये निकटे आगते संन्यासी वेश्याम् आहूय किं कथितवान् ?
en_dmt: "When death was near, what did the renunciate say after calling the courtesan?  "

text: वेश्या तं किम् अवदत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the prostitute say to him?  "

text: संन्यासी वेश्यां स्त्रीपुरुषयोः कीदृशं भेदं प्रबोधितवान् ?
en_dmt: "What distinction did the renunciate explain between a prostitute and a man?  "

text: शिक्षानुसारणेन एव पाठलाभः
en_dmt: "Acquisition of the text is only through following the precepts (śikṣānusāraṇena eva pāṭhalābhaḥ).  "

text: रामायणमधीत्यापि, तच्छिक्षाऽनुसृता न चेत् । लाभः कोऽस्ति ततस्तर्हि, वृथा समययापनात् ॥
en_dmt: "Even having studied the *Rāmāyaṇa*, if its teachings are not followed, then what is the benefit of it? [It is] a waste of time.  "

text: अहं गुरुमहाराजेन सह रैलयात्रां कुर्वन् आसम्।
en_dmt: "I was traveling by train with the great Guru.  "

text: अग्रिमे स्थैषणे अस्मत्कक्षे एकः प्रौढः जनः प्रविष्टः।
en_dmt: "In the next session, one elderly person entered our class.  "

text: रैलयाने प्रस्थिते सति सः वाल्मीकिरामायणं निःसार्य पठितुं प्रावर्त्तत।
en_dmt: "When the train departed, he took out the Vālmīki Rāmāyaṇa and began to read.  "

text: पश्चात् पृष्टः सः कथितवान् यत् विगतचत्वारिंशद्वर्षेभ्यः अहं रामायणस्य नित्यं पारायणं कुर्वन् अस्मि।
en_dmt: "Afterwards, when asked, he said that for the past forty years, he has been constantly reciting the *Rāmāyaṇa*.  "

text: अद्य गृहे समयाप्राप्त्या इह कृतवान् अस्मि।
en_dmt: "Today, due to arriving at the wrong time, I did it here at home.  "

text: मथुरायाम् अभियोगः चलति, तत्र एव अहं गच्छामि।
en_dmt: "A lawsuit is proceeding in Mathurā; I will go there.  "

text: गुरुमहाराजः अवदत् - "अहम् अपि पूर्वाश्रमे वाक्कीलः आसम्। स्वपत्रावलिं दर्शयतु, यदि अहं तत्र काञ्चित् सहायतां कर्तुं शक्नुयाम्।"
en_dmt: "The great teacher said: \"I was also a lawyer in my former āśrama. Show me your documents, if I can be of any help there.\"  "

text: सः पत्रावलिं प्रदर्शितवान्।
en_dmt: "He displayed the collection of letters.  "

text: तत्र वादिप्रतिवादिनोः पितुः एकम् एव नाम दृष्ट्वा गुरुमहाराजः तम् एतस्य रहस्यम् अपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "There, seeing that the father of the two disputants had the same name, the great teacher asked him the secret of this.  "

text: सः उक्तवान् - "वादी अहम् अस्मि, प्रतिवादी च मम अग्रजः। भूमिखण्डनिमित्तम् अयं वादः।"
en_dmt: "He said: \"I am the plaintiff, and my elder brother is the defendant. This dispute is about a piece of land.\"  "

text: गुरुमहाराजः ततः अग्रे किम् अपि श्रोतुम् अनिच्छन् पत्रावलिं परावर्त्तयत् अभर्त्सयत् च - "रामायणं पठितं, किन्तु ततः किञ्चित् अपि न शिक्षितम्। वृथा एव समयः यापितः। अरे! भरतः तु पितृदत्तम् अपि राज्यं वैमातृकाय अग्रजा परावर्त्तयत्। एकः त्वम् असि, यः स्वसहोदरे अपि अभियोगं चालयसि। धिक् त्वाम्।"
en_dmt: "The great teacher, not wanting to hear anything further, turned the document over and rebuked him: \"You have read the *Rāmāyaṇa*, but have learned nothing from it. Your time has been wasted in vain (*vṛthā eva samayaḥ yāpitaḥ*). Alas! Bharata returned even the kingdom given by his father (*pitṛdattam api rājyaṃ*) to his elder brother, born of another mother (*vaimātṛkāya agrajā*). You alone (*ekaḥ tvam asi*) are the one who brings a charge even against your own brother. Shame on you (*dhik tvām*)!\"  "

text: अनेन वचनेन तस्य मनः परिवर्तितम् एव।
en_dmt: "By this statement, his mind was indeed changed.  "

text: सः अभियोगं परावर्त्तयितुम् अग्रजतः च क्षमां याचितुं निश्चयं कृत्वा तत्कालम् एव पत्रावलिं विदार्य बहिः प्रक्षिप्तवान्, गुरुमहाराजस्य च चरणयोः प्रणिपत्य स्वीयां त्रुटिं स्वीकृतवान्, वारं वारं च कृतज्ञतां प्रकटितवान् इति।
en_dmt: "Having decided to reverse the accusation and to ask for forgiveness, he immediately tore up the document and threw it outside, and, bowing at the feet of the Gurumahārāja, he admitted his fault and repeatedly expressed his gratitude.  "

text: प्रौढः जनः गुरुमहाराजं किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the mature person say to the great guru?  "

text: गुरुमहाराजः तं किं कर्तुम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the great guru tell him to do?  "

text: प्रौढः जनः तदा किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the old man do then?  "

text: गुरुमहाराजः प्रौढं जनं किं कथयन् अभर्त्सयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the great preceptor, the great king, say to the elderly people as he rebuked them?  "

text: प्रौढः जनः तदा किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the elderly person do then?  "

text: सुखशान्त्योः के बाधकाः?
en_dmt: "What are the obstacles to happiness and peace?  "

text: जनतेच्छति युद्धं न, सुखं शान्तिं च सेच्छति। स्वार्थिनः शासकास्तस्याः, सुखे शान्त्यां च बाधकाः॥
en_dmt: "The people do not want war; they want happiness and peace. Selfish rulers are obstacles to their happiness and peace.  "

text: पुत्रः  - तात! इमे सैनिकाः परस्परं किं युध्यन्ते, म्रियन्ते मारयन्ति च?
en_dmt: "Son: Father! Why are these soldiers fighting each other, dying, and killing?  "

text: पिता - वत्स! देशरक्षार्थम् एते बलिदानं कुर्वन्ति।
en_dmt: "Father: My dear boy! These ones are sacrificing themselves for the protection of the country.  "

text: पुत्रः  - किं युद्धेन देशरक्षा भवति?
en_dmt: "Son, does protecting the country happen through war?  "

text: पिता - आम्।
en_dmt: "Father - Yes.  "

text: पुत्रः  - तर्हि, शासकाः किं कुर्वन्ति? तेषु किं देशरक्षाभावना न अस्ति ?
en_dmt: "Son: Then, what do the rulers do? Is there no feeling of protecting the country in them?  "

text: पिता - वत्स! तेषाम् एव पक्षतः इमे युध्यन्ते।
en_dmt: "Father: Son! These [men] are fighting on their side.  "

text: पुत्रः  - अनेन तु इदं सिद्धम् - 'मन्त्रम् अहं पठामि। सर्पबिले हस्तं त्वं देहि ।'
en_dmt: "Son - But by this, it is proven - 'I will recite the mantra. You put your hand in the snake hole.'  "

text: पिता - किमपि जानीहि ।
en_dmt: "Father, understand something.  "

text: पुत्रः - किं द्वयोः देशयोः जनता युद्धम् इच्छति ?
en_dmt: "\"Son, do the people of both countries want war?\"  "

text: पिता - नहि कदापि नहि, सा तु सुखं शान्तिं च इच्छति।
en_dmt: "Father: No, never, she desires happiness (*sukham*) and peace (*śāntim*).  "

text: पुत्रः - तर्हि, तदिच्छाविरुद्धं युद्धाग्नौ सैनिकानां निपातनं निरपराधजनतायाः च हत्या सर्वथा अनैतिकम् एव कर्म।
en_dmt: "son - then, throwing soldiers into the fire of war against their will, and the killing of innocent people is completely an unethical act.  "

text: पिता - आम्, एवम्  एव इति।
en_dmt: "Father: \"Yes, it is just so.\"  "

text: सैनिकाः परस्परं किं युध्यन्ते म्रियन्ते मारयन्ति च ?
en_dmt: "Why do the soldiers fight each other, die, and kill?  "

text: सैनिकाः केषां पक्षतः युध्यन्ते ?
en_dmt: "From whose side do the soldiers fight?  "

text: किं जनता युद्धम् इच्छति ?
en_dmt: "Does the populace desire war?  "

text: यदि नहि, तर्हि तदिच्छाविरुद्धं सैनिकानां युद्धाग्नौ निपातनं निरपराधजनतायाः च हत्या किं नैतिकं कर्म अस्ति ?
en_dmt: "If not, then is it ethical to throw soldiers into the fire of battle against their will, and to kill innocent people?  "

text: जनतायाः सुखशान्त्योः बाधकाः के सन्ति ?
en_dmt: "What are the obstacles to the happiness and peace of the people?  "

text: गुरुसेवा  कल्याणकारिणी
en_dmt: "Service to the teacher, [she who is] the cause of welfare.  "

text: गुरुसेवा कृता सम्यक्, सदा कल्याणकारिणी। नानारीत्या परीक्षन्ते, गुरवः शिष्यमण्डलीम्॥
en_dmt: "Service to the guru, well performed, is always the bringer of welfare. In various ways, the gurus test the assembly of disciples.  "

text: एकदा समर्थगुरुरामदासः उच्चैः उच्चैः आक्रन्दति स्म- "हा! मृतः रे!, हा! मृतः रे!, रक्ष प्रभो! रक्ष!"
en_dmt: "Once, Samartha Guru Ramdas was crying out loudly, \"Alas! He is dead! Alas! He is dead! Protect, Lord! Protect!\"  "

text: तस्य आक्रन्दनम् आकर्ण्य सर्वे अपि शिष्याः तत्र समवेताः अजायन्त, तस्य पीडाकारणं च पृष्टवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Having heard his cry, all the disciples gathered there and inquired about the cause of his suffering.  "

text: गुरुः स्वपादं दर्शयन् अकथयत्- "अत्र अयं कृष्णमुखः प्राणहरः स्थूलः स्फोटः उत्पन्नः। मुखद्वारा दूषितमलनिःसारणेन एव अहं जीवेयम्।"
en_dmt: "The teacher, showing his foot, said: \"Here, this black-faced, life-threatening, large blister has arisen. I can only live by draining the contaminated impurities through the opening (mukha-dvāra).\"  "

text: स्फोटः वस्त्रपट्टिकया आवेष्टितः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The abscess was wrapped with a strip of cloth.  "

text: केवलं तस्य कृष्णमुखं दृश्यते स्म।
en_dmt: "Only his black face was seen.  "

text: स्पर्शेन सः मृदुः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "He was soft to the touch.  "

text: अहमहमिकया गुरोः प्राणान् रक्षितुं सर्वेपि शिष्याः तत्कालम् एव स्फोटं चूषितुं प्रवृत्ताः।
en_dmt: "With a sense of competition, all the disciples immediately began to suck the swelling in order to save the life of their guru.  "

text: तदा गुरुः तान् अवदत् - "किन्तु स्मरणीयं, चूषकः पुनः जीवितः न स्थास्यति।"
en_dmt: "Then the guru said to them: \"But remember, the mouse will not remain alive again.\"  "

text: इदम् आकर्ण्य शिष्याः एकतः अपसृताः।
en_dmt: "Having heard this, the students withdrew to one side.  "

text: केवलं गुरोः प्रियतमः शिष्यः शिववीरः एव स्वप्राणान्  अपि अगणयन् एव स्फोटस्य पूयं महता प्रेम्णा चूषित्वा सर्वान्‌ विस्मापयन् इव गुरोः मनसि महतीं प्रीतिम् उत्पादितवान्।
en_dmt: "Only Śivavīra, the guru's most beloved disciple, disregarding even his own life, as if astonishing everyone by sucking the pus of the abscess with great affection, produced great joy in the guru's mind.  "

text: वस्तुतः गुरुः शिष्यान् परीक्षितुं पादे कृष्णमुखं मधुररसभरितं मृदुलम् एकम् आम्रं कर्पटपट्टिकया आवेष्ट्य स्फोटजनितां पीडाम् अभिनयन् आसीत् इति।
en_dmt: "In reality, the teacher, in order to test the students, had wrapped a soft mango, black-faced and filled with sweet juice, around his foot with a cloth bandage, and was acting out the pain caused by a blister.  "

text: समर्थगुरुः रामदासः कथम् आक्रन्दति स्म?
en_dmt: "How did the capable guru Rāmadāsa cry out?  "

text: शिष्यान् सः किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What did he say to the disciples?  "

text: शिष्याः तदा किं कर्तुम् उद्यताः कथं च पुनः विरताः?
en_dmt: "What were the disciples then prepared to do, and how did they desist again?  "

text: शिववीरः किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did Śivavīra do?  "

text: समर्थगुरुरामदासस्य तद् आचरणं किमर्थम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "Why was that conduct of Samartha Guru Ramdas?  "

text: शुचिता निष्फला नहि
en_dmt: "Purity is not fruitless.  "

text: सङ्‌कटेऽप्यागते स्वीया, त्यक्तव्या शुचिना नहि। तस्याः फलं मिलत्यच्छम्, अत्र तत्र प्रमोदनम् ॥
en_dmt: "Even when difficulties arise, one's own [wife] should not be abandoned by a virtuous man. Its pure result is obtained, delight here and there.  "

text: नगरस्य एकः दानवीरः श्रेष्ठी निःशुल्कम् अन्नक्षेत्रं चालयति स्म।
en_dmt: "In the city, a generous and charitable merchant used to run a free kitchen (anna-kṣetra).  "

text: आवश्यकतानुसारम्  इतः जनाः स्वकीयवस्तूनि गृह्णन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "According to the need, people took their own things from here.  "

text: तेषु एका षट्सप्तवर्षीया बालिका अपि आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Among them was also a girl of sixty-seven years.  "

text: किन्तु ग्रहीतॄणां सम्मर्दवशात् सा सदा किम् अपि न प्राप्नोति स्म।
en_dmt: "But due to the crush of those wanting to take [something], she never obtained anything.  "

text: वितरकः तस्याः इमाम् अशक्ततां दृष्ट्वा एकं विशिष्टं स्थूलमोदकं सर्वेभ्यः वितरणानन्तरं तस्यै दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "The distributor, seeing her inability, gave her a special large *modaka* (sweet dumpling) after distributing to everyone.  "

text: गृहं गत्वा बालिका तं मोदकं मात्रे दत्तवती।
en_dmt: "Having gone home, the girl gave that sweetmeat to her mother.  "

text: मोदकत्रोटनेन तस्मिन् एकं सौवर्णम् अङ्गुलीयकं मिलितम्, यस्य विक्रयेण सम्पूर्णा अपि दरिद्रता दूरे भवितुं शक्नोति स्म।
en_dmt: "By breaking the *modaka*, a golden ring was found in it, by the sale of which, even complete poverty could have been removed far away.  "

text: किन्तु कदाचित् प्रमादेन तद् अस्मिन् आयातं स्यात् इति विचार्य सा सद्यः एव परावर्तयितुं पुत्रीं प्रेषितवती।
en_dmt: "But, thinking that perhaps it had come to him by mistake, she immediately sent her daughter to return it.  "

text: वितरकः अनेन सन्तुष्टः सन् पुत्र्या सह तद् गृहं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "The distributor, being satisfied by this, arrived at that house together with his daughter.  "

text: तत्र तस्याः मातुः शुचितया प्रभावितः भूत्वा यत्र पुत्र्याः शिक्षातः आरभ्य विवाहपर्यन्तं सर्वं भारं सम्भालितवान् तत्र मातुः अपि समुचितां भरणपोषणव्यवस्थां सम्पाद्य स्वकीयां विशालहृदयताम् एव प्रमाणितवान् इति।
en_dmt: "There, being impressed by the purity of that mother, he took on the entire responsibility from the daughter's education until her marriage. There, he also arranged for the mother's proper maintenance and nourishment, thus proving his own magnanimity.  "

text: दानवीरः श्रेष्ठी किं करोति स्म?
en_dmt: "What did the generous hero, the merchant, do?  "

text: बालिका वितरकतः किम् अपि किं न प्राप्नोति स्म?
en_dmt: "Did the girl not receive anything at all from the distributors?  "

text: वितरकः तस्यै बालिकायै किम् अददात्?
en_dmt: "What did the distributor give to that girl?  "

text: बालिकया सह वितरकः तस्याः गृहे किं गतवान्?
en_dmt: "Did the distributor go to her house with the girl?  "

text: वितरकः स्वविशालहृदयतां किं कृत्वा प्रमाणितवान्?
en_dmt: "How did the distributor prove his large-heartedness?  "

text: पूर्णत्वकामना
en_dmt: "Desire for completeness.  "

text: यो यस्माज्जायते सोऽपि, स्वपितेव बुभूषति। नहि सूर्योद्भवो वह्निः, शीतो भवति वारिवत्॥
en_dmt: "He from whom someone is born, even he, desires to sleep. Indeed, fire born from the sun does not become cold like water.  "

text: एका गृहिणी स्वस्य पत्ये भोजने एकं पूर्णं मोदकं, पुत्राय च अर्धं मोदकं पर्यवेषयत्।
en_dmt: "A housewife served her husband one whole *modaka* (sweet dumpling) for his meal, and her son half a *modaka*.  "

text: पुत्राय अर्धः मोदकः नैव अरोचत।
en_dmt: "The son did not like half a sweet.  "

text: सः अपि पूर्णं मोदकं ग्रहीतुम् इच्छति स्म।
en_dmt: "He also wanted to take the whole sweetmeat.  "

text: तस्य हठं दृष्ट्वा माता तत्कालम् एव पुत्रस्य अर्धं मोदकं गोलकाकृतौ कृत्वा तस्मै दत्तवती।
en_dmt: "Seeing his stubbornness, the mother immediately made half a sweet into a ball shape for her son and gave it to him.  "

text: सः तं पूर्णं मोदकं दृष्ट्वा सन्तुष्टः अभवत्।
en_dmt: "He, having seen that full *modaka* (sweet dumpling), became satisfied.  "

text: एवम् एव परमात्मनः अंशः जीवात्मा अपि परमात्मा इव पूर्णः एव भवितुम् इच्छति अंशरूपेण स्थातुं न इच्छति इति।
en_dmt: "Just so, the individual soul (jīvātmā), as a part (aṃśa) of the Supreme Soul (Paramātman), also wishes to be complete like the Supreme Soul and does not wish to remain as a part.  "

text: गृहिणी कस्मै कस्मै किं किं भोजने पर्यवेषयत्?
en_dmt: "To whom all and what all did the housewife serve in the meal?  "

text: पुत्राय किं न अरोचत?
en_dmt: "What did not please the son?  "

text: पुत्रः किम् इच्छति स्म?
en_dmt: "What did the son want?  "

text: पुत्रः कदा सन्तुष्टः अभवत्?
en_dmt: "When did the son become satisfied?  "

text: अनया कथया का शिक्षा मिलति?
en_dmt: "What lesson is learned from this story?  "

text: भक्तोत्तमः कः?
en_dmt: "Who is the best devotee?  "

text: निद्रितोऽपि प्रतिश्वासं, भगवन्नाम यो जपेत्। किं स भक्तोत्तमो नास्ति? तदिष्टं किं न सिध्यति?॥
en_dmt: "Even while asleep, one who murmurs the name of the Fortunate One (Bhagavat), Is he not the best of devotees? Will his desires not be fulfilled?  "

text: देवर्षिनारदस्य भगवन्तं प्रति स्वकीयभक्तौ महान् गर्वः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The divine sage Nārada had great pride in his devotion to the Blessed Lord (Bhagavān).  "

text: एकदा आत्मीयम् इमं भावं प्रकारान्तरेण सः भगवतः सम्मुखे प्रकटम् अपि कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Once, he revealed this personal feeling to the Blessed One in a different way.  "

text: अन्तर्यामी भगवान् तस्य इमं गर्वं चूर्णयितुम् एव तम् अर्जुनं प्रति स्वसन्देशं दातुं मिषेण प्रोषितवान्।
en_dmt: "The omnipresent Lord, with the intention of crushing his pride, sent him, Arjuna, on the pretext of delivering his own message.  "

text: तदा अर्जुनः बाह्यजगतः सर्वथा सुदूरे स्थितः गहननिद्रायां निमग्नः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Then Arjuna, completely far from the external world, was immersed in deep sleep.  "

text: तस्य प्रत्येकश्वासतः 'नारायण! नारायण!'
en_dmt: "With each breath of his, \"[He is] Nārāyaṇa! Nārāyaṇa!\"  "

text: अयं मधुरः ध्वनिः निरन्तरं निःसरन् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "This sweet sound was constantly emanating.  "

text: इदम् अद्भुतं दृश्यं दृष्ट्वा नारदस्य गर्वभङ्गः तु सञ्जातः एव।
en_dmt: "Having seen this wondrous sight, Nārada's pride was indeed shattered.  "

text: सः तस्य जागरणम् अनुचितं मत्वा विना सन्देषदानम् एव यथा गतः तथा परावर्तितः आसीत् इति।
en_dmt: "Thinking that it was not the right time to wake him, he turned back, just as he had come, without even delivering the message.  "

text: देवर्षिनारदस्य कीदृशः गर्वः आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What kind of pride did the divine sage Nārada have?  "

text: भगवान् तं कुत्र कस्मै कार्याय प्रेषितवान्?
en_dmt: "Where did the Blessed One send him, and for what purpose?  "

text: नारदः कं किं कुर्वन्तम् अपश्यत्?
en_dmt: "What did Nārada see, and whom did he see doing what?  "

text: पुनः नारदः किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did Nārada do next?  "

text: भक्तोत्तमः कीदृशः भवति?
en_dmt: "What kind of excellent devotee (bhaktottamaḥ) is [he]?  "

text: राष्ट्रभविष्यज्ञाता ईश्वरः एव
en_dmt: "God alone is the knower of the nation's future.  "

text: रक्षका भक्षका यत्र, यत्र स्त्रीषु बलात्कृतिः। भविष्यं तस्य राष्ट्रस्य, वेत्ति केवलमीश्वरः॥
en_dmt: "Where protectors are predators, where force is used against women, only God knows the future of that kingdom.  "

text: श्यामः मातापितृभ्यां सह ग्रामतः नगरम् आगत्य गृहनिर्माणे विगतदशवर्षेभ्यः श्रमिकः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Śyāma, having come from the village to the city with his mother and father, had been a laborer in house construction for the past ten years.  "

text: मध्ये मध्ये सः यदा कदा ग्रामम् अपि प्रत्यागच्छति स्म।
en_dmt: "From time to time, he would also return to the village.  "

text: एकदा अकाले आपतिते आजीविकायाः अलाभेन मातापितरौ दिवं गतौ आस्ताम्।
en_dmt: "Once, when famine struck and a livelihood was unobtainable, his parents passed away.  "

text: सर्वथा असहायः एकाकी श्यामः अपि जीवनतः निराशः सञ्जातः।
en_dmt: "Completely helpless, alone, and even though dark-skinned, he became hopeless about life.  "

text: किन्तु तस्य मातापित्रोः परिचितेन तस्मै स्वकीयां कन्यां दत्त्वा कश्चन आशायाः सञ्चारः कृतः।
en_dmt: "But some hope was instilled when a relative of his parents gave him his own daughter in marriage.  "

text: सः तया सह नगरम् आयातः।
en_dmt: "He came to the city with her.  "

text: इतस्ततः भ्रमन् यत्र यत्र तेन कार्यं कृतम् आसीत्, ताः ताः उच्चाः उच्चाः अट्टालिकाः पत्नीं दर्शयन् कम् अपि गर्वं करोति स्म।
en_dmt: "Wandering here and there, showing his wife those tall mansions wherever he had done work, he felt some pride.  "

text: अस्मिन् एव मध्ये तत्रत्याः प्रहरिणः तं चौरं मत्वा निगृह्य आरक्षिणां हस्ते समर्पितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Just then, the guards there, thinking he was a thief, seized him and handed him over to the police.  "

text: श्यामः एतत् प्रतिकर्तुं बहु अचेष्टत।
en_dmt: "Śyāma tried very hard to counteract this.  "

text: किन्तु तस्य किम् अपि न श्रुतम्।
en_dmt: "But nothing was heard of him.  "

text: रात्रौ एकाकी सः अपराधिप्रकोष्ठे निपातितः।
en_dmt: "At night, he was thrown alone into the offenders' cell.  "

text: अन्येद्युः तेन श्रुतं यत् तस्य पत्नी कुत्रचित् पलायिता।
en_dmt: "The next day, he heard that his wife had fled somewhere.  "

text: सा पलायिता, अपहृता, बलात्कृता, मारिता वा? इदं तु परमेश्वरः एव जानाति इति।
en_dmt: "Was she abducted, carried off, violated, or killed? Only the Supreme Lord knows this.  "

text: श्यामः कः आसीत्? किं करोति स्म?
en_dmt: "Who was Shyama? What did he do?  "

text: सः कया सह नगरम् आयातः?
en_dmt: "With whom did he come to the city?  "

text: आरक्षिणः श्यामेन सह कीदृशं व्यवहारं कृतवन्तः?
en_dmt: "How did the guards behave with Śyāma?  "

text: परमेश्वरः एव किं जानाति?
en_dmt: "Does only the supreme lord know?  "

text: इयं कथा कं सन्देशं ददाति?
en_dmt: "What message does this story give?  "

text: यथा प्रश्नस्तथोत्तरम्
en_dmt: "As the question, so the answer.  "

text: लेखकस्यात्र को दोषो, यथा प्रश्नस्तथोत्तरम्। उप्त्वा निम्बस्य बीजानि, नाम्रा लभ्याः कदाचन॥
en_dmt: "What fault is there of the writer here? The answer is according to the question. Having sown the seeds of the *nimba* tree (Azadirachta indica), when can mangoes be obtained?  "

text: एकदा एकस्य अभिनवशैल्याः सुप्रसिद्धचित्रकारस्य गृहे रात्रौ चौराः प्रविष्टाः।
en_dmt: "Once, thieves entered the house of a very famous painter of a new style at night.  "

text: चित्रकारः स्वपरिवारस्य सदस्यैः सह गृहोपरि प्रगाढनिद्रायां प्रसुप्तः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The painter was fast asleep on the roof of his house with the members of his family.  "

text: चौराः स्वमनीषितम् असाधयन्।
en_dmt: "The thieves accomplished their own desires.  "

text: प्रातः प्रबुद्धः चित्रकारः इदम् अजानात्, आरक्षिस्थाने च गत्वा चौर्यघटनाम् असूचयत्।
en_dmt: "Having awakened in the morning, the painter realized this and, going to the police station, reported the theft.  "

text: तेन एव सह चौरहस्तपादचिह्नानि ग्रहीतुं ततः एकः आरक्षी आगतः।
en_dmt: "Then, to seize the marks of the thieves' hands and feet along with him, a single policeman came.  "

text: स्वकार्यं कृत्वा गच्छन् सः चित्रकारं कथितवान्।
en_dmt: "Having done his own work and leaving, he spoke to the painter.  "

text: "भवान् तु चित्रकारः। चौरस्य आकृतिं लिखित्वा तु ददातु येन चौरानुसन्धानं सुकरं भवेत्"
en_dmt: "You are a painter. Please draw a picture of the thief so that the investigation of the thief becomes easier.  "
"[Tibetan missing. See note below.]  "

text: चित्रकारः तथा एव कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "The painter did just that.  "

text: चौराः चित्रकारगृहे स्वमनीषितं कदा असाधयन्?
en_dmt: "When did the thieves accomplish their desires in the painter's house?  "

text: चित्रकारः तदा किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the painter do then?  "

text: आरक्षी चित्रकारं किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the police officer say to the painter?  "

text: चित्रकारः तदा किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the painter do then?  "

text: आरक्षिस्थानतः चित्रकाराय मिलिते पत्रे किं लिखितम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was written in the letter that the painter received from the police station (ārakṣisthāna)?  "

text: प्रेम शत्रुम् अपि सुधारयति
en_dmt: "Love even reforms enemies.  "

text: शत्रुणाऽपि कृतं प्रेम, तमवश्यं सुधारयेत्। विश्वस्तेन दुराचारो, नैव कार्यः कदाचन॥
en_dmt: "Even love shown by an enemy, one should certainly requite. Improper conduct towards a trusted person should never be done.  "

text: आयुषः अन्तिमेषु वर्षेषु श्रेष्ठी रामदासः स्वपत्न्या सह बदरीनाथयात्रायै प्रस्थितः।
en_dmt: "In the final years of his life, the merchant Śreṣṭhī Rāmadāsa set out with his wife on a pilgrimage to Badrinātha.  "

text: विश्वासपात्राणां केषाञ्चित् सेवकानां मण्डली अपि सह आसीत्।
en_dmt: "A group of some trustworthy servants was also with [him].  "

text: तदा यातायातसाधनानाम् अभावेन पदयात्रा एव क्रियते स्म।
en_dmt: "Then, due to the absence of transportation, journeys were undertaken only on foot.  "

text: मार्गे एकत्र रात्रौ विश्रामः कल्पितः।
en_dmt: "On the path, rest was arranged for one night.  "

text: सर्वेषु सुप्तेषु एकः सेवकः यः केनचित् कारणेन रुष्टः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "When all were asleep, one servant, who for some reason was angry.  "

text: सुप्तं श्रेष्ठिनं भारिप्रस्तरेण शिरसि आहत्य पलायितः।
en_dmt: "Having struck the sleeping merchant on the head with a heavy stone, he fled.  "

text: श्रेष्ठिना सह सर्वे अपि प्रबुद्धाः।
en_dmt: "Along with the merchant, all were enlightened.  "

text: तेषु केचित् श्रेष्ठिनम् उपचरितुं प्रवृत्ताः तर्हि केचन अन्ये स्वं सहचरं तत्र अनवाप्य तम् एव अपराधिनं मत्वा तस्य अन्वेषणाय निर्गताः।
en_dmt: "Among them, some set out to attend upon the merchant; then some others, not finding their companion there, and thinking him guilty, went out to search for him.  "

text: कियद्दूरे पलायमानं तं निगृह्य ते स्वश्रेष्ठिसम्मुखे उपस्थापितवन्तः, तं दण्डयितुं च ततः आदेशं याचितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Having seized him as he fled a short distance away, they brought him before their master merchant, and then requested an order to punish him.  "

text: श्रेष्ठी तं सदयं वीक्षमाणः केवलम् इदम् एव अकथयत्- "सर्वं मम दुष्कृतस्य एव इदं फलम्। इह अस्य कश्चन न दोषः। अयं तु भगवता निमित्तीकृतः। इदानीम् एषः निरन्तरं पलायमानः श्रान्तः अस्ति। शार्करं पाययित्वा अस्य मनःशान्तिः करणीया।"
en_dmt: "The merchant, looking at him compassionately, said only this: \"All this is the fruit of my own evil deeds. He has no fault in this. But he was made an instrument by the Blessed One (Bhagavatā). Now he is constantly fleeing and is tired. Having given him sugar water, his peace of mind should be restored.\"  "

text: सेवकः तस्य अनेन व्यवहारेण लज्जितः स्वकृत्ये अतीव पश्चात्तपन् पुनः पुनः श्रेष्ठिनः चरणयोः निपत्य ततः स्वकृतापराधाय क्षमाम् अयाचत।
en_dmt: "The servant, ashamed by his behavior, deeply regretting his actions, repeatedly fell at the feet of the merchant and begged forgiveness for his offense.  "

text: अग्रे सः एव तस्य घनिष्ठः सेवकः भूत्वा आजीवनं तस्य सेवां नैव पर्यत्यजत् इति।
en_dmt: "From then on, having become his closest servant, he never abandoned his service to him for life.  "

text: सेवकः किं कृत्वा पलायितः ?
en_dmt: "What did the servant do before fleeing?  "

text: अन्ये तत्सहचराः किं कृतवन्तः ?
en_dmt: "What did the other companions do?  "

text: श्रेष्ठी तान् किम् अकथयत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the merchant tell them?  "

text: श्रेष्ठिनः कथनस्य पलायनकर्तरि सेवके कीदृशः प्रभावः अभवत् ?
en_dmt: "What effect did the merchant's statement have on the fleeing servant?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति ?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: मधुरभाषणं कटुस्थितिलोपकम्
en_dmt: "Sweet speech destroys a bitter situation.  "

text: उग्रतायामपि स्वीयो, नैव त्याज्यो हि संयमः। मधुरं भाषणं चापि, कटुस्थितिं विलोपयेत्॥
en_dmt: "Even in fierceness, one's own self-control should not be abandoned. Sweet speech, indeed, can eliminate a bitter situation.  "

text: "महाशय! भवदीयः आत्मजः क्रिकेटं क्रीडन् मम वातायनस्य बहुमूल्यं काचं त्रोटितवान् अस्ति। अस्य क्षतिपूर्तिः भवता करणीया"
en_dmt: "\"Sir! Your son, while playing cricket, has broken the valuable glass of my window. You must compensate for this damage.\"  "

text: प्रतिवेशी श्यामसुन्दरं कथितवान्।
en_dmt: "The neighbor said to Śyāmasundara.  "

text: "बालकः एव तु अस्ति सः। भवता अपि बाल्ये बहूनां हानिः कृता स्यात्। इह ध्यानं न देयं बहु। किं प्रतिवेशितः क्षतिमूल्यं याच्यते?"
en_dmt: "But he is only a boy. You also probably caused much harm in your childhood. Not much attention should be given here. Why is the neighbor being asked for compensation?  "

text: श्यामसुन्दरः प्रतिवेशिनं पृष्टवान्।
en_dmt: "Śyāmasundara asked the neighbor.  "

text: "यदि सः बालकः एव अस्ति, तर्हि आत्मनः एव वातायनस्य काचं किं न त्रोटितवान्?"
en_dmt: "If he is just a boy, then why didn't he break the window glass himself?  "

text: प्रतिवेशी जिज्ञासां कुतवान्।
en_dmt: "The neighbor asked out of curiosity.  "

text: "सः न अस्ति इयान् मूर्खः"
en_dmt: "He is not such a fool.  "

text: श्यामसुन्दरः उत्तरं दत्तवान् इति।
en_dmt: "Śyāmasundara gave the answer, thus it is said.  "

text: प्रतिवेशी श्यामसुन्दरं किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the neighbor say to Śyāmasundara?  "

text: श्यामसुन्दरः प्रतिवेशिनं किम् उदतरत्?
en_dmt: "What did Śyāmasundara say to the neighbor?  "

text: प्रतिवेशी तदा श्यामसुन्दरं किम् अपृच्छत्?
en_dmt: "Then what did the neighbor ask Śyāmasundara?  "

text: श्यामसुन्दरस्य प्रतिवेशिने तदा किम् उत्तरम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the neighbor's reply to Śyāmasundara then?  "

text: कटुस्थितिं किं विलोपयति?
en_dmt: "What destroys a painful situation?  "

text: कारुण्यमैत्र्योः प्रभावः
en_dmt: "The power of compassion and loving-kindness.  "

text: कारुण्यं मित्रता यस्य, चित्ते नित्यं विराजते । ईश्वरोऽपि ततस्तुष्टः, तदिच्छापूरको भवेत् ॥
en_dmt: "He whose compassion and friendliness constantly shine in his mind (citta), even the Lord (īśvara) is pleased with him, and fulfills his desires.  "

text: एकः धार्मिकः सत्सङ्गानुरागी राजा आसीत्।
en_dmt: "There was a righteous king, fond of the company of the good.  "

text: सः दूरदूरात् साधून् महात्मनः आहूय तेभ्यः ज्ञानोपदेशं शृणोति स्म, तान् धनादिप्रदानेन सम्मानयति स्म।
en_dmt: "He, having called forth virtuous great souls from afar, used to listen to their instruction in wisdom, and he used to honor them with gifts of wealth and so forth.  "

text: एकदा एकः महात्मा ततः दानदक्षिणाम् आदाय परावर्तमानः कैश्चित् दस्युभिः दृष्टः।
en_dmt: "Once, a great being, taking gifts and offerings from there, was seen by some robbers as he was returning.  "

text: ते दस्यवः तस्य साधोः हस्तौ कर्तयित्वा दानदक्षिणाम् आच्छिद्य च पलायितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Those robbers cut off the hands of that holy man, seized his gifts and offerings, and fled.  "

text: कतिपयमासानन्तरं सः एव महात्मा राज्ञा पुनरपि भगवच्चर्चायै आहूतः।
en_dmt: "After a few months, that great being was again invited by the king for a discussion of the Bhagavān.  "

text: अस्मिन् वारे दस्यवः अपि साधुवेषं धृत्वा तस्मिन् राजकीये सत्सङ्गे समुपस्थिताः।
en_dmt: "In this instance, even robbers, having assumed the guise of virtuous men, were present in that royal assembly.  "

text: तान् दृष्ट्वा कृत्तहस्तः महात्मा राजानं कथितवान् - "महाराज! इमे साधवः मम ज्ञानिनः सुहृदः सन्ति। इमे अवश्यं सम्माननीयाः।"
en_dmt: "Having seen them, the great being (mahātmā), whose hands were cut off, said to the king: \"Oh great king (mahārāja)! These ascetics are my wise friends. They must certainly be honored.\"  "

text: राजा तान् अपूजयत्, एकां बृहतीं धनपेटिकां च तेषाम् आवासे प्रापयितुं स्वकीयम् एकं कर्मचारिणं प्रेष्तवान्।
en_dmt: "The king honored them and sent one of his servants to deliver a large treasure chest to their dwelling.  "

text: मार्गे कर्मचारी तान् साधून् अपृच्छत् - "कथ्यताम् महात्मा भवतः कथं जानाति? कथम् असौ भवद्भ्यः इदं धनम् अदापयत्?"
en_dmt: "On the road, the officer asked the ascetics: \"Tell me, how does the great soul know you? How did he cause this wealth to be given to you?\"  "

text: साधवः उदतरन् - "सः मृत्युमुखे आसीत्। वयम् एव तं मृत्योः अमोचयाम। हस्तौ एव तस्य कर्तितौ अभवताम्। अतः एव उपकारकान् अस्मान् सः महाराजेन सममानयत्।"
en_dmt: "The good men replied: \"He was in the jaws of death (mṛtyumukhe āsīt). We ourselves rescued him from death (mṛtyoḥ amocayāma). His hands (hastau) were cut off. Therefore, he honored us, who are benefactors, as equal to the great king.\"  "

text: पृथ्वी माता तेषाम्‌ इमां निराधारवार्तां न असहत।
en_dmt: "Mother Earth did not tolerate their baseless talk.  "

text: सा व्यदीर्यत।
en_dmt: "She burst.  "

text: तत्र एव ते व्यलीयन्त।
en_dmt: "There they dissolved.  "

text: विस्मितः कर्मचारी राजानम् उपगत्य सर्वां घटनाम् अश्रावयत्।
en_dmt: "Astonished, the servant approached the king and recounted the entire incident.  "

text: कृत्तहस्तः महात्मा अपि तदा तत्र एव आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The great-souled one, whose hand was cut off, was also there at that time.  "

text: सः अपि तैः साधुभिः सह दुर्घटितां घटनाम् आकर्ण्य अतीव दुःखितः अभवत्, उच्चैः उच्चैः रोदितुं प्रावर्त्तत च।
en_dmt: "Having heard of the misfortune from those good men, he became extremely sorrowful and began to weep loudly.  "

text: किन्तु आश्चर्यं! महत् आश्चर्यम्! तदा एव सः महात्मा पुनः उत्पन्नहस्तः अजायत।
en_dmt: "But how astonishing! A great wonder! At that very moment, that great being was born again with a hand.  "

text: राजा तद् एतद् दृष्ट्वा रहस्यम् एतस्य कथयितुं महात्मानं प्रार्थितवान्।
en_dmt: "Having seen this, the king requested the great being to explain its secret.  "

text: महात्मा अकथयत् - "राजन्! सत्यम् एव ते साधवः मम सुहृदः सन्ति। भवद्भ्यः धनग्रहीतारौ हस्तौ छित्वा ते माम् उपकृतवन्तः एव। किन्तु भगवत्कृपया तौ पुनरपि उत्पन्नौ। मम एव कारणेन ते पृथिव्यां व्यलीयन्त। अनेन एव कारणेन तेषां सृहृदां वियोगेन अहम् इदानीं भृशं दुःखी सञ्जातः विलपामि च"
en_dmt: "The great soul said: \"O King! Truly, those virtuous men are my friends. By cutting off the hands of those who would take wealth from you, they indeed helped me. But by the grace of the Blessed One (bhagavat-kṛpayā), they were born again. Because of me, they perished on earth. For this very reason, I am now greatly saddened by the separation from those friends, and I lament.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: राजा कीदृशः आसीत्? सः किं करोति स्म?
en_dmt: "What was the king like? What did he do?  "

text: तेन सम्मानितेन महात्मना सह दस्यवः कीदृशं व्यवहारम् अकुर्वन्?
en_dmt: "What sort of treatment did the robbers accord to that great soul who had honored them?  "

text: दस्युभिः सह महात्मनः कीदृशः व्यवहारः आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the great-souled one's behavior with the robbers like?  "

text: महात्मा आत्मनः रोदनस्य किं कारणं राजानम्  अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "Why did the great being not tell the king the reason for his weeping?  "

text: ईश्वरः कस्मिन् तुष्टः भवति?
en_dmt: "What makes the Lord pleased?  "

text: धूर्ततः रक्षा
en_dmt: "Protection from the deceitful.  "

text: धूर्तो वाक्छलतोऽवश्यं, सौम्यं वञ्चयते सदा। अतो दूरेऽवतिष्ठेत, ततः सुमतिमाञ्जनः॥
en_dmt: "A rogue certainly always deceives the gentle with deceptive speech. Therefore, a wise man should stay far away from him.  "

text: मित्राणाम् आग्रहेण श्रेष्ठी शिवराजः रविवारे रात्रौ एकां संगीतगोष्ठीम् आयोजितवान्।
en_dmt: "At the insistence of his friends, the wealthy Śivarāja organized a musical gathering on Sunday night.  "

text: नगरस्य सुप्रसिद्धः गायकः आहूतः।
en_dmt: "A well-known singer of the city was summoned.  "

text: तस्य मधुरेण संगीतेन विद्यमानाः पारिवारिकाः सदस्याः सुहृदः च अतीव आनन्दानुभूतिं कृतवन्तः।
en_dmt: "With his sweet music, the present family members and friends experienced exceedingly great joy (atīva ānandānubhūtiṃ kṛtavantaḥ).  "

text: गायकाय पुरस्काररूपे यत्किञ्चित् ते दत्तवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Whatever they gave to the singer as a reward.  "

text: श्रेष्ठी अपि स्वकीयं पञ्चशतरूप्यकाणां पारितोषिकं वित्ताधिकारितः ग्रहीतुं गायकम् अकथयत्।
