en_dmt: "The wealthy man also told the singer to receive his own reward of five hundred silver coins from the treasurer.  "

text: अतीव प्रसन्नः भूत्वा गायकः वित्ताधिकारिणम् उपागच्छत्।
en_dmt: "Having become exceedingly pleased, the singer approached the treasurer.  "

text: किन्तु वित्ताधिकारी तस्मै न किमपि दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "But the treasurer did not give him anything.  "

text: अतः परावृत्य सः श्रेष्ठिनं तद्विषये न्यवेदयत्।
en_dmt: "Therefore, having returned, he informed the merchant about that matter.  "

text: श्रेष्ठी तं कथितवान् "गायक महाशय! भवता गानमाधुर्येण अस्मदीयकर्णेषु आनन्दानुभूतिः कारिता। मया अपि परितोषिकराशिं श्रावयित्वा भवदीयकर्णयोः आनन्दानुभूतिः कारिता एव। अतः अनेन आदानं प्रदानं च समानं समजायत। न किञ्चिता अपि प्रदानाय अवशिष्यते"
en_dmt: "The merchant said to him, \"Oh, great singer! You have caused a feeling of joy in our ears with the sweetness of your song.  I too have caused a feeling of joy in your ears by making you hear the amount of the reward.  Therefore, this giving and taking has become equal.  Nothing at all remains to be given.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: गायकस्य सङ्गीतेन प्रभाविताः सदस्याः किम् अुकुर्वन्?
en_dmt: "What did the members, who were influenced by the singer's music, do?  "

text: श्रेष्ठी गायकं किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "What did the merchant say to the singer?  "

text: वित्ताधिकारी किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the treasurer do?  "

text: श्रेष्ठी तं गायकं किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the merchant say to that singer?  "

text: धूर्तस्य स्वभावः कीदृशः भवति?
en_dmt: "What is the nature of a rogue (dhūrta)?  "

text: पशुवधिकाः दण्डनीयाः एव
en_dmt: "Animal killers [paśuvadikaḥ] are indeed to be punished [daṇḍanīyāḥ].  "

text: पशूनां मौनिनां हत्यां, ये विषेण प्रकुर्वते। दण्ड्यन्ते ते किमर्थं न, पामराः पिशिताशनाः?॥
en_dmt: "But why are those ignorant, meat-eating men not punished who kill cattle and silent [creatures] with poison?  "

text: यत्र प्रातः गवां दर्शनं पुण्यं मन्यते, तत्र तासां सामूहिकरूपे मृत्युं दृष्ट्वा गोभक्तानां महान् सम्मर्दः नाना आशङ्‌काः प्रकटयति स्म।
en_dmt: "Where seeing cows in the morning is considered meritorious, there, having seen their collective death, a great crowd of cow devotees expressed various apprehensions.  "

text: कश्चित् कथयति स्म यत् अमुकजातीयाः जनाः विषं दत्त्वा एताः मारितवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Someone said that people of a certain class killed them by giving poison.  "

text: अन्ये विचारयन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "Others pondered.  "

text: यत्  इमाः गावः दिने येषां शाकफलविक्रयिकाणां सामग्रीं खादन्ति स्म, ते एव जनाः गोस्वामिनाम् अनिष्टं कर्तुम् असमर्थाः सन्तः एताः विषप्रदानेन हतवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Those very people, who are vegetable and fruit sellers whose wares these cows ate during the day, being unable to harm the owners of the cows, killed them by giving poison.  "

text: इदम् एव न, रात्रौ बहवः बालकबालिकाः स्त्रियः पुरुषाः च अपि रुग्णाः भूत्वा चिकित्सालये प्रविष्टाः।
en_dmt: "Not only this, but at night many boys, girls, women, and men also became ill and entered the hospital.  "

text: परीक्षणेन ते अपि विषभक्षिणः आसन्।
en_dmt: "Through examination, they were also poison eaters.  "

text: यत्र तत्र अन्यजीवानाम् अपि निष्प्राणशरीराणि बीभत्सदृश्यं प्रस्तुवन्ति स्म।
en_dmt: "Here and there, even the lifeless bodies of other living beings presented a disgusting sight.  "

text: तदा एव कश्चित् समाचारपत्रस्य तत्कर्तनम् अदर्शयत्- यत्र निगमद्वारा अवार्यकुक्कुरान् मारयितुं विंशतिसहस्ररूप्यकैः 'गुलाब्जामून्'
en_dmt: "Then someone showed a newspaper clipping in which the corporation [offered] twenty thousand rupees to kill stray dogs, 'Gulabjamuns'.  "

text: नामकं मिष्टान्नं क्रेतुं निर्णीतम् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "It was decided to buy a sweet called nāmakam.  "

text: 'विषमिश्रितस्य तस्य मिष्टान्नस्य एव इयं सर्वा लीला'
en_dmt: "\"All this play is indeed of that sweet food mixed with poison.\"  "

text: इति मत्वा सर्वः अपि क्रुद्धः जनसम्मर्दः स्वकीयम् आक्रोशं नगरनिगमस्य इदं दुराचरणं प्रति अभिव्यक्तं कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Thinking thus, the entire crowd, filled with anger, expressed their outrage towards this misbehavior of the city corporation.  "

text: श्रूयते, केनचित् तु जीवानुरागिणा न्यायालये एतस्मिन् सम्बन्धे याचिका अपि प्रस्तुता इति।
en_dmt: "It is heard that a petition has even been filed in court by someone sympathetic to the animals in this connection.  "

text: सामूहिकरूपे गवां मृत्युं दृष्ट्वा गोभक्ताः कीदृशाः आशङ्‌काः प्रकटयन्ति स्म?
en_dmt: "Seeing the collective death of cows, what kind of fears did the devotees of cows express?  "

text: समाचारपत्रस्य कर्तने किं लिखितम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was written in the newspaper clipping?  "

text: तस्य लेखस्य श्रवणेन गोभक्तेषु का प्रतिक्रिया अभवत्?
en_dmt: "What was the reaction among the cow devotees upon hearing that letter?  "

text: न्यायालये याचिका केन कस्मिन् विषये प्रस्तुता?
en_dmt: "In which court, by whom, and regarding what subject was the petition presented?  "

text: के दण्डिताः न क्रियन्ते?
en_dmt: "Who are not punished?  "

text: कार्यं सिध्यति धैर्येण
en_dmt: "A task is accomplished by patience.  "

text: धैर्यं स्वं न परित्याज्यं, सङ्‌कटे समुपस्थिते। धैर्यादुद्धरते व्यक्तिः, स्वात्मानं नात्र संशयः॥
en_dmt: "One should not abandon one's own firmness when difficulties arise. Through firmness, a person delivers himself; there is no doubt about it.  "

text: एकः कुम्भकारः स्वपुत्रं श्यामं मृत्तिकाम् आनेतुं वने प्रेषितवान्।
en_dmt: "A potter sent his son Shyama to the forest to bring clay.  "

text: श्यामः तत्र गत्वा सिंहस्य गर्दभस्य च मध्ये जायमानं द्वन्द्वम् अपश्यत्।
en_dmt: "Śyāma went there and saw the conflict arising between the lion and the donkey.  "

text: गर्दभस्य लत्तया आहतः सिंहः पलायितः।
en_dmt: "The lion, struck by the kick of a donkey, fled.  "

text: पलायमानः सः एकस्य वृक्षस्य पृष्ठे निलीनं श्यामं दृष्ट्वा तम् आदिष्टवान् - "ग्रामे सः न कथयतु यत् सिंहः गर्दभस्य लत्तया आहतः भूत्वा पलायितः। यदि सः कथयिष्यति तर्हि तं ग्रामतः उत्थाप्य वने आनीय खादिष्यति।"
en_dmt: "Fleeing, he saw a dark-complexioned man hidden behind a tree and ordered him: \"He should not say in the village that the lion, struck by the donkey's kick, fled. If he says [it], then having removed him from the village, he will bring [him] into the forest and eat [him].\"  "

text: श्यामः तस्य आदेशं स्वीकृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Shyāma accepted his order.  "

text: किन्तु गृहे आगत्य सः विषण्णमुखः स्थितः।
en_dmt: "But having come home, he stood there with a sad face.  "

text: वारं वारं मातापितृभ्यां पृष्टः सः वनघटनाम् आश्रावयत्।
en_dmt: "Having been asked again and again by his father and mother, he related the events in the forest.  "

text: रात्रौ सः गृहाद् बहिः एव खट्वायां सुप्तः।
en_dmt: "At night, he slept on a cot outside the house.  "

text: सिंहः अपि श्यामेन अदृश्यमानः अन्येन मार्गेण श्यामगृहम् आगतः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The lion, unseen by Śyāma, came to Śyāma's house by another path.  "

text: तेन श्यामकथिता सर्वा अपि वार्ता श्रुता।
en_dmt: "Having heard all the news spoken by Śyāmaka.  "

text: सः खट्वासहितम् एव सुप्तं श्यामं स्वपृष्ठे उत्थाप्य प्रचलितः।
en_dmt: "He lifted the black one sleeping on the cot onto his back and departed.  "

text: यदा सः वने गच्छन् आसीत्, तदा जागरितः श्यामः एकस्य वटवृक्षस्य लम्बमानां जटाम् अवलम्ब्य तया उपरि वटवृक्षम् आरूढः।
en_dmt: "When he was going in the forest, then the awakened Shyama, having taken hold of the hanging root of a banyan tree, climbed up the banyan tree by it.  "

text: अस्य ज्ञानं सिंहस्य तदा एव अभवत् - यदा सः स्वगृहं प्राप्य खट्वां पृष्ठतः नीचैः उदतारयत्।
en_dmt: "At that moment, the lion realized [this] when he reached his own home and lowered the couch from his back.  "

text: पुनः अन्वेष्टुं परावृत्तः सः श्यामं वृक्षे निलीनं दृष्ट्वा समौनं ततः निर्गत्य सर्वान् अपि दश द्वादश स्वपरिवारसदस्यान् सिंहान् तत्र आनीतवान्।
en_dmt: "Again, he turned back to search. Seeing the dark one hidden in the tree, he silently went from there and brought all ten or twelve members of his family of lions there.  "

text: पुनः सर्वे अपि ते वृक्षस्य समीपे एकस्य उपरि एकः कृत्वा आरूढाः।
en_dmt: "Furthermore, all of them climbed the tree, one on top of the other, near it.  "

text: अधस्तात् सः एव सिंहः स्थितः आसीत् - यः गर्दभस्य लत्तया प्रहतः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Below, the very same lion was situated, the one who had been struck by the donkey's kick.  "

text: उपरि स्थितः सिंहः यथा एव श्यामं निग्रहीतम् उद्यतः, तथा एव प्रत्युत्पन्नमतिः श्यामः उच्चैः अकथयत् - " अरे रे ! पश्यत पश्यत। सम्मुखे सः एव गर्दभः आगच्छन् अस्ति।"
en_dmt: "Just as a lion standing above was about to seize Śyāma, so the quick-witted Śyāma loudly exclaimed, \"Hey, hey! Look, look! That very donkey is coming in front.\"  "

text: इदं श्रुत्वा एव गर्दभनाम्ना भीतः सिंहेषु अधः स्थितः सिंहः यथा एव निःसृत्य पलायितः, तथा एव उपरि स्थिताः सर्वे अपि सिंहाः निपत्य पलायिताः।
en_dmt: "Having heard this, just as a lion, frightened by the name of donkey, who was standing below the lions, ran away, so too, all the lions standing above, having fallen down, ran away.  "

text: एवं सर्वेषु सिंहेषु निर्गतेषु श्यामः अपि वृक्षात् अवतीर्य सकुशलं गृहं प्रत्यागच्छत् इति।
en_dmt: "Thus, when all the lions had departed, Śyāma also descended from the tree and safely returned home.  "

text: सिंहः श्यामं किम् आदिष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did the lion command to Shyama?  "

text: किं श्यामः सिंहस्य आदेशं पालितवान् ?
en_dmt: "Did Śyāma obey the lion's command?  "

text: सिंहः श्यामं कुत्र अनयत् किं च अकरोत् ?
en_dmt: "Where did the lion lead Shyama, and what did he do?  "

text: श्यामः सिंहनिग्रहणतः आत्मानं कथम् अरक्षत् ?
en_dmt: "How did Shyama protect himself from being seized by the lion?  "

text: धैर्यधारणेन किं भवति ?
en_dmt: "What is the result of having perseverance (dhairya-dhāraṇa)?  "

text: अनुमतिं विना पत्रपाठकः दोषी
en_dmt: "A letter reader is guilty without permission.  "

text: अनुमत्या विना पत्रं, नैव वाच्यं कदाचन। अन्या मन्यते दोषी, निन्द्यते चोपहस्यते॥
en_dmt: "A letter should never be read without permission. Another thinks [you are] guilty, and [you] are censured and ridiculed.  "

text: प्रश्नपत्रनिर्देशानुसारम् उत्तरपुस्तिकायां मित्राय पत्रं लेखनीयम् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "According to the instructions on the question paper, a letter to a friend had to be written in the answer book.  "

text: रमेशः अर्धं पत्रम् अलिखत् एव यत् पर्यवेक्षकः तस्य समीपे आगत्य स्थितः, पत्रं च पठितुं प्रवृत्तः।
en_dmt: "Rameśa had only written half the letter when the supervisor came and stood near him, and began to read the letter.  "

text: तस्य अयं व्यवहारः रमेशाय नैव अरोचत।
en_dmt: "This behavior of his was not at all pleasing to Rameśa.  "

text: सः स्वकीयं पत्रम् अग्रे एवम् उपसंहृतवान्।
en_dmt: "He concluded his own letter in the following way.  "

text: "मित्र! लेखनार्थं तु बहु अस्ति। परन्तु एकः अशिष्टः जनः इदं पत्रं पठन् वर्तते। अतः अग्रिमे अन्यस्मिन् कस्मिंश्चित् पत्रे अवशिष्टं लेखनीयं प्रस्तोष्यामि"
en_dmt: "Friend! There is much for writing.  But, one rude person is reading this letter.  Therefore, I propose to write the remaining [content] in another letter later.  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: भवदीयः
en_dmt: "Yours.  "
"Who?, kha?, ga?  "

text: रमेशः किं कुर्वन् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was Rameśa doing?  "

text: पर्यवेक्षकः किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the supervisor do?  "

text: रमेशाय किं न अरोचत?
en_dmt: "Why was it that [something] was not pleasing to Rameśa?  "

text: रमेशः तदा किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did Rameśa do then?  "

text: कः दोषी मन्यते? कं जनाः उपहसन्ति?
en_dmt: "Who is considered guilty? Whom do people ridicule?  "

text: महाकालः न मारकः
en_dmt: "Mahākāla is not a killer.  "

text: महाकालो न कस्यापि, मृत्यौ हेतुर्हि जायते। अन्ये रोगादयः किन्तु, जायन्ते तत्र हेतवः॥
en_dmt: "Mahākāla is not the cause of death for anyone; but other things, such as diseases, are the causes that arise there.  "

text: महाकालम् एकदा तस्य जननी कथितवती - "पुत्र ! प्राणिनां  प्राणापहरणात् त्वं विरम। तेषां, तेषां च सम्बन्धिनाम् अनेन महत् अनिर्वचनीयं कष्टं भवति। तैः त्वम् अभिशप्तः मा भव। इदम् अहं कामये। त्वं मम एकः एव पुत्रः। यदि तव किञ्चित् भविष्यति तर्हि अहं किं करिष्यामि? वृद्धायाः मम एकाम् इमां शिक्षां मन्यस्व।"
en_dmt: "Once, Mahākāla's mother said to him: \"Son! Refrain from taking the lives of beings. By this, those beings and their relatives experience great, indescribable suffering. Do not be cursed by them. This I desire. You are my only son (ekaḥ eva putraḥ). If something happens to you, then what will I do? Accept this one piece of advice from me, an old woman.\"  "

text: महाकालः स्मयमानः ताम् उदतरत् - "मातः! कुत्र अहं प्राणान् अपहरामि? मरणं प्रकृतिः शरीरिणाम्। इदं सर्वविदितम् अस्ति। यदि न विश्वसिषि। तर्हि त्वां नयामि। प्रत्यक्षं पश्य। अहं न कम् अपि मारयामि।"
en_dmt: "Mahākāla, smiling, answered her: \"Mother! Where do I steal life? Death is the nature of embodied beings. This is known to all. If you do not believe [it], then I will take you [there]. See directly. I do not kill anyone.\"  "

text: इति कथयित्वा सः ताम् अन्यैः अदृश्यमानः भूलोके अभ्रामयत्।
en_dmt: "Having said this, he, invisible to the others, wandered with her on the earth.  "

text: यत्र यत्र प्राणी मृतः आसीत्, तत्र तत्र उपस्थिता माता तत्सम्बन्धिनः पृष्टवती - "कथम् अयं मृतः?"
en_dmt: "Wherever a living being had died, the mother went there and asked those related to the deceased, \"How did this one die?\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: अस्य उत्तरे न कश्चित् अपि अवदत् यत् महाकालः तं मारितवान्, प्रत्युत भिन्नभिन्नकारणानि एव तस्य मृत्यौ निरदिशत्।
en_dmt: "To this question, no one at all replied that Mahākāla had killed him; on the contrary, they indicated various different causes for his death.  "

text: एतद् आकर्ण्य माता प्रसन्ना अभवत् यत् प्राणिनां मृत्यौ तस्य पुत्रः हेतुः न अस्ति, अपि तु अन्यानि एव आघातरोगविषसेवनादीनि एव निमित्तानि सन्ति इति।
en_dmt: "Having heard this, the mother became pleased that her son was not the cause ( *hetuḥ*) of the death of living beings, but rather other things such as blows, diseases, consuming poison, and so forth, were the causes ( *nimittāni*).  "

text: महाकालं तस्य जननी किं कथितवती?
en_dmt: "What did his mother say to Mahākāla?  "

text: स्वजननीं महाकालः तदा किम् उदतरत्?
en_dmt: "What did Mahākāla then say to his own mother?  "

text: जननी महाकालेन सह कुत्र कुत्र अभ्रमत्?
en_dmt: "Where all did the mother wander with the great Time (mahākāla)?  "

text: जननी कं कं किं पृष्टवती?
en_dmt: "What all did the mother ask?  "

text: जननी प्रसन्ना कदा अभवत्?
en_dmt: "When did the mother become pleased?  "

text: साधुसङ्गः वृत्तिलाभः
en_dmt: "Association with the virtuous is the acquisition of livelihood.  "

text: वृत्तिश्चेद् मिलते नैव, जनश्चौर्ये प्रवर्तते । साधुसङ्गो वृत्तिलाभश्चौर्यकर्मनिवारकः ॥
en_dmt: "If livelihood is not obtained, people resort to theft. Association with the virtuous and obtaining a livelihood are deterrents to the act of theft.  "

text: राज्ञः भोजस्य राज्ये दुर्मुखः नामकः एकः चौरः निवसति स्म।
en_dmt: "In the kingdom of King Bhoja, there lived a thief named Durmukha.  "

text: किन्तु अधिकतरं सः चौर्यं कर्तुं न पारितवान्।
en_dmt: "But mostly, he was not able to commit theft.  "

text: अनेन दुःखी सः प्रतिवेशिराज्ये प्रवेष्टुं रात्रौ प्रचलितः।
en_dmt: "Afflicted by this, he set out at night to enter the neighboring kingdom.  "

text: मध्ये एकं साध्वाश्रमं प्राप्य तत्र एव स्थितः।
en_dmt: "Having reached a good hermitage in the middle, he stayed right there.  "

text: साधुः तस्य भव्यम् आतिथ्यं कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "The pious man offered him a splendid hospitality.  "

text: अनेन प्रसन्नः सः चौरः प्रातः तं प्रणम्य तां विद्यां शिक्षयितुं प्रार्थयत, यथा सः भव्यां भोगसामग्रीं निष्पादितवान्।
en_dmt: "Pleased by this, that thief bowed to him in the morning and requested him to teach him that *vidyā* (knowledge/magic), by which he had obtained excellent resources for enjoyment.  "

text: साधुः तथा प्रतिज्ञातवान् तम् उपदिष्टवान् च- "त्वं कमपि व्यवसायं कुर्याः किन्तु असत्यं कदापि न वदेः, न च यस्य अन्नं भक्षयेः तं हानिं प्रापयेः।"
en_dmt: "The ascetic thus promised and instructed him: \"You should do some business, but never speak untruthfully, nor cause harm to him whose food you eat.\"  "

text: चौरः तथा स्वीकृत्य राज्ञः भोजस्य एव प्रासादे चौर्यं कर्तुं ततः परावृत्तः।
en_dmt: "Having accepted that, the thief then turned back to commit the theft in the palace of King Bhoja himself.  "

text: अर्द्धरात्रे सः सामन्तवेषं धृत्वा राजप्रासादं प्रविष्टः।
en_dmt: "At midnight, he, having assumed the guise of a vassal, entered the royal palace (rājaprāsāda).  "

text: प्रहरिणा पृष्टः सः आत्मानं चौरम् एव पर्यचाययत्।
en_dmt: "Being questioned by the guard, he introduced himself as a thief.  "

text: किन्तु प्रहरी तथा न विश्वस्य तं प्रवेशात् नैव निवारितवान्।
en_dmt: "But the guard, not trusting him, did not prevent him from entering.  "

text: निर्बाधं चौरः भोजस्य शयनकक्षे प्रविष्टः।
en_dmt: "The thief entered Bhoja's bedroom unimpeded.  "

text: तदा भोजः नगरीसुरक्षाव्यवस्थां द्रष्टुं निर्गतः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Then Bhoja had set out to see the city's security arrangements.  "

text: चौरः सर्वां स्वाभीष्टां सामग्रीं सङ्‌कलितां कृत्वा चलितुम् एव उद्यतः अभवत् यत् तत्र एकस्मिन् पात्रे रक्षिते मिष्टान्ने तस्य दृष्टिः न्यपतत्।
en_dmt: "The thief, having collected all the materials he desired and being just about ready to leave, then his gaze fell upon the sweets kept in a certain vessel there.  "

text: सः तद् भक्षितवान्।
en_dmt: "He ate that.  "

text: भक्षणोत्तरं तस्य स्मृतौ साधोः वाक्यम् आयातं यत् 'यस्य अन्नं भक्षयेः तं हानिं न प्रापयेः।'
en_dmt: "After eating, the following words of the *sādhu* came to his mind: \"One should not harm him whose food one eats.\"  "

text: चौरः सर्वां सामाग्रीं तत्र एव परित्यज्य रिक्तहस्तः ततः निर्गतः।
en_dmt: "The thief, abandoning all the equipment right there, went out from there empty-handed.  "

text: पश्चात् परावृत्तः भोजः कक्षे इदं दुर्दृश्यं दृष्टवान्, तदा प्रातः 'दुर्मुखस्य एव इदं कृत्यं स्यात्'
en_dmt: "Afterwards, Bhoja, turning back, saw this unsightly thing in the inner apartment. Then, in the morning, he thought, \"This must be the deed of Durmukha.\"  "

text: इति अनुमाय तम् आहूतवान्।
en_dmt: "Having inferred thus, he called him.  "

text: राज्ञा पृष्टः च सः सर्वं सत्यम् अकथयत्।
en_dmt: "Having been asked by the king, he told all the truth.  "

text: अनेन सन्तुष्टः राजा तं भूरि भूरि प्रशंसितवान्, स्वकीये रक्षाविभागे च नियुक्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Pleased by this, the king greatly praised him again and again, and appointed him to his own department of protection (rakṣā-vibhāga).  "

text: इदानीं दुर्मुखः अपि सुमुखः भूत्वा चौर्यकर्म पर्यत्यजत् इति।
en_dmt: "Now, even the ill-tempered one, having become good-tempered, abandoned the act of theft.  "

text: दुर्मुखः साधुतः कां विद्यां शिक्षयितुं प्रार्थितवान् ?
en_dmt: "What kind of knowledge did the ugly-faced one (Durmukha) request to be taught well?  "

text: साधुः दुर्मुखं किम् उपदिष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What good advice did the wicked-faced one give?  "

text: दुर्मुखः राज्ञः भोजस्य शयनकक्षे किं कृतवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did Durmukha do in King Bhoja's bedchamber?  "

text: राजा भोजः दुर्मुखं किं पृष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did King Bhoja ask Durmukha?  "

text: दुर्मुखः राज्ञे भोजाय किम् उदतरत् ?
en_dmt: "What did Durmukha report to King Bhoja?  "

text: रोगी साक्षात् ईश्वरः
en_dmt: "The sick person is directly God (Īśvara).  "

text: रुग्णं स्वमीश्वरं मत्वा, यः सम्यक् परिषेवते। सन्तुष्ट  ईश्वरस्तेन,   तत्सामीप्यं न मुञ्चति ॥
en_dmt: "Considering the sick person as his own master (svāmīśvara), one who serves him well, that contented (santuṣṭa) master (īśvara) does not abandon his proximity (tātsāmīpyam).  "

text: एकदा महर्षिरमणं परीक्षितुम् एव केचन गिरिजागृहस्वामिनः पृष्टवन्तः- "श्रुतम् अस्ति, भवान् धर्माचरणशीलः कृतपरमेश्वरसाक्षात्कारः च वर्तते। स्वीयम् आराध्यं परमेश्वरम् अस्मान् अपि दर्शयतु, अन्यथा वयं भवन्तं पाखण्डिनं वञ्चकं धूर्तं च एव प्रचारयिष्यामः।"
en_dmt: "Once, some householders from Girijā, just to test the great sage Ramaṇa, asked: \"It is heard that you are virtuous and have realized the supreme lord. Show us your worshipful supreme lord, otherwise we will proclaim you to be a heretic, a deceiver, and a rogue.\"  "

text: तेषां कर्कशवचनैः अपि अखिद्यमानः एव महर्षिः तु तान् सौम्यवाचा सम्मोहयन् इव उदतरत् - "आम्, श्वः प्रातः दर्शयिष्यामि स्वं परमेश्वरम्। साम्प्रतं विश्रम्यतां तावत्।"
en_dmt: "Though unperturbed by their harsh words, the great sage, as if beguiling them with gentle speech, replied: \"Yes, tomorrow morning I will show you my Supreme Lord (parameśvaram). For now, please rest.\"  "

text: इदम् उक्त्वा रात्रौ स्वस्य आवासे एव तान् अवासयत्, भोजनपानादिना च तान् सम्यक् सत्कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Having said this, at night he lodged them in his own dwelling and properly honored them with food, drink, and so on.  "

text: अन्येद्युः प्रातः तान् आदाय रमणः नद्याः तीरे एकां कुटीं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "The next day, in the morning, taking them along, Ramaṇa reached a hut on the bank of the river.  "

text: तत्र सः निवासिनौ वृद्धौ कुष्ठिनौ दम्पती तैलाभ्यङ्गस्नानादिना विशोध्य भोजनं पक्त्वा भोजितवान्।
en_dmt: "There, he purified an elderly, leprous couple who were living there with oil massage, bathing, and so on, cooked food, and fed them.  "

text: एवम् आचरति तस्मिन् ते स्वं प्रभुम् ईसामसीहम् एव साक्षात्कुर्वन्तः परमं प्रसन्नाः अजायन्त, तस्य अग्रे आत्मानं हीनम् एव मत्वा तं पुनः पुनः क्षमां याचितवन्तः, सबहुमानं च तं प्रणम्य परावृत्ताः इति।
en_dmt: "While he acted thus, they, directly realizing their lord Īśāmasīha himself, became exceedingly pleased; considering themselves inferior before him, they repeatedly begged his forgiveness, and having bowed to him with great respect, they departed.  "

text: महर्षिरमणं गिरिजागृहस्वामिनः किं कथितवन्तः?
en_dmt: "What did the great sage Ramaṇa say to the lord of Girijā's house?  "

text: गिरिजागृहस्वामिनः महर्षिः रमणः कुत्र अनयत्?
en_dmt: "Where did the great sage, Ramaṇa, the owner of Girijā's house, take [him]?  "

text: महर्षिरमणं किं कुर्वन्तं गिरिजागृहस्वामिनः अपश्यन्?
en_dmt: "What were the masters of Girijā's house seeing the great ṛṣi Ramaṇa doing?  "

text: पश्चात् गिरिजागृहस्वामिनः महर्षिरमणेन सह कीदृशं व्यवहारं कृतवन्तः?
en_dmt: "Afterwards, what kind of behavior did the homeowners of Girijā do with the great sage Ramaṇa?  "

text: ईश्वरः किङ्‌करणेन सन्तुष्टः भवति?
en_dmt: "With what kind of action is Īśvara satisfied?  "

text: स्वदेशभक्तस्यव्यवहारः
en_dmt: "The conduct of one devoted to their own country.  "

text: मातृभूमिः प्रिया यस्य, नाऽकार्यं कुरुते हि सः। प्राणाहुतिप्रदानेऽपि, पृष्ठे तिष्ठति न क्वचित्॥
en_dmt: "He who loves his motherland never does what should not be done. Even in offering his life, he never stays behind.  "

text: "निर्भयः तिष्ठ। अत्र त्वं सुखी भवितासि"
en_dmt: "Be fearless. Here, you will be happy.  "

text: भयेन कम्पमानं 20-25 वर्षीयं युवकं सेनाध्यक्षः आश्वासयत्।
en_dmt: "The commander reassured the young man, 20-25 years old, who was trembling with fear.  "

text: "हा हन्त! अहं सैनिकैः अपहृतः अस्मि। वृद्धौ मातापितरौ मां प्रतीक्षेते। विकार्यता मां मम कुटुम्बं च पूर्वतः एव उत्पीडयति। त्यजतु मां त्यजतु"
en_dmt: "Alas, I have been captured by the soldiers! My elderly parents are waiting for me. Poverty oppresses me and my family from before. Release me, release me!  "

text: युवकः सेनाध्यक्षस्य पादौ गृह्णन् प्रार्थितवान्।
en_dmt: "The youth, grasping the feet of the commander, pleaded.  "

text: "युवक! धैर्यं धर। अधुना विकार्यतां स्वां विनष्टाम् एव जानीहि। अस्माकं पक्षे सम्मिल्य स्वदेशं प्रति आतङ्‌ककारी भव। अयं स्वदेशः एव ते शिक्षितस्य अपि विकार्यतायाः हेतुः। प्रतिशोधं गृह्णीष्व त्वम् इतः"
en_dmt: "Young man! Take courage. Now, consider your own power as destroyed. Join our side and become a terror against your own land. This very land is the cause of the destruction of even your learning. Take revenge from here.  "

text: सेनाध्यक्षः बोधितवान्।
en_dmt: "The commander-in-chief awakened [someone].  "

text: "नहि नहि, इदं न सम्भवति। मातृभूमिं प्रति कृतघ्नः न भविष्यामि।"
en_dmt: "No, no, this is not possible. I will not be ungrateful to the motherland (mātṛbhūmi).  "

text: युवकः उदतरत्।
en_dmt: "The youth crossed over.  "

text: "तर्हि त्वं त्यक्ष्यसे अपि नैव। अत्र एव त्वया सह दासतः अपि निकृष्टतरः व्यवहारः करिष्यते। पश्यामः कथं त्वं जीवितः तिष्ठसि?"
en_dmt: "Then you will not be abandoned. Here, even a more wretched treatment than slavery will be done to you. Let's see how you remain alive?  "

text: सेनाध्यक्षस्य सङ्‌केतेन सैनिकाः तं निर्जने नीत्वा मारयन्ति।
en_dmt: "At the signal of the commander, the soldiers take him to a deserted place and kill him.  "

text: गुलिकाशब्दः शून्ये विलीनः भवति इति।
en_dmt: "The term *gulika* dissolves into emptiness (*śūnyatā*).  "

text: सैनिकः सेनाध्यक्षं किं प्रार्थितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the soldier request of the general?  "

text: सैनिकं सेनाध्यक्षः किं कर्तुं प्रबोधितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the commander exhort the soldier to do?  "

text: किं सैनिकः सेनाध्यक्षस्य कथनम् अमन्यत?
en_dmt: "Did the soldier disregard the commander's statement?  "

text: यदि नैव अमन्यत तर्हि तस्य का दशा कृता?
en_dmt: "If he did not think so, then what condition was made of him?  "

text: स्वदेशभक्तः कीदृशं व्यवहारं करोति?
en_dmt: "How does a patriot behave?  "

text: अवसरानुरूपशब्दप्रयोगप्रभावः
en_dmt: "The power of using words appropriately according to the occasion.  "

text: अवसरोपयुक्तो यः, शब्दः क्वचित् प्रयुज्यते। प्रभावकृत् स किं भूत्वा, प्रयोक्त्रे न यशस्करः?॥
en_dmt: "That word, which is appropriately used on occasion, Having become effective, why is it not glorious for the user?  "

text: पूर्वं विद्वत्तायाः परीक्षणं शास्त्रार्थद्वारा भवति स्म।
en_dmt: "Previously, the examination of scholarship occurred through the meaning of the scriptures.  "

text: एकदा कश्चित् अभिनवः एव विद्वान् शास्त्रार्थी भूत्वा दिग्विजययात्रायै निःसृतः।
en_dmt: "Once, a certain newly (abhinava) learned (vidvān) man, having become a disputant (śāstrārthī), set out on a journey of conquest (digvijayayātrāyai niḥsṛtaḥ).  "

text: क्रमशः सः चतुर्दिक्षु शास्त्रार्थे तत्रत्यान् पण्डितान् पराजित्य वाराणसीं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "Gradually, he, having defeated the local scholars in debates on the scriptures in all four directions, reached Vārāṇasī.  "

text: तत्र एकस्यां पण्डितसभायां स्वकीयं शास्त्रार्थं प्रारम्भमाणः सः एवम् अभाषत- "अहं स्वकीयाम् एकां लघुशङ्‌कां प्रस्तौमि यत्.....।"
en_dmt: "There, in an assembly of learned scholars, as he began his own exposition of the scriptures, he spoke thus: \"I present one small doubt of my own, namely...  "

text: मध्ये एव तं निवारयन् सम्मुखस्थः शास्त्रार्थी विद्वान् कथितवान्- "महाशय! भवदीया लघुशङ्‌का भवतु दीर्घशङ्‌का वा, तां स्वमुखे एव रक्षतु। इदं स्थानं तदर्थं न अस्ति।"
en_dmt: "Interrupting him in the middle, the learned scholar standing before him said: \"Sir, whether your small doubt or large doubt, keep it to yourself.  There is no opportunity for that here.\"  "

text: इदं श्रुत्वा यत्र सभ्याः उच्चैः हसितवन्तः, तत्र लघुशङ्‌काकारिणः मुखाकृतिः दर्शनीया एव आसीत् इति।
en_dmt: "Having heard this, the expression on the face of the one who caused a slight doubt, where the assembly members laughed loudly, was indeed worth seeing.  "

text: पुरा विद्वत्तापरीक्षणं कथं भवति स्म?
en_dmt: "How was the examination of scholars done in the past?  "

text: शास्त्रार्थी किं कृत्वा प्राप्तः?
en_dmt: "How is the meaning of the treatise attained? (kathaṃ kṛtvā)  "

text: सः पण्डितसभायाम् किं अभाषत?
en_dmt: "What did he say in the assembly of learned men (paṇḍita-sabhā)?  "

text: सम्मुखस्थः शास्त्रार्थी तदा किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What, then, did the master of doctrine who was present say?  "

text: अनया कथया कः सन्देशः मिलति?
en_dmt: "What message is obtained from this story?  "

text: न स्वाभाविकता त्याज्या
en_dmt: "Naturalness cannot be abandoned.  "

text: यः स्वाभाविकतां त्यक्त्वा, कृत्रिमतामुपाश्रयेत्। शोभां प्राप्नोति नैवासौ, वाच्यो भवति सर्वतः॥
en_dmt: "He who abandons naturalness (svabhāvatāṃ tyaktvā) and resorts to artificiality (kṛtrimatām upāśrayet), that person never attains beauty (śobhāṃ prāpnoti naivāsau) and is criticized everywhere (vācyo bhavati sarvataḥ).  "

text: एकदा भारतवर्षस्य प्रथमः प्रधानमन्त्री श्रीजवाहरलालनेहरुः कस्याश्चित् जलसेचनयोजनायाः उद्घाटनं कर्तुं गतः।
en_dmt: "Once, the first Prime Minister of India, Śrī Jawaharlal Nehru, went to inaugurate some irrigation project.  "

text: आयोजकाः रजतखनित्रं तस्य हस्ते दत्तवन्तः।
en_dmt: "The organizers gave the silver shovel into his hand.  "

text: नेहरुः तदेकतः प्राक्षिपत्, लोहस्य च उत्थाय तान् अपृच्छत्- "किं भारतीयः कृषकः रजतखनित्रेण खनति?"
en_dmt: "Nehru then threw one of them aside and, picking up an iron [tool], asked them, \"Does an Indian farmer dig with a silver mining tool?\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: श्रीजवाहरलालनेहरवे कदा के किं दत्तवन्तः?
en_dmt: "When and what did [someone] give to Śrī Jawaharlal Nehru?  "

text: अस्य नेहरौ का प्रतिक्रिया आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the reaction of the two to this?  "

text: सः आयोजकान् किम् अपृच्छत्?
en_dmt: "What did he ask the organizers?  "

text: किं तदा आयोजकाः नेहरुं सन्तुष्टं कृतवन्तः?
en_dmt: "Did the organizers satisfy Nehru then?  "

text: शोभां कः प्राप्नोति?
en_dmt: "Who attains beauty?  "

text: अनिष्टकर्तुः स्वभावः।।
en_dmt: "The nature of one who causes harm. (aniṣṭakartuḥ svabhāvaḥ)  "

text: अन्यानिष्टचिकीर्षुर्ना, स्वानिष्टं समुपेक्षते। सोऽन्यापशकुनं कर्तुं, छिनत्ते स्वां नासिकामपि॥
en_dmt: "He who wishes to do evil to others does not disregard his own harm. He, in order to make a bad omen for others, even cuts off his own nose.  "

text: एकस्मिन् ग्रामे निवासिनोः द्वयोः प्रतिवेशिनोः मध्ये प्रारम्भे तु अतीव घनिष्ठं प्रेम आसीत्, परं पश्चात् केनचित् कारणेन तदेव प्रेम घोरशत्रुतायां परिवर्तितम् अभवत्।
en_dmt: "In a certain village, there was initially very deep love between two neighbors living [there], but later, due to some reason, that same love was transformed into fierce enmity.  "

text: अधुना द्वयोः अपि एकः अन्यस्य अनिष्टं कर्तुम् अवसरं प्रतीक्षते स्म।
en_dmt: "Now, both of them were waiting for an opportunity to do harm to each other.  "

text: अथ एकदा कालिकोपासनायां रते एकस्मिन् प्रतिवेशिनि कालिकाप्रत्यक्षं दर्शनं दत्त्वा तं वरं याचितुं कथितवती, सह एव इदम् अपि सूचितवती यत् सः यावत् याचिष्यते, ततः द्विगुणितं तस्य प्रतिवेशी प्राप्स्यति।
en_dmt: "Then, once, while a neighbor was engaged in the worship of Kālī, Kālī appeared to him in person and told him to ask for a boon, also indicating that whatever he would ask for, his neighbor would receive twice as much.  "

text: इदम् आकर्ण्य सः बहुविचारं कृत्वा आत्मनः काणत्वम् अयाचत।
en_dmt: "Having heard this, he, having done much thinking, requested blindness for himself.  "

text: अनेन वरदानेन यत्र तस्मै काणत्वं मिलितं, तत्र अन्यः प्रतिवेशी अन्धः एव सञ्जातः इति।
en_dmt: "By this boon, where he received the condition of being one-eyed (kāṇatva), there another neighbor became blind (andha) instead.  "

text: द्वयोः प्रतिवेशिनोः प्रेम घोरशत्रुतायां किं परिवर्तितम् ?
en_dmt: "How did the love of two neighbors turn into bitter enmity?  "

text: एकः प्रतिवेशी अन्यस्य प्रतिवेशिनः अनिष्टाय किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What harm did one neighbor do to another neighbor?  "

text: तस्य कः परिणामः अभवत्?
en_dmt: "What was its result?  "

text: अन्यस्य अनिष्टं कर्तुम् इच्छुकः जनः कस्य उपेक्षां करोति?
en_dmt: "Whose well-being does a person who wishes to do harm to another disregard?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: संस्कृतेन संस्कारसम्पन्नता
en_dmt: "Through Sanskrit, the attainment of refinement.  "

text: संस्कृतं यो विजानाति, संस्कृतः स हि देवराट्। संस्कृतं यो न जानाति, संस्कृतः स कथं भवेत्?॥
en_dmt: "He who knows Sanskrit is truly a king of the gods (devarāṭ). He who does not know Sanskrit, how can he be refined (saṃskṛta)?  "

text: मम एकः दूरस्थः सम्बन्धी कार्यवशात् यदा जयपुरे आयातः, तदा माम् अपि द्रष्टुं गृहे उपस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Once, when a distant relative of mine came to Jaipur for some work, he also came to my house to see me.  "

text: अहं तं स्वकक्षे उपावेशयम्।
en_dmt: "I seated him on my lap.  "

text: मम पुत्रः तदा विद्यालयतः आगतः एव आसीत्।
en_dmt: "My son had just come from school then.  "

text: सः इमम् अपूर्वदृष्टम् अपि सम्बन्धिनं सचरणस्पर्शम् अभ्यवन्दत।
en_dmt: "He bowed down to this relative, though his appearance was unprecedented, touching his feet.  "

text: तस्य अनेन व्यवहारेण सन्तुष्टः सः स्वीयम् आशीर्वादं दत्त्वा विश्रमितुं पुत्रं प्रेषितवान्।
en_dmt: "Pleased with him by this conduct, he gave his own blessing and sent his son to rest.  "

text: पुनः मम पुत्रेण सह स्वपुत्रस्य तुलनां कुर्वन् सः मां पृष्टवान् "बन्धुवर! बालम् इमं भवान् कुत्र पाठयति? तत्र तु उत्तमाः संस्काराः दीयन्ते"
en_dmt: "Then, comparing his son with my son, he asked me, \"O best of friends! Where do you teach this boy? Surely excellent saṃskāras (cultural values, mental impressions) are imparted there.\"  "
"[Tibetan missing. See note below.]  "

text: अहम् उदतरम् "महाशय! अहं संस्कृतज्ञः अस्मि। संस्कृतविद्यालये एव पाठयामि। संस्कृतभाषायाः सम्पर्के आगन्तुकः किं न संस्कृतः अर्थात् संस्कारसम्पन्नः भवेत्?"
en_dmt: "I replied, \"Sir! I am a knower of Sanskrit (saṃskṛtajñaḥ). I teach only in a Sanskrit school. Why should not a newcomer in contact with the Sanskrit language be refined, that is, endowed with culture (saṃskārasampannaḥ)?\"  "

text: सः अकथयत् "अहम् अपि अधुना स्वपुत्रम् आङ्ग्लविद्यालयतः अपसार्य संस्कृतविद्यालये एव प्रवेशयिष्यामि"
en_dmt: "He said, \"I too, now, having removed my son from the English school, will enroll him in the Sanskrit school itself.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: मां द्रष्टुं गृहे कः उपस्थितः?
en_dmt: "Who has come to the house to see me?  "

text: मम पुत्रः किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did my son do?  "

text: पुत्रस्य विषये आगन्तुकः किं पृष्टवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the visitor ask regarding the son?  "

text: अहं तं किम् उदतरम्?
en_dmt: "What did I say to him?  "

text: संस्कृतज्ञे असंस्कृतज्ञे च कीदृशः भेदः?
en_dmt: "What is the difference between the knowledge of the conditioned (saṃskṛtajñe) and the knowledge of the unconditioned (asaṃskṛtajñe)?  "

text: विलम्बः हानिकरः
en_dmt: "Delay is harmful.  "

text: विलम्बो नैव कर्तव्यः, कार्यं सद्यो विधीयताम्। विलम्बाज्जायते हानिस्तस्याः पूर्तिरसम्भवा॥
en_dmt: "Delay should not be done; the task should be performed immediately. From delay, loss arises, and its fulfillment is impossible.  "

text: तीर्थयात्रार्थं प्रस्थितः एकः सिद्धपुरुषः मार्गे समायातस्य एकस्य सद्‌गृहस्थस्य अतिथिः अभवत्।
en_dmt: "A perfected man, setting out for a pilgrimage, became the guest of a virtuous householder who met him on the road.  "

text: पतिः पत्नी मिलित्वा तस्य सर्वात्मना सेवाम् अकुरुताम्।
en_dmt: "The husband and wife together served him with all their being.  "

text: तत्सेवया सन्तुष्टः सः स्वजटारक्षितं स्पर्शमणिं निःसार्य सद्‌गृहस्थं कथितवान् - "अस्य स्पर्शेन लोहः सुवर्णे परिवर्तितः भवति। तद् आनीयतां कश्चित् लोहः।"
en_dmt: "Being pleased by that service, he took out the *sparśa-maṇi*, the touchstone, protected in his matted hair and said to the good householder: \"By the touch of this, iron is transformed into gold. Therefore, let some iron be brought.\"  "

text: पत्नी लोहछुरिकाम् आनीतवती।
en_dmt: "The wife brought an iron knife.  "

text: सिद्धपुरुषः तां स्पर्शमणिना स्पर्शयित्वा सुवर्णमयीं कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "The accomplished man, having touched it with a philosopher's stone, made it golden.  "

text: साश्चर्यं विलोकयद्भ्यां ताभ्यां दम्पतिभ्यां स्पर्शमणिं दत्त्वा सः अकथयत् - "इमं स्वोपयोगार्थं स्वसमीपे रक्षतम्। यात्रातः त्रिमासानन्तरं निवृत्तः अहम् इमं ग्रहीष्यामि।"
en_dmt: "Having given the *sparśa-maṇi* (touchstone) to that couple, who were looking on with astonishment, he said: \"Keep this near you for your own use. After three months from my journey, I, having returned, will take this.\"  "

text: एवम् उक्त्वा तस्मिन् गते सद्‌गृहस्थः गृहस्य सर्वाणि लोहवस्तूनि मणिना सुवर्णस्य कृतवान्, आपणतः अपि लोहं क्रीत्वा सुवर्णं निर्मातुं व्यचारयत्, परन्तु महार्घताकारणात् 'अधुना नैव, पश्चात् क्रेष्यामि यदा अस्य मूल्यं निपतिष्यति'
en_dmt: "Having spoken thus, after he had gone, the virtuous householder, with the jewel, turned all the iron objects in his house into gold. He even considered buying iron from the market to make gold, but because of the high price, he thought, \"Not now, I will buy it later when its price falls.\"  "

text: एवं वारं वारं चिन्तयतः एव तस्य त्रयः मासाः व्यतीताः।
en_dmt: "Thus, as he reflected again and again, three months passed.  "

text: निर्धारिते समये सिद्धपुरुषः प्रतिनिवृत्तः।
en_dmt: "At the appointed time, the accomplished person returned.  "

text: स्वमूर्खतायां पश्चात्तपता सद्‌गृहस्थेन स्पर्शमणिः सिद्धपुरुषाय देयः एव अभूत् इति।
en_dmt: "Thus, regretting his own foolishness, the good householder had to give the philosopher's stone to the accomplished man.  "

text: सिद्धपुरुषः सद्‌गृहस्थाय किं दत्तवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the accomplished man give to the virtuous householder?  "

text: दत्तवस्तूनि का विशेषता आसीत्?
en_dmt: "What was the specialty of the things given (dattavastu)?  "

text: सद्‌गृहस्थात् स्ववस्तु सिद्धपुरुषः कदा गृहीतवान्?
en_dmt: "When did the accomplished man take his own property from the good householder?  "

text: किं दत्तवस्तुनः उपयोगं सद्‌गृहस्थः अकरोत्? यदि नहि तर्हि किं न ?
en_dmt: "Did the virtuous householder make use of the thing that was given (dattavastu)? If not, then why not?  "

text: इयं कथा किं शिक्षयति?
en_dmt: "What does this story teach?  "

text: गृहध्वंसः न शोभनः
en_dmt: "The destruction of a house is not auspicious.  "

text: गृहं न कस्यचिज्जन्तोः, ध्वंसनीयं कदाचन। दुःखिनस्तस्य शापेन, ससुखं जीव्यते नहि॥
en_dmt: "The house of no living being should ever be destroyed. By the curse of that suffering person, one cannot live happily.  "

text: पत्न्याः आग्रहेण एकः सामान्यः वेतनभोगी कर्मचारी सन् अपि मम मित्रं स्वस्य खाद्यपेयपरिधेयादिसामग्रीषु व्यये न्यूनतां कृत्वा तथा इतस्ततः ऋणं गृहीत्वा च स्वस्मै एकं गृहं क्रीतवान्।
en_dmt: "Due to his wife's insistence, a common salaried employee, even though he was my friend, reduced expenses on his food, drink, clothing, and other materials, and also took loans from here and there, and bought a house for himself.  "

text: भाटकगृहं परित्यज्य तत्र निवसितुम् अपि प्रारब्धवान्।
en_dmt: "He even started to abandon his rented house and live there.  "

text: यथासमयं गृहीतम् ऋणराशिं परावृत्तवान् अपि।
en_dmt: "Even though he returned the entire sum of the debt at the proper time.  "

text: जीवनयात्रा ससुखं प्रचलति स्म।
en_dmt: "The journey of life proceeded happily.  "

text: एकस्मिन् दिने शयनकक्षे दृष्टं यत् चटकदम्पतिभ्याम् इतस्ततः तृणादिकम् आनीय उपरि एकस्मिन् आलये निजावासयोग्यम् एकं सुन्दरं नीडं निर्मितम्।
en_dmt: "One day, it was seen in the bedroom that a pair of sparrows, bringing grass and other [materials] from here and there, had built a beautiful nest, a dwelling suitable for themselves, on top of a certain abode.  "

text: तस्मिन् चटका द्वौ अण्डौ अपि दत्तवती।
en_dmt: "In that [nest], the female sparrow also laid two eggs.  "

text: यथासमयं ततः द्वौ शावकौ विनिःसृतौ।
en_dmt: "Then, at the proper time, two young ones emerged.  "

text: चटकदम्पती तत्कृते इतस्ततः भ्रामं भ्रामम् आहारव्यवस्थां कुरुतः स्म।
en_dmt: "The pair of sparrows, for that reason, wandered here and there, again and again, providing food.  "

text: यद्यपि शावकौ एवं तु निरन्तरम् एव कूजतः स्म, किन्तु मातापित्रोः उपस्थितौ तु तयोः कूजनम् इयत् अधिकं भवति स्म यत् तत् मम मित्रपत्न्यै न अभिरोचते स्म।
en_dmt: "Although the chicks were constantly chirping in this way, their chirping became so much louder in the presence of their parents (mātāpitroḥ) that it was not pleasing to my friend's wife.  "

text: एकदिने क्रोधस्य सीमानम् अतिक्रान्ता सा मम मित्रस्य अनुपस्थितौ तन्नीडं सन्त्रोट्य प्रक्षिप्तवती।
en_dmt: "One day, having exceeded the limit of anger, she, in the absence of my friend, broke and threw away that nest.  "

text: वराकौ शावकौ अपि तेन एव दुर्गतिं प्राप्तवन्तौ।
en_dmt: "The poor cubs also met with misfortune because of him.  "

text: असहायौ चटकदम्पती तु किं कर्तुं शक्नुतः स्म ? सायं गृहं प्रत्यावृत्तः पत्नीमुखात् एव इदं वृत्तं ज्ञातवान् मम सुहृत्।
en_dmt: "What could the helpless pair of sparrows do? In the evening, my friend, returning home, learned of this event from his wife's mouth.  "

text: विषण्णहृदयः सः पत्नीं केवलम् इदम् एव अकथयत् यत् यदि कश्चित् अस्मद्‌गृहेण अपि एवं व्यवाहरिष्यत् तर्हि कीदृशी अस्मदीया दुर्गतिः अभविष्यत्? तदा तु सा न किञ्चित् उक्तवती।
en_dmt: "With a despondent heart, he only said this to his wife: \"If someone had behaved thus even with our house, then what would our misfortune have been?\" Then, she said nothing.  "

text: परन्तु पञ्चमे एव दिने गृहस्य एका प्रस्तरपट्टिका सहसा त्रुटिता यस्याः अधस्तात् क्रीडन् तयोः एकमात्रं कुलदीपकः सदासदार्थं भगवत्प्रणयी सञ्जातः।
en_dmt: "But on the fifth day, a stone slab of the house suddenly broke, and beneath it, their only scion, a devotee of the Blessed One, became forever subject to existence and non-existence while playing.  "

text: तस्मात् एव दिनात् मम मित्रपत्नी आत्मकृत्ये पश्चात्तपन्ती इव विक्षिप्तावस्थां प्राप्ता अस्ति इति।
en_dmt: "Therefore, from that day, my friend's wife, as if regretting her own actions, has been in a distraught state.  "

text: वेतनभोगी कर्मचारी किं कृतवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did the salaried employee do?  "

text: तस्य पत्नी किं कृतवती ?
en_dmt: "What did his wife do?  "

text: पतिः तां किं अकथयत् ?
en_dmt: "What did her husband say to her?  "

text: पत्नी विक्षिप्तावस्थां कथं प्राप्ता ?
en_dmt: "How did the wife reach a state of distraction?  "

text: कस्यचित् गृहध्वंसनेन किं भवति ?
en_dmt: "What happens by the destruction of someone's house?  "

text: ईश्वरशरणागतः सदा निर्भयः
en_dmt: "One who has surrendered to Īśvara is always fearless.  "

text: ईश्वरं शरणं यातः, सर्वत्र निर्भयः सदा। अवस्थितस्ततो दूरे, विपद्ग्रस्तः पदे पदे॥
en_dmt: "Having gone to Īśvara for refuge, [he is] always fearless everywhere. Having remained far from Him, [he is] afflicted by calamity at every step.  "

text: एकः महात्मा स्वशिष्येण सह वनमार्गेण तीर्थस्नानार्थं गच्छन् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "A certain great soul (mahātmā) was going along a forest path with his disciple to bathe in a sacred bathing place (tīrtha).  "

text: मध्ये मध्ये वन्यजीवानां कर्कशः ध्वनिः तत्रत्यः तीव्रः वायुवेगः च शिष्यं प्रकम्पयति स्म।
en_dmt: "From time to time, the harsh sounds of wild animals and the intense speed of the wind there caused the student to tremble.  "

text: चलतोः चलतोः तयोः द्वयोः सन्ध्यासमयः सञ्जातः।
en_dmt: "As they were moving, as they were moving, twilight occurred for the two of them.  "

text: महात्मा शिष्यं सावधानं कृत्वा स्वयं सन्ध्योपासनार्थम् उपविष्टः।
en_dmt: "Having made the great-souled disciple attentive, he himself sat down for the evening twilight worship (sandhyopāsanā).  "

text: शिष्यः अकस्मात् तत्र आयान्तम् एकं भयानकसिंहं दृष्ट्वा भयातुरः समीपस्थम् एव एकं वृक्षं सत्वरम् आरूढवान् आत्मानं च सिंहात् सुरक्षितवान्।
en_dmt: "The student, suddenly seeing a terrifying lion coming there, became fearful and quickly climbed a nearby tree and protected himself from the lion.  "

text: सिंहः महात्मानम्  अजिघ्रत् निर्गतः च तूष्णीम्।
en_dmt: "The lion smelled the great-souled one, went out, and [remained] silent.  "

text: ध्यानमग्नः महात्मा इदं सर्वं न अजानात्।
en_dmt: "The great soul, absorbed in meditation, did not know all this.  "

text: सिंहे निर्गते शिष्यः वृक्षात् अवतीर्य तथा स्थितः यथा किञ्चित् अभवत् एव न।
en_dmt: "When the lion had gone out, the student descended from the tree and stood as if nothing had happened.  "

text: सन्ध्योपासनातः निवृत्तः महात्मा पुनः अग्रे शिष्येण सह प्रस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Having finished his twilight devotions, the great-souled one again set forth ahead with his disciple.  "

text: सः किञ्चित् एव दूरे गतः आसीत् यत् एका वनमक्षिका महात्मनः नासिकाम् अदंशत्।
en_dmt: "He had gone only a little distance when a forest fly bit the great being's nose.  "

text: तेन महात्मा अत्यन्तं व्याकुलः अभवत्।
en_dmt: "Then the great-souled one became extremely agitated.  "

text: इदं दृष्ट्वा शिष्यः महात्मानां पृष्टवान्-" गुरुदेव! सिंहे समीपे आगते तु भवान् नैव भीतः परम् अधुना एकया सामान्यमक्षिकया अिपि दष्टः इयान् व्याकुलः अभवत्। इदं किम् ?"
en_dmt: "Having seen this, the student asked the great-souled one: \"Gurudeva! When the lion came near, you were not afraid, but now you have become so agitated by the bite of a common fly. What is this ( *idam kim*)?\"  "

text: महात्मा उत्तरं दत्तवान्- "पुत्र! तदा अहं मात्रा गायत्र्या सह आसम्, अधुना च मनुष्येण त्वया सह अस्मि"
en_dmt: "The great being gave [this] reply: \"Son, at that time I was with [my] mother Gāyatrī, and now I am with you, a human.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: सन्ध्योपासनार्थं महात्मनि उपविष्टे शिष्यः किं कृतवान् ?
en_dmt: "When the great soul sat down for the evening twilight worship, what did the student do?  "

text: महात्मानं व्याकुलं दृष्ट्वा शिष्यः किं पृष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "Having seen the great-souled one agitated, what did the student ask?  "

text: महात्मा तदा किम् उत्तरं दत्तवान् ?
en_dmt: "What reply did the great being (mahātmā) give then?  "

text: सर्वत्र सदा निर्भयः कः भवति ?
en_dmt: "Who is always fearless everywhere?  "

text: पदे पदे विपद्ग्रस्तः कः तिष्ठति ?
en_dmt: "Who remains afflicted by misfortune at every step ( *pade pade*)?  "

text: श्वश्रूवध्वोः कलहः
en_dmt: "The quarrel of the mother-in-law and daughter-in-law.  "

text: श्वश्रूर्भूत्वा वधूः स्वीयां, वधूं सन्तापयेन्न चेत्। तां वधूस्तर्हि शत्रुं स्वं, न विद्यान्न च पीडयेत्॥
en_dmt: "If, having become a mother-in-law, she does not torment her own daughter-in-law, then that daughter-in-law should not regard her as an enemy, nor should she cause her pain.  "

text: बहुसमयानन्तरं द्वे सख्यौ मिलिते।
en_dmt: "After a long time, two female friends met.  "

text: कुशलक्षेमादिविषये प्रश्नान् कृत्वा एका सखी स्वविषये सदुःखं कथितवती "किं कथयानि? सखि! मम भाग्ये न सुखम् अस्ति, न शान्तिः। पूर्वं यदा अहं वधूः आसम्, तदा श्वश्र्वा सह नित्यं कलहः भवति स्म, यदा च अधुना अहं श्वश्रूः अस्मि, तदा अपि वध्वा सह कलहः भवति। त्वम् एव अस्य कलहस्य शान्तेः उपायं दर्शय"
en_dmt: "Having asked questions regarding well-being and such, one female friend sadly spoke about her situation, \"What can I say? Friend! There is no happiness or peace in my destiny. Formerly, when I was a bride, there was a constant quarrel with the mother-in-law, and now when I am a mother-in-law, even then there is a quarrel with the daughter-in-law. You alone show me a way to pacify this quarrel.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: एका सखी अन्यां सखीं किं कथितवती?
en_dmt: "What did one female friend say to another female friend?  "

text: ते द्वे सख्यौ कदा मिलिते आस्ताम्?
en_dmt: "When did those two female friends meet?  "

text: द्वितीया सखी प्रथमसख्याः कथनं श्रुत्वा किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "Having heard the statement of the first friend, what did the second friend say?  "

text: वधूः श्वश्रूं कदा न पीडयति?
en_dmt: "When does a bride not torment her mother-in-law?  "

text: श्वश्रूः यदा वधूं सन्तापयति तदा वधूः श्वश्रूं किं जानाति?
en_dmt: "When the mother-in-law torments the daughter-in-law, what does the daughter-in-law know about the mother-in-law?  "

text: प्रशंसां श्रोतुं लालसा
en_dmt: "Desiring to hear praise.  "

text: प्रशंसामन्यतः श्रोतुं, जनः सर्वत्र यत्नवान्। वृद्धावत् स स्वहस्तेन, करोति स्वां क्षतिं न किम् ?॥
en_dmt: "A person is always eager to hear praise from others. Like an old man, doesn't he inflict harm on himself with his own hand?  "

text: एकस्याः वृद्धायाः पुत्रस्य विवाहः सम्पन्ने गृहे सञ्जातः।
en_dmt: "In the house of an old woman, the wedding of her son took place.  "

text: विवाहे बहु यौतुकं मिलितम्।
en_dmt: "At the wedding, a large dowry was assembled.  "

text: मातापितरौ पुत्र्यै विविधानि बहुमूल्यानि स्वर्णभूषणानि अपि दत्तवन्तः।
en_dmt: "The parents gave various precious gold ornaments to their daughter.  "

text: यदा एभिः आभूषणैः अलङ्‌कृता सा पतिगृहम् आयाता, तदा तां द्रष्टुम् आयाताः प्रतिवेशिन्यः सम्बन्धिन्यः च महिलाः आभूषणानां तस्याः मातापित्रोः च बहुबहुप्रशंसां कृतवत्यः।
en_dmt: "When, adorned with these ornaments, she arrived at her husband's house ( *pati-gṛham* ), then the neighboring and related women who came to see her greatly praised the ornaments and her parents ( *mātā-pitroḥ* ).  "

text: वृद्धायै एतद् न अरोचत।
en_dmt: "This did not please the old woman.  "

text: सा अपि आत्मानं प्रशंसयितुम् एकं हीरकजटितं सुवर्णाङ्गुलीयकं निर्मापितवती।
en_dmt: "She also had a diamond-studded golden ring made to praise herself.  "

text: समये समये येन केनापि मिषेण अङ्गुलीयकं दर्शयित्वा तत्सम्बन्धे प्रशंसावचनानि श्रोतुं प्रयतितवती।
en_dmt: "From time to time, by whatever pretext, she would try to show her ring and hear words of praise related to it.  "

text: किन्तु अत्र न केनापि ध्यानं दत्तम्।
en_dmt: "But here, meditation was not given by anyone.  "

text: अन्ते जनानां तत्र ध्यानम् आकृष्टं कर्तुं स्वहस्तेन एव सा स्वकीये आवासे अग्निं योजितवती।
en_dmt: "Finally, in order to draw the attention of the people there, she herself ignited the fire in her own dwelling with her own hand.  "

text: 'अस्माकम् अपि अग्निः न लगेत्'
en_dmt: "Fire would not touch us either.  "

text: - इदं विचार्य प्रतिवेशिनः अग्निं प्रशमयितुम् उपस्थिताः।
en_dmt: "Having considered this, the neighbors arrived to extinguish the fire.  "

text: वृद्धा धृताङ्गुलीयकहस्तेन वारं वारं दर्शयति स्म -"अत्र अग्निशमनं करोतु, अत्र अग्निशमनं करोतु।"
en_dmt: "The old woman, with the ring held in her hand, repeatedly showed it, saying, \"Extinguish the fire here, extinguish the fire here.\"  "

text: तदा कश्चित् युवकः वृद्धाम् अङ्गुलीयकविषये पृष्टवान्, तत्सम्बन्धे च कांश्चित्‌ प्रशंसाशब्दान् अपि कथितवान्।
en_dmt: "Then a certain youth asked an old woman about a finger ring, and also spoke some words of praise in connection with it.  "

text: वृद्धा स्वं शिरः स्फोटयन्ती अवोचत् - "अरे मूर्ख! पूर्वम् एव किं न अङ्गुलीयकं प्रशंसितवान्? अहं स्वहस्तेन किं स्वं गृहम् अग्निना अयोजयिष्यम् ?"
en_dmt: "The old woman, striking her own head, said: \"Hey fool! Why did you not praise the ring earlier? Would I have set my own house on fire with my own hand?\"  "

text: इति कथयित्वा उच्चैः उच्चैः रोदितुं प्रवृत्ता इति।
en_dmt: "Having said this, she began to weep loudly, loudly.  "

text: प्रतिवेशिन्यः सम्बन्धिन्यः महिलाः च कस्य कस्य प्रशंसां कृतवत्यः?
en_dmt: "Whom all did the female neighbors, relatives, and women praise?  "

text: वृद्धा प्रशंसां प्राप्तुं किं कृतवती ?
en_dmt: "What did the old woman do to receive praise?  "

text: प्रतिवेशिनः किं विचार्य वृद्धायाः गृहे उपस्थिताः?
en_dmt: "Why have the neighbors come to the old woman's house to discuss?  "

text: वृद्धा तान् किं कुर्वती किं कर्तुं कथयति स्म ?
en_dmt: "What was the old woman doing to them, and what was she telling them to do?  "

text: युवकः वृद्धां किं पृष्टवान्, वृद्धा च तं किम् अवोचत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the young man ask the old woman, and what did the old woman say to him?  "

text: भिक्षुः भिक्षुं न भिक्षते
en_dmt: "A monk does not beg from a monk.  "

text: यः स्वयं भिक्षतेऽन्यस्माद्, भिक्षवे दास्यते स किम् ?। ज्ञात्वैतद् भिक्षुरेकोऽन्यं, भिक्षुं नैव हि भिक्षते॥
en_dmt: "He who himself begs from another, what will he give to a *bhikṣu* (monk)? Having known this, one *bhikṣu* (monk) never begs from another *bhikṣu* (monk).  "

text: एकः राजा देवदर्शनार्थं निःसृतः।
en_dmt: "A certain king set out to see the god.  "

text: मार्गे एकः भिक्षुकः चलन् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "On the path, a *bhikṣu* was walking.  "

text: राजपुरुषाः तं ततः अपसर्तुम् आदिशन्।
en_dmt: "The king's men ordered him to leave that place.  "

text: भिक्षुकः कथितवान्- "अहं किम् अपसरेयम्? अयं तु सार्वजनिकः मार्गः। युष्माकं राजा अपि आगच्छतु गच्छतु च"
en_dmt: "The mendicant said: \"Why should I move? This is a public road. Let your king also come and go.\"  "
"[Tibetan missing. See note below.]  "

text: राजपुरुषाः अवदन्- "अस्माकं राजा महान् शक्तिशाली अस्ति। अप्रसन्नः सः त्वां देशात् निर्वासयिष्यति।"
en_dmt: "The king's men said: \"Our king is great and powerful. Displeased, he will banish you from the country.\"  "

text: भिक्षुकः कथितवान्- "पूर्वं सः अत्रत्यान् मक्षिकादंशकादीन् तु निःसारयतु। पश्चात् मां निर्वासयितुं विचारयतु।"
en_dmt: "The monk said: \"First let him drive away the flies, gnats, and other biting insects here. Afterwards, let him consider expelling me.\"  "

text: राजपुरुषाः अवोचन्- "इदं तु असम्भवम्।"
en_dmt: "The king’s men said: “But this is impossible!”  "

text: भिक्षुकः उक्तवान्- "तर्हि कीदृशः सः महाशक्तिशाली राजा?"
en_dmt: "The mendicant said: \"Then, what sort of greatly powerful king is he?\"  "

text: एवं कथयति एव तस्मिन् राजा अपि तत्र आगतः।
en_dmt: "Just as he was saying this, the king also arrived there.  "

text: भिक्षुकः स्वेच्छया अपसृत्य राज्ञे मार्गं दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "The monk voluntarily stepped aside and gave way to the king.  "

text: राजा तं दृष्टवान्, देवालयं च प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "The king saw him and reached the temple.  "

text: तत्र देवमूर्तिं प्रणम्य सः उच्चैः उच्चैः स्तुतवान्, ततः अतुलितां सम्पत्तिं सुखसमृद्धिं च अयाचत।
en_dmt: "There, bowing to the image of the deity, he praised [it] loudly and repeatedly, then requested incomparable wealth, happiness, and prosperity.  "

text: ततः देवालयात् बहिर् आगच्छन् राजा तम् एव भिक्षुकं दृष्टवान् पृष्टवान् च- "अरे! त्वम् अत्र अपि आयातः? ब्रूहि किम् इच्छसि?"
en_dmt: "Then, as the king was coming out of the temple, he saw that very beggar and asked him: \"Hey! Have you come here too? Tell me, what do you want?\"  "

text: राजपुरुषाः भिक्षुकं किं कर्तुम् आदिशन् ?
en_dmt: "What did the king’s men order the beggar to do?  "

text: भिक्षुकस्य तदा किम् उत्तरम् आसीत् ?
en_dmt: "What answer did the *bhikṣu* have then?  "

text: राजा भिक्षुकं किं कर्तुं पृष्टवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did the king ask the beggar to do?  "

text: भिक्षुकः राजानं किम् उदतरत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the mendicant say to the king?  "

text: एकः भिक्षुकः अन्यं भिक्षुकं किं मत्वा न याचते ?
en_dmt: "Thinking what, does one *bhikṣu* not ask another *bhikṣu*?  "

text: कृपणस्य अग्रे भगवान् अपि पराजितः
en_dmt: "Even the Lord is defeated before a miser.  "

text: कृपणो म्रियतां नाम, दानं किञ्चित् करोति न । सर्वेश्वरोऽपि तस्याग्रे, मन्यते स्वं पराजितम् ॥
en_dmt: "Let the miser die, but he gives nothing in charity. Even the lord of all feels defeated before him.  "

text: एकः महान् कृपणः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "There was one great miser.  "

text: पत्न्याः आग्रहेण सः गङ्गास्नानार्थं गतः।
en_dmt: "Due to his wife's insistence, he went to bathe in the Gaṅgā.  "

text: स्नानं कृत्वा गङ्गातः सः बहिरागतः एव यत् भगवान् गङ्गागुरुः भूत्वा तस्य सम्मुखे उपस्थितः कथितवान् च- "भाग्यवान्! दानपुण्यं कुरु।"
en_dmt: "Having bathed in the Gaṅgā, as soon as he came out, the Blessed One, having become the teacher of the Gaṅgā, stood before him and said: \"Fortunate one! Perform giving and merit.\"  "

text: कृपणः तं भर्त्सयन् इव ततः अपसर्तुम् अब्रवीत्।
en_dmt: "\"'Miserly, as if scolding him, then told him to go away.'\"  "

text: परन्तु गङ्गागुरुः नैव अपसृतः।
en_dmt: "But Gaṅgāguru did not retreat.  "

text: पञ्चपणानाम्‌ एव दानं कर्तुं तं बाध्यम् अकुरुत।
en_dmt: "He compelled him to give a gift of even five *paṇas*.  "

text: तदा कृपणः स्वगृहस्य सङ्‌केतं दत्त्वा तत्र निश्चितदिवसे तम् उपस्थातुम् अकथयत्।
en_dmt: "Then the miser, having given the signal of his own house, told him to come there on a certain day.  "

text: गङ्गागुरुः तथा एव कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Gaṅgāguru did just that.  "

text: कृपणः पुत्रमुखेन तं पश्चात् आगन्तुम् आदिशत्।
en_dmt: "The miser ordered him to come later, by means of [his] son's face.  "

text: गङ्गागुरुः आगमनं नैव त्यक्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Gaṅgāguru did not give up coming.  "

text: कृपणः पुनः पुत्रमुखेन एव तं सन्दिष्टवान्- "अधुना पितुः स्वास्थ्यम् समीचीनं नास्ति, न जाने अग्रिमे दिने सः सूर्योदयं द्रक्ष्यति अपि न वा।"
en_dmt: "The miser, however, sent him a message through his son: \"Now, father's health is not good; I do not know whether he will see the sunrise tomorrow or not.\"  "

text: गङ्गागुरुः "तर्हि अहम् अत्र एव तिष्ठामि, तस्मै स्वस्कन्धं दत्त्वा एव गमिष्यामि"
en_dmt: "Gaṅgāguru said, \"Then I will stay here. I will only leave after giving him my shoulder.\"  "

text: इति उक्त्वा तत्र एव संस्थितः।
en_dmt: "Having spoken thus, he remained right there.  "

text: कृपणस्य सङ्‌केतेन गृहे रोदनं विलपनं प्रारब्धम्।
en_dmt: "At the miser's indication, weeping and lamenting began in the house.  "

text: बाह्याः सम्बन्धिनः च शवयात्रायां सम्मेलितुम् आगच्छन्।
en_dmt: "And external relatives came to gather at the funeral procession.  "

text: कृपणस्य शवम् आदाय सर्वे श्मशानं प्राप्ताः।
en_dmt: "Taking the corpse of the miser, all reached the cremation ground.  "

text: शवः चितायाम् उपस्थापितः।
en_dmt: "The corpse was placed on the pyre.  "

text: कृपणः पुत्रं सङ्‌केतेन आहूतवान् पृष्टवान् च- "सः गङ्गागुरुः गतः न वा ?"
en_dmt: "The miser, having called his son with a gesture, asked: \"Has that Gaṅgāguru gone or not?\"  "

text: "नहि स तु अत्र एव तिष्ठति, भवते सः स्वीयं स्कन्धम् अपि दत्तवान्"
en_dmt: "Indeed, he does not stay here; he even gave you his own shoulder.  "

text: पुत्रः उत्तरम् अददात्।
en_dmt: "The son gave an answer.  "

text: "तर्हि विलम्बसे किम् ? अग्निं देहि"
en_dmt: "Then why do you delay? Give the fire.  "

text: पितुः अनेन आदेशेन यथा पुत्रः अग्निं दातुम् उद्यतः एव आसीत् तथा गङ्गागुरुः स्वकीयं रूपं धृत्वा भगवान् तं कृपणं कथितवान्- "अरे! पञ्चपणानां कृते किं म्रियसे ? त्वं विजितवान्। अहं पराजितः अस्मि"
en_dmt: "Just as a son, by the order of his father, was about to offer fire, so Gaṅgāguru, assuming his own form, said to that miserable one: \"Hey! Why are you dying for five *paṇas*? You have won. I am defeated.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: गङ्गागुरुः कृपणं किं कर्तुं कथितवान् ?
en_dmt: "What did Gaṅgāguru tell the miser to do?  "

text: कृपणः गङ्गागुरुं किम् अकथयत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the miser say to Gaṅgāguru?  "

text: गङ्गागुरुतः आत्मानं मोचयितुं कृपणः किं किं कृतवान् ?
en_dmt: "What all did the miser do to free himself from the heavy burden of the Ganges?  "

text: अन्ते विजयः कस्य अभवत् गङ्गागुरोः कृपणस्य वा ?
en_dmt: "In the end, who was victorious, Gaṅgāguru or Kṛpaṇa?  "

text: कृपणः कीदृशः भवति ?
en_dmt: "What kind of stingy person is there?  "

text: विभीषणतः हानिः
en_dmt: "Loss from Vibhīṣaṇa.  "

text: स्वीय एव यदा लोभी, भूत्वा मिलति शत्रुभिः। जायमानात् तदा नाशात्, त्रातुं शक्तो न कश्चन॥
en_dmt: "When someone is greedy for his own [things/interests] and joins with enemies, then no one is able to protect him from the destruction that arises.  "

text: कुठारम् आविष्कृत्य मनुष्यः आत्मानं बहु बहु अमन्यत।
en_dmt: "Having invented the axe, the human thought of himself as very, very important.  "

text: कुठारे काष्ठदण्डम् आयोज्य सः वनं गतः।
en_dmt: "Having fitted an axe with a wooden handle, he went to the forest.  "

text: तत्र यावत् सः वृक्षम् एकं कर्तयितुं प्रवृत्तः, तावत् वृक्षः तं निवारयन् अकथयत्-  "अरे! स्वीये आविष्कारे किं गर्वसे? यदि मम सजातीयः अयं दण्डः विभीषणः न अभविष्यत्, तर्हि किं ते कुठारः पूर्णः अभविष्यत्? त्वं वा एवं मां मम परिवारं च छेत्तुम् अत्र आगमिष्यः?"
en_dmt: "There, as soon as he began to cut down a tree, the tree, preventing him, said: \"Hey! Why are you proud of your invention? If this club, a member of my own species, had not been a traitor ( *vibhīṣaṇa*), would your axe have been effective? Or would you have come here to cut me and my family?\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: मनुष्यः किं कृत्वा कुत्र गतः?
en_dmt: "What did the man do, and where did he go?  "

text: वृक्षः मनुष्यं किं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the tree say to the man?  "

text: किं वृक्षस्य कथनं सत्यम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "Was the statement of the tree true?  "

text: आत्मीयः एव यदा शत्रुणा मिलति, तदा तस्य परिणामः कः भवति?
en_dmt: "What is the result when one's own person unites with the enemy?  "

text: अनया कथया कीदृशः सन्देशः दीयते?
en_dmt: "What kind of message is given by this story?  "

text: कृपणस्वभावः
en_dmt: "[One who is] miserly by nature.  "

text: लोकापवादतो भीतः, कृपणो जायते नहि। म्रियतां कष्टमाविन्दन्, कार्पण्यं स्वं न मुञ्चते॥
en_dmt: "Fearing the censure of the world, he does not become miserly. Though dying and experiencing suffering, he does not relinquish his own miserliness.  "

text: एकः कृपणः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "There was a miser.  "

text: सः आत्मानं बहुबुद्धिमन्तं मन्यते स्म।
en_dmt: "He considered himself very intelligent.  "

text: एकदा कार्यवशात् सः ग्रामान्तरं गतः।
en_dmt: "Once, due to some business, he went to another village. (ekadā kāryavaśāt saḥ grāmāntaraṃ gataḥ)  "

text: तत्र सः स्मृतवान् यत् तस्य बहुव्ययकारिणी पत्नी निरर्थकं व्ययं न कुर्यात् इति विचार्य शीघ्रं शीघ्रं पदातिः एव पलायमानः गृहं प्रत्यावृत्तः।
en_dmt: "There, he remembered that his wife, who caused much expense, would not waste things uselessly; thinking thus, he quickly, quickly, as a foot-soldier, ran away and returned home.  "

text: तत्र दीपं प्रज्वलन्तं दृष्ट्वा पत्नीं भर्त्सयन् आक्षिपन् च अकथयत् - "महाभागे! दीपं ज्वालयित्वा तैलं किं वृथा अपव्ययसे? चन्द्रस्य सर्वत्र विद्यमाने प्रकाशे स्वीयं सर्वं कार्यं साधयितुं शक्यते। अहं तु तव अनेन स्वभावेन लुण्ठितः अस्मि।"
en_dmt: "There, having seen the lamp burning, scolding and reproaching his wife, he said: \"O noble lady! Why do you light the lamp and waste oil in vain? In the light of the moon, which is present everywhere, all your work can be accomplished. I am indeed plundered by this nature of yours.\"  "

text: पत्नी उत्तरं दत्तवती - "प्राणनाथ! इयती अपि कृपणता किं प्रयोजनवती? '
en_dmt: "The wife gave the answer: \"Lord of my life! What is the use of even such miserliness as this?\"  "

text: भवान् तु उपानहौ कदाचित् न विदीर्णे भवेताम्' इति विचार्य ते स्वकीयपोट्टलिकायाम् एव निधाय नग्नपादः एव इतः गतः, ततः अपि च स्वकार्यम् अकृत्वा एव तथा एव आगतः, किञ्चित् क्षतविक्षतौ तु स्वपादौ विलोकयतु। का दुर्दशा कृता अनयोः? किम् इदम् अभिनन्दनीयं सुखकरं कार्यम्?"
en_dmt: "\"But you, thinking, 'May my shoes not be torn,' having placed them in your own bundle, went barefoot from here; and then, without accomplishing your task, you returned in the same way. Just look at your feet, somewhat bruised and wounded. What a miserable condition they are in! What is this praiseworthy, pleasant task?\"  "

text: पत्न्याः एतेन सोपालम्भेन उत्तरेण कृपणस्य पत्युः मुखं तदा दर्शनीयम् एव आसीत् इति।
en_dmt: "And then, with this reproachful reply of the wife, the face of the miserly husband was indeed worth seeing!  "

text: ग्रामान्तरं गतः कृपणः प्रत्यागत्य पत्नीं किम् अकथयत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the wretch, having gone to another village and returned, say to his wife?  "

text: ततः पत्नी किम् उत्तरं दत्तवती ?
en_dmt: "Then, what answer did the wife give?  "

text: पत्न्याः उत्तरेण कृपणस्य पत्युः मुखं कीदृशम् आसीत् ?
en_dmt: "What did the face of the miserly husband look like to his wife afterwards?  "

text: कृपणः कस्माद् भीतः न भवति ?
en_dmt: "Why is the miser not afraid?  "

text: कृपणः किं न मुञ्चति ?
en_dmt: "What does a miser not abandon?  "

text: बह्वर्थवेत्ता पण्डितः
en_dmt: "A scholar who knows many meanings.  "

text: सामान्यस्यापि वाक्यस्य, बह्वर्थं वेत्ति पण्डितः । केनापि वञ्च्यते नास्मात्, ससुखं स प्रमोदते ॥
en_dmt: "Even a wise man understands the manifold meanings of a general sentence. He is not deceived by anyone, he rejoices with happiness.  "

text: कश्चित् नटः राजपरिवारसमक्षे स्वनटविद्याकौशलं प्रदर्शयन् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "A certain actor was displaying his skill in the art of acting in the presence of the royal family.  "

text: नट्याः भेरीवादनेन सह रज्जौ नटस्य नर्तनं बहुकालं प्रचलितम्।
en_dmt: "The dancer's dance on the rope, accompanied by the playing of the kettle drum, continued for a long time.  "

text: प्रदर्शनम् इदं रात्रौ चन्द्रप्रकाशे आसीत्।
en_dmt: "This performance took place at night in the moonlight.  "

text: भेरीं वादयन्ती नटी श्रान्ता।
en_dmt: "The actress, tired, is playing the drum.  "

text: राज्ञा साधुवादेन सह अधुना अपि पुरस्काररूपे न किञ्चित् दत्तम्।
en_dmt: "Even now, the king has given nothing in the form of a reward along with kind words.  "

text: तदा नटस्य नटीं प्रति-
en_dmt: "Then, to the dancer regarding the actress.  "

text: "गतं बहु, स्थितं स्वल्पं, स्वल्पेऽप्यर्धं हि संस्थितम् ।अतोऽप्यधीयताम् तूर्णं, ताले भङ्गोऽस्तु माऽधुना ॥"
en_dmt: "Much has passed, little remains, and even of that little, half is gone. Therefore, let it be learned quickly, may there be no interruption in the rhythm now.  "

text: इति वचनं श्रुत्वा राजगुरुः सद्यः एव स्वं शालं नटाय दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Having heard these words, the royal teacher immediately gave his shawl to the actor.  "

text: राजकुमारी अपि स्वहारं नट्यै दत्तवती।
en_dmt: "The princess also gave her necklace to the dancer.  "

text: राजकुमारः अपि स्वं परिधानं नटाय दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "The prince also gave his garment to the actor.  "

text: दत्त्वा ततः गन्तुम् उद्यतान् एतान् राजा अवरोध्य तत्कारणम् अपृच्छत्।
en_dmt: "Having given [something], the king, blocking them as they were about to depart from there, asked the reason.  "

text: पुरोहितः उदतरत्- "राजन्! नटः सावधानं कृतवान् यत् सम्प्राप्तात् आयुषः बहु अपव्ययितं, स्वल्पम् एव अवशिष्यते, ततः अपि पुनः अर्धं गतम्। अवशिष्टं तु आत्मकल्याणे उपयुज्यताम्। तद् अहम् ईश्वराराधनाय गच्छामि।"
en_dmt: "The priest replied: \"O King! The actor has heedlessly wasted much of his allotted lifespan. Only a little remains, and even half of that is gone. Let what remains be used for the welfare of the *ātman* (self). Therefore, I shall go to worship *Īśvara* (the Lord).\"  "

text: राजकुमारी अपि उक्तवती- "अहं कुसङ्गौ पतिता आसम्। अधुना नटेन गुरुवत् मम अपि अक्षिणी उद्घाटिते। तत् प्रायश्चित्ताय तपः तप्तुं गच्छामि।"
en_dmt: "The princess also said: \"I fell into bad company. Now, the actor has opened my eyes like a guru. Therefore, I am going to perform penance for atonement.\"  "

text: राजकुमारः कथितवान्- "तात! अहं तु कैश्चित् दुर्जनैः प्रेरितः समयतः पूर्वम् एव राज्यम् अधिग्रहीतुं भवन्तं हन्तुं विचारं कृतवान् आसम्। किन्तु इदानीं नटः माम् अपि तस्मात् महापापतः सुरक्षितवान्। अतः अहम् अपि ईश्वरम् आराधयितुं गच्छामि।"
en_dmt: "The prince said: \"Father! Incited by some wicked people, I had planned to kill you in order to seize the kingdom prematurely.  But now, the actor has saved me from that great sin as well.  Therefore, I too shall go to worship *īśvara* (the Lord).\"  "

text: राजा स्वयम् अपि तथा एव स्वं जीवनं निरर्थकं मन्वानः राजकुमाराय एव राज्यभारं दत्वा नटं नटीं च बहु बहु पुरस्कृत्य सपत्नीकः राजगुरुणा राजकुमार्या च सह तपः आचरितुं वनं प्रस्थितः इति।
en_dmt: "The king himself, thinking his own life was equally meaningless, and having given the burden of the kingdom to the prince, and greatly rewarded the actor and actress, set out with his wife, the royal preceptor, and the princess to the forest to practice asceticism.  "

text: नटः नटीं प्रति किं वचनं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What words did the actor say to the actress?  "

text: तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा नटनटीभ्यां कः कः किं किं दत्तवान्?
en_dmt: "Having heard those words, what did each of the actors and actresses give?  "

text: नटनटीभ्यां दानस्य कारणं कः कः किं किं राजानं कथितवान्?
en_dmt: "What reasons regarding the gift to the actors did each person tell the king?  "

text: तदा राज किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the king do then?  "

text: पण्डितः किं जानाति? सः ससुखं कथं प्रमोदते?
en_dmt: "What does a wise person know? How does he rejoice with happiness?  "

text: विश्वासघातुकः नरकं याति
en_dmt: "A betrayer goes to hell.  "

text: लवणं भक्षितं यस्य, तद्विश्वासो न हन्यताम्। विश्वासघातकर्ता यो, नरकं सोऽधिगच्छति॥
en_dmt: "He whose salt has been eaten, his trust should not be betrayed. He who is a betrayer of trust, he goes to hell.  "

text: चन्द्रधरः श्रेष्ठिरामदासस्य गृहे कर्मचारी आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Chandradhara was an employee in the house of the merchant Rāmadāsa.  "

text: केनापि कारणेन ततः रुष्टः सः सेवां त्यक्त्वा निर्गतः।
en_dmt: "For some reason, angered, he left his service and departed.  "

text: तत्कालम् अन्याम् आजीविकां न प्राप्य इतस्ततः अटन् असामाजिकतत्त्वानां कुसङ्गतौ सः निपतितः।
en_dmt: "Not obtaining another livelihood at that time, he wandered here and there and fell into the bad company of anti-social elements.  "

text: तस्य साहाय्येन ते श्रेष्ठिरामदासस्य गृहे चौर्यम् अकुर्वन् तं च कथितवन्तः यत् - "त्वया अस्माकं लवणं भक्षितं, यस्य लवणं भक्ष्यते - तं प्रति विश्वासघातः न नैतिकः अस्ति न च धार्मिकः एव। अतः अस्य चौर्यस्य रहस्यं गोपनीयं रक्षणीयम्"
en_dmt: "With his help, they committed a theft in the house of the merchant Rāmadāsa, and they said to him, \"You have eaten our salt. Betrayal of someone whose salt is eaten is neither ethical nor religious. Therefore, the secret of this theft must be kept confidential and protected.\"  "

text: इति उक्त्वा तस्मै अपि चोरितद्रव्यस्य भागं दत्तवन्तः।
en_dmt: "Having said this, they gave him also a share of the stolen goods.  "

text: चन्द्रधरः चौराणां वचने वारं वारं मननं कृतवान्।
en_dmt: "Candra-dhara repeatedly reflected on the words of the thieves.  "

text: सः व्यचिन्तयत्- 'प्रथमं तु मया श्रेष्ठिरामदासस्य एव लवणं भक्षितम्। तद् गृहे चौर्यं कारयित्वा अवश्यं मया तं प्रति विश्वासघातः कृतः। अस्य प्रायश्चित्तं कर्तुं मया त्वरितम् एव तस्मै चौर्यरहस्यम् उद्घाटनीयम्।'
en_dmt: "He thought: \"First, the salt of the merchant Rāmadāsa was eaten by me. Having caused a theft in his house, certainly, I have betrayed him. To atone for this, the secret of the theft must be revealed to him by me quickly.\"  "

text: एवं निश्चित्य सः तथा एव कृतवान् येन चोरितं सर्वम् अपि द्रव्यं श्रेष्ठिने मिलितं, चन्द्रधरः च पुनः तत्र एव सेवां कर्तुं प्रवृत्तः इति।
en_dmt: "Having decided thus, he did just that, whereby the merchant recovered all the stolen goods, and Candradhara again began to serve there.  "

text: रुष्टः कर्मचारी चन्द्रधरः केषां कुसङ्गतौ पतितः?
en_dmt: "In whose bad company has the angry employee Candradhara fallen?  "

text: येषां कुसङ्गतौ सः पतितः ते तं चन्द्रधरं किं कथितवन्तः?
en_dmt: "What did those who he fell in with, in bad company, say about him, the bearer of the moon ( *chandradhara*)?  "

text: चन्द्रधरः तदा किम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did Candradhara do then?  "

text: कस्य विश्वासघातः न करणीयः?
en_dmt: "Whose betrayal should not be done?  "

text: विश्वासघाती कुत्र गच्छति?
en_dmt: "Where does a betrayer go?  "

text: विद्वान् सम्पादकः
en_dmt: "A learned editor.  "

text: विद्वान् सम्पादकः सोऽस्ति, सत्यं यो हि प्रकाशयेत्। पक्षविपक्षतोऽनन्तान्, साधुवादान् स विन्दति॥
en_dmt: "He is a learned editor, for he reveals the truth. From theses and antitheses, he finds endless, excellent arguments.  "

text: विधानसभायाः अधिवेशने तस्मिन् दिने सदस्यानां भाषणे अपेक्षातः अधिका एव उग्रता आसीत्।
en_dmt: "In the session of the legislative assembly, on that day, there was more intensity than expected in the speeches of the members.  "

text: परस्परम् आरोपप्रत्यारोपद्वारा विचारणीयविषयः सुदूरे त्यक्तः अभूत्।
en_dmt: "The topic to be examined through mutual accusation and counter-accusation was abandoned far away.  "

text: उत्तेजिताः सदस्याः अभद्रम् अपि व्यवहारं कृतवन्तः।
en_dmt: "The agitated members behaved improperly as well.  "

text: तेषाम् इदं निन्दनीयम् आचरणं स्वस्य संवाददातुः लेखस्य आधारेण समाचारपत्रस्य सम्पादकेन स्वकीये पत्रे अधिवेशनस्य चर्चां कुर्वता अर्धाः सदस्याः अशिष्टाः प्रकाशिताः।
en_dmt: "The newspaper editor, while discussing the assembly in his paper based on his informant's report, published that half of the members were uncivilized; this behavior of theirs is blameworthy.  "

text: द्वितीयस्मिन् दिने क्रुद्धानां सदस्यानाम् आग्रहेण विधानसभाध्यक्षेण तस्मिन् लेखे क्षमायाचनापूर्वकं खण्डनं प्रकाशयितुं सम्पादकः आदिष्टः।
en_dmt: "On the second day, due to the insistence of the angry members, the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly ordered the editor to publish a retraction of that article with an apology.  "

text: तदनुसारेण सम्पादकः अन्यस्मिन् दिने खण्डनम् एवं प्रकाशितवान् "अर्धाः सदस्याः अशिष्टाः न आसन्"
en_dmt: "Following that, the editor published a refutation on another day, thus: \"Half of the members were not rude.\"  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: विधानसभायाम् उत्तेजिताः सदस्याः कीदृशं व्यवहारं कृतवन्तः?
en_dmt: "How did the agitated members behave in the legislative assembly?  "

text: सम्पादकः स्वसमाचारपत्रे किं प्रकाशितम् अकरोत्?
en_dmt: "What did the editor publish in his newspaper?  "

text: विधानसभाध्यक्षः समाचारपत्रसम्पादकं किं कर्तुम् आदिष्टवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the Speaker of the Assembly order the newspaper editor to do?  "

text: सम्पादकः पुनः किं समाचारपत्रे प्रकाशितवान्?
en_dmt: "What did the editor publish in the newspaper again?  "

text: विद्वान् सम्पादकः कीदृशः भवति?
en_dmt: "What sort of learned (vidvān) editor (sampādakaḥ) is (kīdṛśaḥ bhavati)?  "

text: कुकर्म नहि कर्तव्यम्
en_dmt: "Evil deeds should not be done.  "

text: यत् सन्तानोऽनुकुर्वीत, तत् कुर्वीत कुकर्म न। किं वानरस्वभावा न, सन्ति बालकबालिकाः?॥
en_dmt: "Whatever progeny would imitate, that should not be done, [namely] evil deeds. Are young boys and girls not of a monkey's nature?  "

text: ग्रामाद् बहिः जङ्गलस्य शून्यप्रदेशे खनन्तं पितरं दृष्ट्वा सप्ताष्टवर्षीयः पुत्रः पृष्टवान्-  "तात! इदं किं क्रियते?"
en_dmt: "Having seen his father digging outside the village in a deserted place in the forest, a seven- or eight-year-old son asked, \"Father! What is this being done?\"  "

text: "तव इमं मरणासन्नं रुग्णं पितामहम् इह शाययितुं महागर्तः अयं निर्मीयते। रात्रिन्दिवा अस्य सेवया वयं सर्वे अपि अत्यन्तं सन्तप्ताः स्मः। आर्थिकक्षयः अपि अस्मान् बाधते। तव अपि पालनं पोषणं सम्यक् कर्तुं न शक्यते"
en_dmt: "\"A large pit is being prepared here to lay your grandfather, who is ill and near death. We are all extremely distressed day and night by nursing him. Financial loss also troubles us. Even your care and upbringing cannot be properly done.\"  "

text: ससङ्‌कोचं पिता पुत्रं प्राबोधयत्।
en_dmt: "The father roused his son with hesitation.  "

text: "वरम्, स्वकार्यं कृत्वा खनित्रं मह्यम् अपि ददातु। अहम् अपि अस्य पार्श्वे एकं गर्तं भवत्कृते निर्मास्यामि। भवान् अपि अधुना वृद्धः भवितुं प्रवृत्तः। रुग्णः च तु भवान् सदा तिष्ठति एव"
en_dmt: "\"Rather, having done your work, let him give the spade to me as well. I too will make a hole near him for you. You also are now beginning to become old. And you are always sick.\"  "

text: पुत्रः पितरं कथितवान्।
en_dmt: "The son spoke to his father.  "

text: "न, न पुत्र! त्वया मे चक्षुः उन्मीलितम्। न अहम् अग्रे इदं करिष्यामि। त्वं गुरुः असि। तव पितामहं गृहे एव नयामः, तत्र एनं सेवया नीरोगम् एव कर्तुं पूर्णं प्रयत्नं करिष्यामः"
en_dmt: "No, no, son! You have opened my eyes. I will not do this again. You are the teacher (guru). Let us take your grandfather home; there, we will make every effort to heal him through service.  "

text: इति।
en_dmt: "Thus.  "

text: पुत्रस्य प्रश्नस्य उत्तरं पिता किं दत्तवान्?
en_dmt: "What answer did the father give to the son's question?  "

text: पुत्रः उत्तरं श्रुत्वा पितरं किम् अकथयत्?
en_dmt: "Having heard the son's reply, what did he say to his father?  "

text: पुत्रस्य कथनस्य पितरि का प्रतिक्रिया अभवत्?
en_dmt: "What was the father's reaction to the son's statement?  "

text: कीदृशं कर्म न करणीयम्?
en_dmt: "What kind of action should not be done?  "

text: बालकबालिकाः कीदृक्स्वभावाः भवन्ति?
en_dmt: "What kind of nature do boys and girls have?  "

text: यदा बुद्धिः तदा धनम्
en_dmt: "When there is intellect, then there is wealth.  "

text: चिन्ता धनस्य का कार्या, कस्य पार्श्वेऽस्ति तत् स्थिरम्?। बुद्धिः  कदापि  नश्येन्न,  यदा  बुद्धिस्तदा  धनम्॥
en_dmt: "Why worry about wealth? With whom is it permanent? Intelligence never perishes; when there is intelligence, then there is wealth.  "

text: एकः रत्नव्यवसायी व्यापारार्जितं धनराशिम् आदाय वनमार्गेण गृहं प्रत्यागच्छन् आसीत्।
en_dmt: "A certain jewel merchant, having taken the wealth acquired from trade, was returning home by a forest path.  "

text: आतपतृष्णासन्तप्तः सः पार्श्वस्थां कुटीं प्राप्तः।
en_dmt: "Tormented by the heat and thirst, he reached a nearby hut.  "

text: तत्र कुटीस्वामी तम् आश्वासयत्।
en_dmt: "There, the owner of the hut reassured him.  "

text: सः मेषपालः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "He was a shepherd.  "

text: तस्य पत्नी पुत्री च व्यवसायिनं सम्यक् सत्कृतवत्यौ।
en_dmt: "His wife and daughter properly honored the merchant.  "

text: किञ्चित्समयानन्तरम् एव दस्युदलस्य आगमनं श्रुत्वा कुटीस्वामी अतीव व्याकुलः अजायत।
en_dmt: "After a short time, having heard of the arrival of a band of robbers, the owner of the hut became very agitated.  "

text: पुत्र्याः विवाहार्थं सञ्चितं धनं यदि दस्यवः नेष्यन्ति, तर्हि सः किं करिष्यति? व्यवसायिनः परामर्शेन सः स्वीयं धनं कुटीराङ्गणे एव गर्तं खनित्वा तस्मिन् गोपितवान्।
en_dmt: "If bandits carry away the wealth accumulated for the daughter's marriage, then what will he do? On the advice of a merchant, he hid his wealth in the courtyard of his hut by digging a pit.  "

text: उपस्थिताः दस्यवः तान् स्वीयं धनं स्वयम् एव समर्पयितुम् आदिष्टवन्तः।
en_dmt: "The robbers arrived and ordered them to hand over their own wealth themselves.  "

text: व्यवसायी गर्तगुप्तं धनं समकेतयत।
en_dmt: "The merchant suspected that wealth was hidden in a pit.  "

text: तद्धनं गृहीत्वा निर्गतेषु दस्युषु व्यवसायी मेषपालं स्वकीयां धनपोट्टलिकां निःसार्य अवोचत्- "बन्धो! त्वम् इतः दस्युभिः नीतं धनराशिं गृहाण, ततः द्विगुणितं च मत्पक्षतः तुभ्यम् अहं पुत्रीविवाहाय ददामि।"
en_dmt: "When the robbers had taken the money and left, the merchant took out his own money bag and said to the shepherd, \"Friend! Take this amount of money that was taken away by the robbers, and then I will give you twice as much from my side for your daughter's wedding.\"  "

text: मेषपालपरिवारः तस्य अनेन व्यवहारेण अतीव सन्तुष्टः समजायत इति।
en_dmt: "The shepherd's family became very pleased with his behavior.  "

text: रत्नव्यवसायी कुत्र प्राप्तः?
en_dmt: "Where was the jewel merchant found?  "

text: कुटीस्वामी व्याकुलः किम् अभवत्?
en_dmt: "Why did the owner of the hut become agitated?  "

text: रत्नव्यवसायिनः परामर्शेन सः किं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "What did he do on the advice of the jeweler (ratnavyavasāyin)?  "

text: दस्यवः किम् अकुर्वन्?
en_dmt: "What did the robbers do?  "

text: रत्नव्यवसायी कुटीस्वामिनं कथं सन्तुष्टं कृतवान्?
en_dmt: "How did the jewel merchant satisfy the owner of the hut?  "

text: क्षुत्पिपासे न कस्य हि ?
en_dmt: "Hunger and thirst, to whom do they not [belong]?  "

text: क्षुत्तृषौ व्याप्नुतः सर्वान्, सुलभं तच्छान्ति साधनम्। स्पर्शो जातिविशेषस्य, न तद्दूषयते क्वचित्॥
en_dmt: "Hunger and thirst pervade all; the means to pacify them are easily obtained. Contact with a particular class does not defile it anywhere.  "

text: अहं रैलयात्रां कुर्वन् आसम्।
en_dmt: "I was traveling by train.  "

text: अयम् आसीत् घोरग्रीष्मसमयः।
en_dmt: "This was a terrible summer season. (ayam āsīt ghoragrīṣmasamayaḥ)  "

text: मम सम्मुखस्थे पीठे एका वृद्धा स्वपौत्रेण सह उपविष्टा अभूत्।
en_dmt: "On the seat in front of me, an old woman was sitting with her grandson.  "

text: पौत्रः द्वित्रवर्षीयः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "The grandson was two or three years old.  "

text: तृषा व्याकुलः सः यदा उच्चैः उच्चैः क्रन्दितुं प्रवृत्तः, तदा सम्पूर्णः एव प्रकोष्ठस्थः जनः असुविधाम् अन्वभवत्।
en_dmt: "When, tormented by thirst, he began to cry out louder and louder, then the entire roomful of people felt discomfort.  "

text: तत्र अन्या अपि महिला आसीत्।
en_dmt: "There, another woman was also present.  "

text: तस्याः पार्श्वे जलम् अविद्यत।
en_dmt: "Near her, water was found.  "

text: वृद्धा ततःएव आदाय पौत्रं जलम् अपाययत्।
en_dmt: "Then the old woman, taking her grandson from there, gave him water to drink.  "

text: अधुना सः प्रसन्नः आसीत्।
en_dmt: "Now he was pleased. (adhunā saḥ prasannaḥ āsīt).  "

text: पश्चात् तस्याः जलदात्र्याः मुखात् इदं ज्ञात्वा यत् सा हरिजनजातीया अस्ति, वृद्धा अप्रसन्ना सती पौत्रस्य मुखे अङ्गुलिं निक्षिप्य पीतजलस्य वमनं कारितवती।
en_dmt: "After learning from the water-carrier's mouth that she was of the Harijana caste, the displeased old woman put her finger in her grandson's mouth and made him vomit the water he had drunk.  "

text: इदं दृष्ट्वा अहम् एव किम्? अन्ये अपि प्रकोष्ठस्थाः सर्वे जनाः वृद्धायाः इदम् आचरणम् अच्छं नैव अमन्यन्त इति।
en_dmt: "Having seen this, not only I, but all the people in the chamber did not consider this behavior of the old woman to be good.  "

text: तृषाव्याकुलं पौत्रं वृद्धा कुतः जलम् आदाय अपाययत्?
en_dmt: "Where did the old woman get water to give to her grandson who was distressed by thirst?  "

text: पुनः तस्य एव जलस्य वृद्धा वमनं किं कारितवती?
en_dmt: "Then, why did the old woman cause her to vomit up that same water again?  "

text: किं वृद्धायाः इदम् आचरणं प्रशंसनीयम् आसीत्?
en_dmt: "Was this conduct of the old woman praiseworthy?  "

text: किं क्षुत्पिपासयोः शान्तिकारकं साधनं जातिविशेषस्य स्पर्शेन दूषितं भवति?
en_dmt: "Does a means of pacifying hunger and thirst become contaminated by the touch of someone of a particular caste?  "

text: इयं कथा कीदृशं सन्देशं ददाति?
en_dmt: "What message does this story give?  "

text: सार्वजनिककार्ये धनविनियोगलाभः
en_dmt: "Profit from investing wealth in public works.  "

text: सार्वजनिककार्ये यः, स्वं धनं विनियोजयेत्। यशस्तस्य चिरं तिष्ठेद् धनं वर्धेत् सन्ततम्॥
en_dmt: "He who employs his own wealth in public works, his fame will endure, and his wealth will continuously increase.  "

text: एकजनः कार्पासव्यवसाये आशातीतं धनम् उपार्जितवान्।
en_dmt: "One man earned unexpected wealth in the cotton trade.  "

text: कस्मिंश्चित् सार्वजनिककार्ये सः तं धनराशिं विनियोजयितुम् इच्छति स्म।
en_dmt: "He wanted to invest that sum of money in some public work.  "

text: सर्वान् वसतिवासिनः एकत्र कृत्वा आत्मनः मन्तव्यं प्रकटितवान्।
en_dmt: "Having gathered all the inhabitants, he revealed his opinion.  "

text: कश्चित् मन्दिरं, कश्चित् मस्जिदं, कश्चित् गिरिजागृहं, कश्चित् चिकित्सालयं, कश्चित् वाचनालयम्, कश्चित् विद्यालयं, कश्चित् धर्मशालां, कश्चित् जलशालां, कश्चित् यज्ञशालां, कश्चित्त् चित्रशालां यस्मै यद् रोचते स्म तदेव निर्मातुं सः स्वं परामर्शं दत्तवान्।
en_dmt: "Someone [built] a temple (mandiraṃ), someone [built] a mosque (masjidaṃ), someone [built] a church (girijāgṛhaṃ), someone [built] a hospital (cikitsālayaṃ), someone [built] a library (vācanālayam), someone [built] a school (vidyālayaṃ), someone [built] a rest house (dharmśālāṃ), someone [built] a water fountain (jalaśālāṃ), someone [built] a place for sacrifice (yajñaśālāṃ), someone [built] an art gallery (citraśālāṃ). He gave his advice to build whatever pleased each person.  "

text: तत्र ऐकमत्यं तु कस्यचित् आसीत् एव न।
en_dmt: "But there was definitely no consensus there for anyone.  "

text: अन्ते जनः स्वयम् एव सुविचार्य सुन्दरम् एकं सुलभं शौचालयं निर्मापितवान् यस्य उपयोगं विना लिङ्गजातिधर्मसम्प्रदायवयोभाषादिभेदं सर्वथा निःशुल्करूपे अद्यापि सर्वे वसतिवासिनः कुर्वन्ति इति।
en_dmt: "In the end, the people themselves, having carefully considered, constructed a beautiful and easily accessible toilet, which, without distinction of gender, caste, religion, community, age, language, etc., is still used completely free of charge by all residents today.  "

text: व्यवसायी स्वं धनराशिं कुत्र विनियोजयितुम् इच्छति स्म?
en_dmt: "Where did the merchant want to invest his own wealth?  "

text: वसतिवासिनः तं किं निर्दिष्टवन्तः?
en_dmt: "What did the dwelling-residents point out to him?  "

text: अन्ते व्यवसायी स्वं धनराशिं कुत्र विनियोजितवान्?
en_dmt: "In the end, where did the businessman invest his own wealth?  "

text: अस्य लाभः कस्मै मिलितः?
en_dmt: "To whom was this gain obtained?  "

text: कस्य यशः चिरं तिष्ठति?
en_dmt: "Whose glory remains long?  "
